loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, celibataire avec deux enfants dont l'age varie entre 17 et 21 ans. Elle se lance dans la papeterie et vente des fournitures scolaires  très jeune , quand elle arrête ses etudes en classe de 1ere.

Elle a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de prêts, elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Avec ce quatrième prêt , elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise tel que des cartons de papiers rame, des cartons de cahiers, des stylos de tous genre, des feutres...
Son étalage est située non loin des bureaux administratifs et des differents écoles primaires , collèges et instituts techniques, il a des clients très fidèles depuis des années qui bénéficient de ses services et qui prennent parfois a crédits.
Très motivée,avec un bon caractère , elle veut aller loin et elle est entrain de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses deux enfants qui sont déjà a l'université.
texts.en:
This client, 41 and single, has two children aged 17 and 21. She got into selling office supplies and such at a very young age, when she left off her studies in high school.  

She has already received several loans, has reimbursed them successfully, and put aside considerable savings. With this fourth loan, she is going to expand her stock of merchandise, for example, boxes of paper, cartons of notebooks, pens of all sorts and felt-tip pens, etc. 

She displays her wares not far from the administrative offices and various primary school, middle schools, and technology institutes, and she has customers who have been buying from her for years and who sometimes buy on credit. 

Very motivated and possessing a good character, she means to go far and she is taking over paying education fees for her two children who are already at university.

loans.use: Purchasing reams of paper, notebooks, ballpoint pens, paints, markers, file folders, and boxes of pencils.

loans.name: Moses Ooko

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has 2 children ages 2 and 6. He describes himself to be jovial, respectful, and God fearing. He operates a milk sales business where he sells milk to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a refrigerator to keep milk fresh. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a refrigerator to keep milk fresh all day. His business goal is to grow it and open a milk depot from which he will be selling milk to retailers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will construct a premises from which he will be running his business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for milk preservation.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive solo, ya que su papá falleció cuando Carlos tenía 26 años de edad  y su mamá se traslado a otra ciudad para cuidar a su otra hija soltera.

Él es técnico en computación, y se dedica a dar clases de computación, en un centro escolar de su comunidad. En las tardes él repara computadoras, y tiene un pequeño negocio de fotocopias, además de eso los fines de semana toma videos y fotografías en eventos como quince años, bodas, etc. Carlos es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, y lo hace porque le gusta ayudar a las demás personas, se siente muy feliz y orgulloso de lo que hace.

Carlos sueña con tener su propio negocio de librería, filmación de videos y su taller de reparación de computadoras. Para realizar las compras, él aborda un autobús desde su comunidad hasta el centro, el viaje dura una hora y luego regresa a su casa.

El préstamo solicitado a Fundación Campo, será invertido en la compra: de repuestos para la fotocopiadora, papel boom, tonel, acetato, tinta negra y de colores; además, para mejorar el equipo de filmación de videos, que él mismo edita; para comprar baterías y memoria interna. De esta manera, realizara sus trabajos más rápidos y de mejor calidad.

Al reparar su equipo de fotocopias,  les brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes, mas que se acercan las fechas de los exámenes finales de la escuela, y es él quien saca todas las copias. Así él podrá obtener ganancias que le ayuden a cumplir su sueño, por lo que, ahorrara lo mas que pueda, para tener su propio negocio de librería, filmación de videos y su taller de reparación y venta de computadoras, además, desea encontrar una joven y casarse para formar una familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, is single and lives alone since his father died when Carlos was 26 years old.  His mother moved to another city to care for her single daughter.

He is a computer technician and teaches computer classes at a school in his community.  In the afternoons he repairs computers and has a small photocopy business.  On weekends he takes videos and photographs at events such as debutante balls and weddings.  He is very dedicated to his work and does it because he likes to help other people.  He is happy and takes pride in what he does.

Carlos would like to have his own business with a bookstore, video filming and computer repair workshop. To make his purchases he must take a bus from his community into the city.  The trip is about an hour long and he then returns home.

The loan he has requested through Fundación Campo will be used to buy photocopier spare parts, paper, toner, acetate, black and colored ink and better video filming equipment.  He also wants to buy batteries and a hard drive.  This is so he can do his work more quickly and with better quality.

By repairing his photocopier he can give his customers beter service.  And the dates for final school exams are approaching so there will be more business.  In this way he can earn enough to reach his goal by saving everything he can to have his own business of a bookstore, video filming and computer repair and sales.  He also wants to find a young woman to marry so he form a family.

loans.use: To buy photocopy spare parts, paper, toner, acetate, black and colored ink, and improve video filming and buy a hard drive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure fresh fish and ingredients to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get additional gari, charcoal, sugar and other things to sell.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es: Floriana tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Filomeno de 43 años y su adorado hijo Marco de 5 añitos, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Floriana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y hojas de coca, dependerá el empeño que le ponga en sus plantas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y maduros. Tiene 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde los vende. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores cultivos y ofrecer a mejores precios. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP; por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprar sacos de abono para fertilizar sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en: Floriana, 41 years old, is a very cheerful, hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband, Filomeno, 43, and her little son, Marco, who is 5 years old. All of her efforts in life are for Marco. The products that Floriana has managed to grow with such hard work and dedication have helped her get ahead in life. Every morning, she starts working her fields, because she knows that the quality of the care she gives her cacao, coffee, and coca plants depends on the effort she puts into them. Her favorite part of her job is taking care of her crops, and she feels really happy when she sees that they've grown large and ripened. She's been farming for four years and thinks the hardest part is transporting her harvest to the city of San Francisco to sell it. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops in order to produce better harvests and sell them at higher prices. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is hoping for your collaboration in pursuing her goals. She will use the 3,000 soles requested to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a banku (fermented corn/cassava dough) seller at Elmina. She prepares it, bags and peddles with it. The tray on her lap has some banku wrapped in transparent bags that will be sold to her customers. Fati has received a junior high education. She is divorced and has 2 children. Her business is about 5 years old. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bags and fresh fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy maize in bags and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: David Omondi

texts.en: David is a 25 year old single man. He describes himself to be strong, bold, and determined. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harassment by the local administration. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase matatus (mini-bus taxis) to continue growing his transport business for which he has a big passion.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La socia Benita es viuda, la socia cría animales menores como chanchos, cuyes, ovejas, para la venta; La socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de animales menores como cuyes 20 pares, ovejas 2 terneras, y un par de chanchos pequeños para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos; la socia desea poder comprar terrenos de cultivo y también ver a sus hijos profesionales y seguir apoyandolos en sus estudios. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de chanchos, cuyes, ovejas para la crianza y venta final.
texts.en: Benita is a widow.  She raises small farm animals like pigs, guinea pigs and sheep to sell.  She wants to use the loan to buy small farm animals like 20 pair of guinea pigs, two lambs and calves and a pair of piglets to raise, fatten up and then sell.  She wants to be able to buy farm land and to see her children become professionals and to continue supporting their schooling.  She’s asking for the loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs and sheep to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, guinea pigs and sheep to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase yams, potatoes and other foods.

loans.name: Patrick Danda

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He describes himself to be energetic, committed and determined. He operates a transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harassment by the local administration. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy new bicycles. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy additional bicycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plum oil (red oil) for her business.

loans.name: Meriy

texts.es: La socia no ha cambiado de negocio y no a  variado mucho su vida con ecepcion de que su hijo ya nació y se encuentra muy atareada con todas las obligaciones que ahora tiene, la socia esta feliz con la llegada de su hijo de 3 meses, la socia por el momento solo criara gallinas y cuyes, ella tien unos chanchos que los vendera en el mes de diciembre, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de 10 cuyes y de 20 gallinas que las comprara en 8 y 10 soles cada una y los criara y los vendera a sus clientas en 25 soles cada una, en cuanto a los cuyes ellos se reproducen rápido y es rentable. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de 20 gallinas y 10 cuyes. La socia desearía tener un negocio propio y estudiar a corto plazo pero en el momento desea seguir haciendo lo que domina y son los negocios con los animales menores y esto le vieen bien por ahora hasta que su bebe este más grande.
texts.en: Meriy is still in the same business and her life hasn't changed all that much, except that her son was born and she is very busy with all her obligations. She's very happy about the arrival of her three-month-old son. At the moment, she's only raising hens and guinea pigs. She has some pigs that she plans to sell in December. Meriy would like to use this loan to purchase 10 guinea pigs and 20 hens, which will cost 8 and 10 soles each, and raise them and sell them to customers at 25 soles apiece. Guinea pigs reproduce quickly and are profitable. Meriy would like to have a real business and study in the near future, but at the moment she wants to keep doing what she's good at, which is raising small animals. This will be a good business for her until her baby is older.

loans.use: to buy 20 hens and 10 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Moses Nyerere

texts.en: Moses is a single man. He describes himself to be quiet, humble, and persuasive. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will start a car hire service business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 41 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flora de 39 años y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Él cultiva cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que son rápidamente comprados por los mayoristas en la ciudad de San Francisco, pues conocen la calidad que produce Jorge. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad, motivo por el cual es considerado uno de los mejores agricultores de su pueblo. Considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que dañen sus plantas. Este será su  crédito número 04 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que una vez mas tendrá el apoyo de ustedes. En su banco comunal es participe y responsable. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para proteger sus cultivos de cacao, café y hojas de coca.
texts.en:
Jorge, 41, is a very hardworking, humble man living in his own house with his wife, Flora, 39, and their four children that he wants to provide a better future for.  He grows cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf that are quickly purchased by wholesales in the city of San Francisco because they are aware of the quality of Jorge’s products.  What he most enjoys about his work is cultivating the land, something he does with much affection.  He’s been in this line of work for 16 years so he’s considered to be one of the town’s best farmers because of this.  He considers the most difficult part of his work protecting his plants from pests that damage the plants.  

This will be loan #4 with MFP.  He is very happy to know that once again he will have support from you.  He is active and responsible in his communal bank.  He will use the requested 2000 soles to buy sacks of manure to protect his cocoa bean, coffee and coca leaf crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Angela es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la producción y comercialización de alimentos como: comida rápida, fritos y comida típica de la región. Desde hace unos meses su negocio ha progresado, pues las ventas han aumentado y proporcionalmente sus ingresos, sin embargo actualmente solicita un prestamos con el cual comprar insumos para la preparación de alimentos y hacer algunas adecuaciones locativas en la cocina, pues en época de fin de año las ventas y los clientes se incrementan y Angela no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir al por mayor y adecuar la cocina, es conciente que así su calidad de vida mejorará pues prestará un mejor servicio, la capacidad de producción será mayor y tendrá mas clientes satisfechos con la comida que Angela les ofrece.
texts.en: Ángela is an enterprising woman who prepares meals to sell.  She prepares fast food, fried snacks and traditional regional dishes.  Her business has been making progress the last few months because sales have increased and her income has done so proportionately too.  However, she is asking for loans at present to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and to do some improvements in her kitchen because at the end of the year the number of customers grows and sales increase and Ángela does not have the necessary capital to stock up at wholesale and to equip her kitchen.  She is conscious that her quality of life will improve because she’ll provide better service; production capacity will also be greater and she’ll have more customers satisfied with the food she offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and to do some kitchen improvements.

loans.name: Elsa Argentina

texts.es: Elsa solcitó el credito para pagar los módulos de titulación de su carrera de Administración de Empresas. Esto le permitirá crecer como persona y profesionalmente. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que la única forma de salir adelante es estudiando. El costo de la carrera ha sido un desafío para ella, el cual ha ido superando poco a poco, y para la finalización espera conseguir el crédito.
texts.en: She requested the loan to pay the costs associated with her getting her degree in Business Administration.  This will allow her to grow as a person and professionally.  She very much wants to get ahead and thinks that the only way to do so is by studying.  The cost of her career has been a challenge for her that she’s gradually overcome and now to finish it all up she hopes to get the loan.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, and 2 of them go to school. Margaret takes care of additional family members (two of her sister's children). She operates a salon from a shop on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years. Margaret works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more hair treatments and braids. Her aspiration is to buy a stand-alone dryer so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenges are off-and-on electricity and seasonality. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more braids and hair treatments.

loans.name: Sylvester Khayeka

texts.en:
Sylvester is a 29 year old married man. He has 2 children, ages 1 and 5. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road networks. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a Nissan matatu (minibus) that will be operating along the Kakamega-Kisumu route.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Hernaldo José

texts.es: Hernaldo estudia Licenciatura en Química y Farmacia, el crédito será usado para pagar los módulos del curso para poder obtener su título, por medio de su trabaj Hernaldo ha costeado los gastos de la universidad. Le inspiran a seguir adelante sus hijos, desea poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Se destaca de los demás estudiantes porque tiene la disciplina y perseverancia necesaria para la culminación de sus estudios.
texts.en: Hernaldo is getting a Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry and Pharmacy.  The loan will be used to pay costs of finalizing his degree requirements.  Hernaldo has paid his university costs through his work.  He is inspired to continue forward by his children; he wants to be able to offer them a better future.  He stands out from the rest of the students because he has the necessary discipline and perseverance to complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay his graduation costs.

loans.name: David Kitau

texts.en:
David is a 33 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. He describes himself to be quiet. He operates a livestock sales business where he sells cows and goats to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a commercial area opposite Mwingi shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy goats for resale. His business goal is to grow it and be selling cattle and goats in large numbers to various slaughterhouses within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he can educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy goats for selling.

loans.name: Carlos Patricio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años, es soltero, vive con su hermana en Atuntaqui que está a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la provincia de Imbabura. Carlos se considera una persona trabajadora, alegre, solidario y con ganas de salir adelante.

Carlos trabaja solo en la carpintería específicamente en la elaboración de muebles. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de madera y laca al por mayor, inversión que será fructífera para Carlos ya que le ayudará a tener una muy buena productividad y en un futuro buenos ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es poder adquirir nueva maquinaria ya que hoy en día se ha incrementado la tecnología, esto le ayudará a que sus productos sean de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Carlos, 25, is single living with his sister in Atuntaqui which is 15 minutes from Ibarra in Imbabura Province.  Carlos considers himself to be a hardworking, cheerful and supportive person who very much wants to get ahead.

Carlos works alone in the carpentry shop specifically making furniture.  This is the second loan he’s requested from Fodemi and he will use it to buy lumber and varnish at wholesale, an investment that will be fruitful for Carlos because it will help him increase production and in future to have good income.  His dream is to be able to acquire new machinery since technology continues moving forward; this will help his products be of better quality.

loans.use: to buy lumber and varnish at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 41 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Demetria de 41 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy temprano, Juan sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo y hacer más fértil sus tierras, para así obtener una buena cosecha. Los productos que siembra son: la hoja de coca, el café y el cacao, que son vendidos en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde tiene muchos compradores, debido a la calidad de éstos frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos dañen su salud. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP; por tanto espera una vez más de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos y seguir trabajando. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y le gusta ser participe de las reuniones que se realiza.
Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, podrá comprar plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man, 41 years old, who lives in his own house together with his wife, Demetria, 41, and his two dear children who are the reason for all of his efforts.  Juan leaves to work on his farm very early. He knows that he has to put all his efforts into making his lands more fertile in order to have a good harvest. He plants coca leaf, coffee and cacao which are sold in the city of San Francisco, where he has many buyers due to the quality of his crop.

What he likes most about his work is planting his fields and he does so with a great deal of patience. He has been doing this work for 21 years and considers that the most difficult task is fumigating his fields since he always runs the risk that the chemicals will damage his health. 

This will be his fourth loan with MFP and he hopes to secure their collaboration one more time in order to continue working and meeting his goals. He is very happy in his communal bank and he enjoys being a participant in bank meetings. With the 2,000 soles he requested he will be able to buy cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee plants.

loans.name: Lucely Janeth

texts.es:
Lucely, desde muy joven se dedico a aprender a los oficios de la confección, actualmente tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad. Mediante su microempresa de confección de ropa de hogar, se siente muy útil, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los  gastos de la familia y la educación de sus hijos.

Actualmente, con la ilusión de aprovechar la época navideña como oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, Lucely necesita un crédito, para comprar insumos con referencia al tema navideño y sacar una producción de tendidos de cama, sabanas, toallas y ropa de hogar en general. Este préstamo le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, llegar a nuevos clientelas y reinvertir en su negocio con la idea de innovar en nuevos productos y así proporcionalmente hacerlo crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucely learned to be a seamstress when she was very young.  Now she is 35 years old, married and the mother of three minor children.  Through her home linens microbusiness she feels very useful since she is able to help her husband with the family expenses and the children's education.

Right now she is excited about taking advantage of the Christmas season to expand her business.  Lucely needs a loan to buy supplies with a Christmas theme so she can make bedspreads, sheets, towels and general household linens.  This loan will enable her to increase sales and reach new customers.  She will reinvest in the business with the idea of innovation through new products, and this will expand the business proportionally and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fabric to make home linens for Christmas.

loans.name: David Mwaniki

texts.en:
David is a 36 year old married man. He has 2 children, ages 1 and 4. He describes himself to be committed and resilient. He operates a retail shop where he sells general items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase his stock of such items as sugar, flour, detergents and beverages. His business goal is to grow it into wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he can buy a van that will help in the running of the business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of general items.

loans.name: Association "dental  15" Group

texts.fr: L'Association"Dental 15" qui se compose de cinq femmes toutes mariées, est issue d'une tontine de quartier.Les femmes pratiquent le commerce de tissus et d'articles de merceirie.Elles tirent des revenus modestes de cette activité mais arrivent tout de même à satisfaire  l'essentiel de leurs besoins.Le chef du groupe (a gauche avec le papier) est mère de 5 enfants dont trois sont à l'école.Elle prend  en charge les dépenses d'habillement de ses enfants et participent souvent aussi à celles d'alimentation et de santé avec les bénéfices tirés de son commerce.Pour augmenter leur capacité, le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter diverses tissus et  articles de mercerie.Les femmes ambitionnent d'implanter chacune une cantine devant chez elle.
texts.en:
Association "Dental 15" is a group made up of five married women, who belongs to the same "tontine". They sell fabrics and notions. They make a modest earning from their businesses, but manage nonetheless to provide for most of their needs.

The group's leader (on the left in the photograph, holding a paper) is the mother of five children, out of whom three attend school. With the profits of her business, she takes care of her children's clothing expenses, and also often helps with the food and healthcare expenses.

To bolster their businesses, the members of the group are seeking a loan of XOF 250'000, in order to buy various fabrics and notions. The women all ambition to set up a small shop in front of their home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and notions

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children, and 2 of them go to school. She sells secondhand shoes on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years. Margaret works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand shoes. Her aspiration is to expand into a wholesale shop so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenges are on-and-off electricity and transportation. 

She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Margaret's monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand shoes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children, and all of them go to school. She operates a pub from a shop on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years.  Florence works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local brew. Besides this pub business she also generates additional income from selling charcoal. Her aspiration and goal is to expand into a wholesale pub so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenge is thieves and transportation. 

She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local brew.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children who both go to school. She has two additional family members (brother, sister). She operates a retail shop that she rents. She sells her products door-to-door. She has been in business for the last 2 years. Esther works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and baking flour. Her aspiration goal is to expand into a wholesale shop. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en: Rukaya, who attended junior high school, has a shop in Abura that sells slippers. She is requesting this loan because she wants to add shoes and, if possible, men’s clothing to her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and men’s clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, caustics, and wood for her soap-making business.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 23 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Diego está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Diego aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 
Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Diego es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Diego, 23, lives with his family in a village in the Sur de Costa Rica area, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The economy there is based on agriculture and fishing, and they grow tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and raise cattle.
Diego is requesting a loan of six hundred thousand colons to treat his crops with fertilizer and fungicides to protect the bean seedlings since this is a reliable and sustainable crop.  Diego will increase the fertility of his fields with the fertilizer to absorb different nutritional elements and the fungicides will prevent mushrooms from showing up on his fields so that his customers won’t run the risk of contracting a disease from the fungi.

He will be able to offer quality products to his customers and it will help him reach the sales goal that he has for each month.  And also it will help him with his obligations and expenses so that he can get his big family ahead.
Diego is a member of the La Danta SA communal bank, one of the 150 sections of communal financing in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en: Ayishetu, a divorced mother of two children, has been selling second-hand clothes and provisions in Abura for 15 years. Her income is used to take care of her family. Ayishetu will use this loan to purchase provisions for her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for her store.

loans.name: Silvia Jeannette

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo.

Ella se dedica, a las actividades de fertilización y limpieza de su plantación de árboles frutales: jocote, naranjas, aguacates, zapotes y café. Ya tiene seis años de dedicarse a esto, ella lo aprendió gracias al esfuerzo de su mamá, quien inicio este cultivo y la venta de frutas.

Silvia debe caminar a pie un kilómetro, hacia un desvió y abordar un autobús, para ir a comprar los insumos, para el regreso a su casa, debe pagar $3.00 dólares a una mototaxi, para que la lleve a su casa con los productos.

El préstamo será invertido, en la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas, con el objetivo de obtener una buena producción de frutas y también para pago de las labores de limpieza y fertilización. De esta forma, ella recibirá un mejor ingreso, lo cual le servirá para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En un futuro Maria, planea diversificar la variedad de árboles frutales, pare tener una mayor producción y aumentar la fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia is 26 years old and the single mother of a son.

She has a fruit plantation where she grows jocotes (plum), oranges, avocados, zapotes (sapote plum) and coffee.  She has been in business for six years and learned the trade from her mother grew and sold fruit.

Silvia must walk a kilometer to catch the bus to go buy supplies.  For the return trip she has to pay $3.00 to take a motortaxi and transport the products home.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and fungicides for better fruit production and also to pay for cleaning and fertilizing worker costs.  In this manner she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.  In the future Silvia plans to diversify the variety of her fruit trees for better production and increased income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fungicides for fruit trees.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La Sra. Hilaria es madre soltera tiene 02 hijos, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora que día a día trabaja para sacar adelante su familia; ella se dedica a venta de caña de azúcar en su triciclo por las calles de la ciudad de Camaná - Arequipa, tiene en esta ocupación mas de 1 año y gana S/. 200 nuevos soles semanales aproximadamente. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de más caña de azúcar para así aumentar sus ventas. Su principal sueño es tener su puesto de venta en el mercado central de Camaná y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella esta muy agradecida con el crédito otorgado y la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en: Ms. Hilaria is a single mother of two children and a very hard-working woman who struggles daily to help her family get ahead.  She sells sugar cane from a tricycle cart in the streets of the city of Camaná - Arequipa.  She has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 200 PEN a week.  She plans to use the loan to buy more sugar cane to increase sales.  Her main goal is to have a stall at the central market in Camaná and to help her children become professionals.  She is very grateful for the loan and the confidence shown in her.

loans.use: To buy goods (sugar cane) to sell.

loans.name: Association "dental 4" Group

texts.fr: Les quatres femmes membres de l'association "Dental 4" s'activent toutes dans le commerce de produits de parfumerie.Elles achètent en gros des parfums , de l'encens et des produits divers qu'elles revendent en détail sur des tables installées au  marché situé non loin de leurs domiciles.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus qui sont utilisés dans la prise en charge de leurs besoins personnels et ceux d'entretien de leurs familles respectives.Le chef du groupe (main lévée) est mariée et mère de quatres enfants.Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'alimentation et des frais de scolarité de leurs enfants. Le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des parfums, de l'encens et des produits divers.Elles ambitionnent d'élargir leurs activités en implantant des cantines au marché central de leur localité.
texts.en:
The four women of Association "Dental 4" all sell perfumery products. They buy perfumes, incense, and various other products wholesale, and retail them on stalls at a market not far from their homes.

The income they make from their businesses is used to provide for themselves and their respective families.

The group's leader (raising her hand in the photograph) is married and the mother of four children. She helps her husband pay their children's school expenses.

The groups is seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 to buy perfumes, incense, and various other products. They ambition to expand their businesses by setting up "cantines" (small shops) at the central market in their village.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense, and various other products

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is into hairdressing at Abura. Faustina has received junior high education. She is married to a security person. Faustina has been a hairdresser for 10 years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more hair products. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop and also to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: to buy more hair products.

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: Rakia is married and has four children. Rakia cooks "wakye"  (a dish composed of cooked beans and rice) at Abura, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. Rakia will use the loan to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rakia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure more provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Eufemia Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Eufemia es una mujer casada, madre D. 6 hijos ya todos mayores D. edad e independientes; la Sra. Eufemia es una mujer que a su edad sigue luchando por salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras en el mercado central D. Camaná, ya lleva en este negocio mas D. 10 años, escogió este tipo D. trabajo porque sus familiares hace 25 años llevan trabajando en el mismo negocio. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la ampliación D. su negocio y así poder progresar mucho más. Su principal sueño D. la Sra. Eufemia es ver a todos sus nietos profesionales. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que ello contribuye a su desarrollo comercial.
texts.en: Mrs. Eufemia is married and the mother of six children, all of whom are adults and independent.  At her age, Eufemia continues to struggle to get ahead selling vegetables at the central market in Camaná.  She has been in business for over ten years.  The reason she chose this type of work was that her family has been in the same business for 25 years.  The loan she has requested will be used to expand her business so she can progress even further.  Eufemia's main goal is to see all her grandchildren become professionals.  She is very grateful for the loan since it will contribute to her commercial development.

loans.use: To buy goods (fruit and vegetables) to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child who goes to school. She has one additional family member. She sells "matooke" (green bananas) on a retail basis at the market. She has been in business for the last five years. 

Mabel works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses and also to be a wholesaler. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua makes millet porridge for sale at Abura. To prepare her porridge, she first gets her millet, removes unwanted particles from it, and washes it.  She adds local spices such as ginger and pepper to taste.  She sends the millet to the mill to be milled into powder.  After returning from the mill, she adds water to the resulting flour to make dough. She leaves it for a couple of hours before using the dough to make porridge.

She heats water to a boiling point and mixes the dough into the water to get a porridge-like consistency. She gradually pours the dough into the heated water stirring continuously to prevent it from forming lumps. The porridge only has to cook for a couple of minutes and then it is ready to be served. Millet porridge goes with bread of any kind and fried doughnuts. 

Ekua is married to a police officer and they are blessed with four children.  Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize and millet and spices to make porridge.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and millet and spices to make porridge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare "banku" and "kenkey".

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier. Elle a 03 enfants. 
Abra travaille comme profession depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place après achat à ANIE. Elle travaille avec 01 personne.
Abra a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs, du haricot et des sacs de charbons.
texts.en:
Abra is a 40 year-old lady who is married to a carpenter with whom she has three children. 
She has worked for a living since 2008. She buys cereals from ANIE and sells them to her customers from an area near her home. She works with one other person. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase corn, beans and bags of coal.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu is a fish monger at Abura. She also sells groceries. She has been through junior high school. She is a widow and has six children. She has been in this business for 20 years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy groceries for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba. 

Leonarda tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urcos y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Leonarda es la venta de comida en el mercado. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y bidones de aceite. 

Leonarda agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the "New Hope of Ollantaytambo" communal bank. The members meet every thirty days in the city of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba.

Leonarda is 37 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has three children. She was born in the city of Urcos, and she lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where she works. Leonarda's main work is selling food in the market. She has already been doing this for 12 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her job.

This time Leonarda needs the loan to purchase more supplies, for example, bags of rice and sugar and bottles of oil.

Leonarda is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies, for example, bags of rice and sugar and bottles of oil

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a small hairdressing business on her porch at Abura in Cape Coast. Efua has received junior high level of education.  She is married to a driver.  The income she makes from her sales is used to help feed the home. Her loan will be used to buy hair products to use on customers' hair. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a dryer.

loans.use: to buy hair products to use on customers' hair.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Socorro

texts.es: A sus 52 años de edad Cecilia es una mujer y madre emprendedora que siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos, desde hace algún tiempo Cecilia tiene un negocio donde vende helados y comidas, y aunque es pequeño hoy sueña con verlo crecer y progresar, para ello quiere comprar un vehículo donde transportar estos alimentos y vender sus productos de una manera más formal, más cómoda, y con más espacio que le permita producir en mayor cantidad, sin embargo Cecilia no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacer las adecuaciones que su negocio necesita para el progreso, como: comprar ese vehículo de transporte que es un carro donde llevar y exhibir la comida, comprar insumos para la preparación de alimentos y adecuar espacialmente su negocio; por lo cual hoy solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda ayudarle a su hijo económicamente con sus estudios, ya que el crédito le permitirá incrementar notablemente sus ingresos y su calidad de vida mejorará proporcionalmente.
texts.en: At 52 years old, Cecilia is an enterprising woman and mother who has always been concerned about the well-being of her 3 children. For some time now, Cecilia has been operating a business selling food and ice cream. Although it is small today, she dreams of seeing it grow and make progress. For this reason, she wants to buy a vehicle to transport her food and sell her products in a more formal and convenient manner. More space will also allow her to produce in greater quantity. However, Cecilia does not have the necessary capital to make the necessary improvements to her business in order to make progress, such as: buying this transport vehicle, which is a cart she will use to transport and display the food; buying supplies to prepare food; and making improvements to her business location. Because of this, today she is requesting a loan which will allow her to help her son economically with his studies, since the loan will permit her to increase her income significantly, and her quality of life will improve accordingly.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing food, buy a food cart and make improvements to her business location.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marisol  es casada, tiene 4  hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Unión por el Progreso” grupo  conformado por 8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Marisol  trabaja desD. hace   2 años en casa,  realizando las labores D. limpieza, cocina y lavado este trabajo surge porque  el sueldo D. su esposo que es taxista  no alcanzaba  para cubrir los gastos básicos , educación, alimentación, servicios, Marisol nos cuenta que su motivación para salir adelante son sus hijos , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van al colegio  y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una  mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y así poder vender helado, gaseosas, marcianos . Sabemos que Marisol cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Marisol is married and has 4 school-aged children. Currently, she is a member of the "Unión por el Progreso" ("Union for Progress") communal bank, which is maD. up of 8 members who dedicate themselves to various business activities. Marisol has been a domestic worker for two years, doing cleaning, cooking, and washing. This job came about because her husband's salary as a taxi driver did not cover their basic costs, such as education, food, and services. Marisol tells us that her motivation to move ahead is her children - thanks to her effort and dedication, she has succeeded in bringing in more money, her children go to high school, and, above all, her family has a better quality of life. With the goal of continuing to grow, she has asked for a new loan to purchase a refrigerator so she can sell ice cream, soft drinks, and popsicles. We know that Marisol will reach her goals with much work and effort, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et est mère de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. L’ainé des enfants a 30 ans et le benjamin 23 ans.  
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1991. Elle achète et revend des céréales genres maïs, haricot, du charbon et des ignames à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Lomé. 
Akoua a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, de céréales et d’ignames. Elle  pense réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans la pérennisation de son activité.  
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir sa clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins alimentaires, éducatifs et sanitaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 54-year old woman. She is married to a pensioner and is mother to three children, one of whom is studying. The eldest of her children is 30 years old and the youngest 23 years old. 

Akoua has been working as a retailer since 1991. She buys and sells cereals such as rice, beans, as well as charcoal and yams, to everyone from her home. She gets her supplies from the towns surrounding Lomé.

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy sacks of charcoal, cereals and yams. She is thinking of reinvesting supplementary profits in order to sustain her busness. In coming years, she would like to expand her customer base. She says that with the profits she is planning to contribute to her family's nutritional, educational and health needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married and has six children. She has been through junior high school. She sells wakye at Abura. Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish colour. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender enough to eat.

Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari (manioc couscous), salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish, or meat.

Salamatu's husband is a mason. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Salamatu will use the loan to purchase rice, beans and other items to cook to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and other items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of them  go to school. She also cares for her father. She operates a retail shop. She sells her products in a rented shop. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, salt and soap. 

Her aspiration for her business is to grow it into a wholesale shop and also to build rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and soap.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi-moto et a 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier enfant a 15 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.
Amivi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003.  Elle achète et revend des pagnes à toutes personnes comme ambulante à Lomé. Elle achète ces pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. 
Amivi a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes destinés à la vente. Elle prévoit agrandir son activité avec ses profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amivi voudrait diversifier sa marchandise. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en: Amivi is a 40 year old lady who is married to a motorbike taxi driver. They have two children, both of whom have attended school. The children are 12 and 15 years old. She has worked in retail since 2003. She buys and sells wax cloths (pagnes) via door-to-door sales to a varied customer base around Lomé. She buys these cloths from Lomé's main market. She is seeking a second loan from WAGES in order to purchase cloths for retail sale. She aims to use her projected higher profits to grow the business. In future Amivi would like to diversify her product range. She aims to use her profits to purchase food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (colourful wax cloths)

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
La señora Ana, tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada con cuatro hijos.

Ella se dedica a trabajar en compañía D. su esposo, en las actividades D. cultivo D. hortalizas: pepino, chile, tomate y granos básicos: maíz y fríjol. Tiene 16 años D. realizar estas actividades, desD. muy joven ha ayudado a sus padres y gracias a ellos conoce bien como desarrollarlas. 

Ana debe viajar en autobús, durante seis kilómetros, para ir a comprar los insumos, para el regreso a su casa, debe esperar ya que el autobús solo hace tres viajes al día. 

El préstamo será invertido, en la compra D. fertilizantes y fungicidas, que serán utilizados en sus cultivos, para obtener una mejor producción D. hortalizas y D. granos básicos. También servirá para pago D. mantenimiento D. los mismos. 

D. esta forma, ella aumentara sus ingresos, lo cual mejorara la calidad D. vida D. su familia. En un futuro Ana junto con su esposo, planean aumentar la variedad D. hortalizas y cultivar: coliflor, repollo, entre otros más. Y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana, 41, is married and has four children.

She and her husband grow vegetables such as cucumber, chili pepper, tomato and basic grains: corn and beans.  For sixteen years she has been in this business.  As a young girl she helped her parents and learned how to take good care of the crops.

To buy farm supplies Ana must take a bus six kilometers.  For the return trip she has to wait for the bus which only makes the trip three times a day.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and fungiciD. for the crops to improve vegetable and grain production.  It will also help pay for crop maintenance.

She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's lifestyle.  In the future Ana and her husband want to increase the variety of vegetables to incluD.: cauliflower and cabbage, among other items, to increase income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fungicide for her crops.

loans.name: Ayimevo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIMEVO 1 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Christine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Christine est âgée de 51 ans et est une veuve. Christine a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés, mais un reste encore à sa charge. Christine vit seule avec son enfant à charge. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et subvenir aux besoins de son enfant, Christine mène une activité de vente de maïs dans son quartier, depuis une dizaine d'année. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Christine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIMEVO 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ayimevo 1 group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Christine, is the lady who has her hand raised in the photo. It is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé with a view to increasing their business volume. 

Christine is 51 years old and a widow. She has two children who have both been to school but one remains in her care. She lives with her one dependant child. Christine did not go to school. In order to provide for her own needs and her child's, she has been selling rice in her neighborhood for the past ten years or so. With the aim of strengthening her activity and better responding to customer demand, Christine wants to increase her stock. In order to do this, she and the other members of the Ayimevo 1 group are requesting a third loan from Alidé. The first two loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et a un enfant de 8 ans scolarisé.  
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001.  Elle achète et revend des pagnes, des sacs et des chaussures à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Elle achète ses produits au grand marché de Lomé. 
Akossiwa est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et vient encore de bénéficier de son quatrième crédit afin d’acheter des pagnes, des sacs et des chaussures destinées à la vente. Elle prévoit diversifier sa marchandise avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akossiwa voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  contribuer aux besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 35-year old woman, who is married to a trader and has an eight-year old child who is at school. She has been working as a retailer since 2001. She buys and sells "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric), bags and shoes to all sorts of people in her shop. She buys her products at Lomé's Grand Market.

Akossiwa is an old customer of WAGES and has just been granted her fourth loan to buy "pagnes", bags and shoes for resalte. She is planning to diversify her merchandise with the additional profits she makes from her business. In coming years, she would like to expand her business and she says that with the profits she is planning to contribute to her family's nutritional needs.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes", bags and shoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Margarita tiene 54 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Margarita es la venta de bebidas como por ejemplo cerveza, gaseosas, vinos, rones y agua mineral. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Margarita requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo cerveza, gaseosas y agua mineral. 

Margarita agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” (New Hope of Ollantaytambo) and the members conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 54 years old and was born in the city of Ollantaytambo. Margarita lives in the city where she was born and now conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling beverages such as beer, sodas, wine, rum, and mineral water. Margarita has been in this business for 15 years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy more merchandise such as beer, sodas, and mineral water.

Margarita appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, and mineral water.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and none of her children goes to school. She has two additional family members (a daughter with her child). She sells second-hand clothes on a retail basis. She sells her products at the market. 

Madina has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. Her other source of income is a little restaurant. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her goals are to see her business grow big and start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land to build rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic dishes and buckets  for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella vende gallinas en los diferentes mercados de Urubamba, ella vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de  gallinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas y alimentos para las gallinas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 49 years old, married, and has two children. Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals. She sells chickens at the different markets in Urubamba from 8am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to move her children forward. Rosa wants to expand and improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and poultry feed.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Pinissam

texts.fr:
Pinissam est une femme âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un étudiant et a un enfant de 6 ans scolarisé.  
Pinissam travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009.Elle fait la restauration de plats alimentaires accompagnée de la vente des boissons de brasserie  dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et à la brasserie de Lomé. 
Pinissam a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin de renforcer sa restauration et la vente les boissons. 
Dans les prochaines années, Pinissam aimerait devenir une grossiste des boissons de brasserie et d’alimentation générale.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer au bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Pinissam is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a student and has a 6-year-old child attending school.

She has been working as a retail merchant since 2009. In her shop she sells food preparations accompanied by beverages. She gets her supplies from the great market and the brewery of Lomé.

Pinissam requested a second credit from WAGES to strengthen her activities preparing food and selling beverages.

In coming years, she would like to become a wholesaler of brewery and general food products. She said that with the profits she plans to contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: Buy beverages

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de cinq enfants. Les trois sont des élèves. Elle exrece le commerce de tissus et de produits de mercerie qu'elle vend en détails après s'être approvisionnée dans les pays limitrophes ou les prix sont moins chers.Son activité lui rapporte des bénéfices très consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et d'appuyer même son mari dans l'entretien de la famille.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce en cette veille de fete ou la demande est très forte, elle sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus de diverses qualités et des articles de mercerie.Son ambition est de s'engager un jour dans l'import- export.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman with five children.  Three of her children are in school.  Her business is selling fabrics and sewing supplies which she sells retail after stocking up in neighboring countries where the prices are lower.  Her business makes her very consistent profits which allow her to support herself and support her husband in providing for their family.  In order to increase her business on this holiday eve when demand is very high, she is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy different quality fabrics and sewing supplies.  Her ambition is to one day start working in import - export.

loans.use: to buy different quality fabrics and sewing supplies

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela tiene 67 años de edad y vive en una aldea de Choloma. Ella ha estado felizmente casada con su esposo José por los últimos 42 años. La pareja tiene 6 hijos mayores. Actualmente vive un hijo y la madre de Graciela con la pareja. Graciela y su hijo sostienen económicamente al hogar. 

Graciela ha ganado la vida como diseñadora. Ella ha dedicado 30 años a este oficio. Antes trabajaba en una casa de modas pero decidió empezar algo propio para poder apoyar su familia. Ella quería dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Lo logré, dado sus esfuerzos en el negocio y a través de financiamiento que ella consiguió para ampliarlo. Ya está en el cuarto ciclo solicitando un préstamo de L5000 para la compra de tela, hilos, zippers y botones para poder continuar elaborando prendas como pantalones, faldas y vestidos. 

Además de educar a sus hijos, Graciela logré tener una casa propia. Ahora los desafíos que enfrenta ella son el cuidado de su madre y su esposo. José ya es minusválido y no puede trabajar como antes y la madre de Graciela está muy viejita. Espera que su negocio continúe siendo un éxito para poder cubrir  sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Graciela, age 67, lives in the village of Cholomo.  She has been happily married to her husband, José, for the last 42 years. The couple has six grown children.  One of her children and Graciela’s mother currently live with the couple.  Graciela and her son financially support the household.

Graciela has made a living as a designer.  She has devoted herself to this profession for 30 years.  She used to work in a fashion house, but she decided to start something of her own in order to be able to support her family.  She wanted to give her children a good education.  She achieved this through her efforts in the business and the loans that she got in order to expand her business.

She is now in her fourth cycle, and she is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons in order to be able to continue making garments like pants, skirts, and dresses.

In addition to educating her children, Graciela managed to have her own house.  The challenges that she now faces are taking care of her mother and her husband.  José is now disabled, and he is not able to work as he previously did.  Graciela’s mother is very old.

She hopes that her business continues being successful in order to be able to cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora surge gracias a la ayuda D. otro comité que está trabajando en ese lugar. Actualmente está integrado por 17 mujeres, las cuales se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas, en un sentido integral, es decir, tanto en lo económico como en lo personal.
La Sra. Ignacia, presidenta del grupo, está domiciliada en la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, está casada, tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas D. todo tipo, como ser cervezas, whiskys, vinos, energizantes y otros. Comenta que tiene muchas ventas, en especial los fines D. semana, que es cuando tiene más salida sus productos. Por medio D. su esfuerzo y trabajo, ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y manutención D. la familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, whiskys, vinos, energizantes y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y D. esa forma ofrecer más variedades a los clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Maria Auxiliadora  exists thanks to the help of another communal bank that is working in the area. Currently it consists of 17 women, who set as their main objective the growth of each one of them, in a holistic sense, personally as well as economically. 

Sra. Ignacia, president of the group, lives in the city of San Lorenzo. She is married and has 2 children. She sells all kinds of drinks such as beer, whisky, wine, energy drinks and others. She tells us that she has many sales especally at the weekends which is when she has the biggest turnover. Through her hard work and effort, she has been able to get ahead and help with the household expenses and support of her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy beer, whisky, wine, energy drinks and others, with which to stock her business and in this way offer her clients more variety.

loans.use: to buy beer, whisky, wines, energy drinks and others

loans.name: Marizela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marizela; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría chanchos, pollos y cuyes y también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y hortalizas y luego los vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y también quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de terreno de. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Marizela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. Marizela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also has a plot of land on which she grows corn, potatoes, and vegetables that she eventually sells at the market in Urubamba. Marizela works from 7am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to help her child move forward. She wants to expand her business of raising animals and also improve her land, so she is requesting a loan to buy animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, as well as seeds and fertilizers.

Marizela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr:
Djatougbé est une femme âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et est mère de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. L’aine de la famille a 33 ans et le benjamin 17 ans. 
Djatougbé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vent des produits d’alimentation générale et des denrées de premières nécessités genres tomates fraîche, oignons, légumes et autres à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Elle travaille seule sur son activité. 
Djatougbé a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales et les denrées de première nécessité destinées à la vente. Elle veut réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans la pérennisation de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Djatougbé voudrait agrandir  son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer à la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Djatougbé is a 55 year-old woman. She is married to a retiree and has three children, one of which goes to school. The oldest is 33 years old and the youngest 17.
Djatougbé has been working as a retailer since 1999. She sells groceries and first necessity products such as fresh tomatoes, onions, vegetables and other products to anyone in her shop. She works alone in her store.
Djatougbé requested her second loan from WAGES to purchase groceries and first-necessity goods intended for resale. She wants to reinvest extra profits to strengthen her business.
In the coming years, Djatougbé would like to grow her business. She says that with the profits, she is planning on contributing to children’s education costs.

loans.use: to buy produce (fresh tomatoes, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes  for her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Antonieta tiene 37 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Santa Teresa, ella vive en la ciudad Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Antonieta es la venta de comida como por ejemplo desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Antonieta tiene un pequeño mototaxi y su esposo Ever es quien brinda el servicio de transporte rural. 

En esta oportunidad Antonieta requiere el préstamo; una parte lo va utilizar para hacer mantenimiento del carro y  la otra parte va comprar gaseosas. 

Antonieta agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Antonieta is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” (New Hope of Ollantaytambo) and the members conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old and was born in the city of Santa Teresa. Antonieta lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, which is where she conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She has been in this business for five years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Antonieta also has a small motorcycle taxi and her husband Ever provides rural transportation services. She is taking the opportunity to request a loan. Part of the loan will be used to maintain the vehicle and the other part will be used to buy sodas.

Antonieta appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas and to pay for maintenance of her husband's motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
