Carmela; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y pollos, ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como gallinas y chanchos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Carmela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs and chickens. After the animals are grown and fattened, they are sold at the different fairs throughout Urubamba. Carmela works from 7am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to grow her enterprise. She is requesting a loan to buy animals at wholesale, such as chickens and pigs.

Carmela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
La formación del comité S. Librada fue gracias a la Srta. Rossana, ya que ella había contactado con la fundación paraguaya y luego de escuchar sobre el programa, formó y organizó a sus amigas y vecinas. El comité está conformado por mujeres que están emprendiendo una actividad y con el objetivo de invertir sus créditos para lograr más ganancias. Ellas están muy motivadas y demuestran interés de superación.
La Sra. Maria tiene 65 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropas, colchas, hamacas en forma ambulante. Ella comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pues recorrer por las calles para vender sus productos es muy cansador, ya que tiene que enfrentarse al sol, y a veces a la lluvia.  Sin duda es una señora destacada en el ámbito del trabajo y  la lucha continua que esto representa .
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas, colchas, hamacas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank S. Librada was formed thanks to Srta. Rossana since she contacted the Fundacion Paraguaya and after hearing about the program, organized her friends and neighbours to form the group. The group consists of women who are starting a business with the goal of investing their loans to make bigger profits. They are highly motivated and interested in exceling.

Sra. Maria is 65 years old. She is a street vendor who sells clothes, blankets and hammocks. She tells us that her work is very selfsacrificing as walking the streets to sell her products is very tiring as she has to face the sun and at times the rain. Without doubt, she is stands out when it comes to working and the constant struggle that this represents.  

She is asking for the loan to buy clothes, blankets, hammocks and other products with which to stock and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets, hammocks and other products.

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yasmina; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene terrenos de cultivo donde siembra repollo, brócoli, repollo y coliflor y luego lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Yasmina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Yasmina divides her time between her daily activities and her farming business. She has land on which she grows cabbage, broccoli, and cauliflower and then sells her products at the market in Urubamba. Yasmina works from 7am to 5pm. Through this business, she is able to move her children forward. Yasmina wants to expand and improve her farming business, so she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers in bulk.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers in bulk.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba est une femme âgée de 56 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. L’ainé a 32 ans et benjamin 24 ans 
Ayaba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale genre laits, sucres, savons et autres à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle achète ses produits au grand marché de Lomé 
Ayaba a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de nouveaux produits destinés à la vente. Elle dit vouloir diversifier sa marchandise en réinvestissant ces profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaba voudrait élargir sa clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a 56 year-old woman. She is widowed and a mother of two children; one of them goes to school. Her oldest is 32 years old and her youngest 24.
Ayaba has been working as a retailer since 2009. She buys and sells groceries such as milk, sugar, and other products; she sells from her home to various people. She purchases her products from the Grand Market in Lomé.
Ayaba requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase new groceries intended for resale. She says that she wants to diversify her products by investing this extra income in her business.
In the coming years, Ayaba would like to develop her clientele. She says that with the profits, she is planning on providing for her family’s primary needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié sans enfants. Il vit en location avec son épouse et exerce le métier de chauffeur de taxi dans sa localité.Avec les revenus générés par son véhicule, il parvient à entretenir son épouse, à se prendre en charge et à envoyer un peu d'argent à ses deux parents restés au village.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter un nouvel moteur et remplacer le vieux moteur de son taxi qui tombe souvent en panne. son ambition est d'achetr un second véhiocule.
texts.en:
The borrower is newlywed, and does not have children. He rents a place with his wife and works as a taxi driver in his town. With the revenues generated by his vehicle, he manages to provide for his wife and himself and to send some money to his parents who stayed in their village.
He is requesting a loan for 300,000 XOF to purchase a new engine and replace his taxi’s old engine, which often breaks down. His ambition is to buy a second vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veronica; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, gallinas y cuyes, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos, gallinas y cuyes al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Veronica divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She sells her animals as a traveling merchant. Veronica works from 6am to 5pm. Through her business, she has been able to move her children forward. Veronica wants to expand and improve her business of raising animals, so she is requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs wholesale.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mario Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr Mario está casado, es policía de tránsito, tiene 2 hijos es. El es propietario de una despensa la que es atendida por su esposa. Cuenta con 9 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela, lo que a la vez le genera muy buenos ingresos. 
Dice que el no se cansa de trabajar, ya que todo su esfuerzo es por darle lo mejor a su familia. Quiere que el día de mañana sus hijos sean personas de bien, y sean utiles no solo a ellos mismos sino también a la sociedad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos esenciales para su despensa, como ser enlatados, azúcar por bolsas, harina, cárnico y demás. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr Mario is married and is a traffic policeman. He has 2 children. He owns a store that is run by his wife. He has been in the business for 9 years which means he has a good and loyal client base which generates a very good income. 

He says that he never tires of working as his every effort is to provide his family with the best. In the future he wants his children to be good people as well as useful not only for themselves but also for society.

He is asking for the loan to buy essential products for his store such as canned goods, bags of sugar, flour, meat products and other products. He is thankful to the Fundacion for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bags of sugar. flour, and  meat products as well as other products.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Vilma tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos,  ella nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Vilma es la venta de bebidas como por ejemplo cerveza y gaseosas. Ya son 3 meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Antes, Vilma se dedicaba a la venta de comida y tenía un restaurante pero lo traspasó a su cuñado.  

En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y balones de gas. 

Vilma agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” (New Hope of Ollantaytambo) and the members conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 26 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Vilma was born in the city of Ollantaytambo. She lives in the same city where she was born and conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling beverages, such as beer and sodas. Vilma has been in this business for three months and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Vilma previously sold food at a restaurant, but she passed that business on to her brother-in-law. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy sodas and tanks of gas.

Vilma appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas and tanks of gas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, la socia también se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos y galletas, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y también para comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Maria divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs. She also has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, noodles, and cookies. Through these businesses, Maria is able to move her children forward. She wants to expand and improve her business of raising animals, so she is requesting a loan to buy pigs. Maria also wants to keep her store in operation by purchasing rice, sugar, milk, and noodles in bulk.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 10 años inició su propio negocio, un galpón donde se dedica a engordar y criar pollos para luego comercializarlos, junto a su esposa han sacado el negocio adelante y con los ingresos que éste les genera pueden cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar.
 
Actualmente quiere comprar más pollos para engordar, ya que se viene la temporada de diciembre donde las ventas se incrementar en gran porcentaje, igualmente necesita comprar cuido para la alimentación y cuidado de los pollos pero Manuel no cuenta con la cantidad de dinero necesaria para dichas compras, por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual mejorar su negocio, y mejorar su calidad de vida al generar mas ingresos con la venta de los pollos que logre comprar, engordar y comercializar.
texts.en:
Manuel is an enterprising gentleman who started his own business 10 years ago. He has a chicken coop where he fattens and raises poultry for eventual resale. Manuel and his wife have worked together to move this business forward and the income they generate is used to cover basic household necessities.

He currently wants to buy more chickens for fattening. December is approaching and that is the time when his sales increase by a large percentage. Manuel also needs to buy feed to maintain his chickens, but he does not have the necessary funds to make these purchases. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can improve his business. By acquiring more chickens that he can fatten and sell, Manuel can generate more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marleni; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y chanchos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas y también comprar alimentos para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES", which is located in the district of Huayllabamba in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Marleni is 40 years old and has a common-law husband and three children.  She splits her time between daily activities and running a grocery store where she sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk.  She also raises chickens and pigs.  The member wants to expand her grocery store and increase her livestock business.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as animal feed.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, D. 63 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía D. su esposo Julián, con quien convive desD. hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con uno D. ellos: Víctor, al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo D. Acraquia.  Una zona ganadera, donD. todos sus pobladores se dedican a L. crianza D. ganado vacuno D. buena calidad. Ahí Julia, comenzó desD. hace 20 años aproximadamente, a incursionar en L. ganadería con L. crianza D. vacas. Ahora tiene 4 vacas lecheras y 3 becerros, que le brindan leche, con los que elabora queso; un promedio D. 18 “bolillos”, diarios (quesos pequeños). Junto a su esposo, también se dedica a L. agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan D. papa, habas, arveja y maíz los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues depenD. D. sus cuidados, para que obtenga buena ganancia en L. cosecha. Ahora su objetivo se centra en L. mejora D. sus sembríos y D. sus animales, con trabajo y empeño sabe que lo logrará. ElL. pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. espera del apoyo D. todos ustedes para seguir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas.  Julia, D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. una vaca D. raza Brown Swiss, que le brindan buena leche.
texts.en: Julia, 63, is a responsible woman.  She lives with her husband, Julián, and they have been together for 40 years.  They have nine children, of which only one still lives at home, Víctor, who they care for in their own house in the Acraquia annex.  This is a livestock farming area where all the inhabitants raise quality cattle.  Approximately 20 years ago Julia began raising cattle in this area.  Now she has four dairy cows and three calves who give her milk which she uses to make cheese.  She produces an average of 18 small cheese balls a day.  She and her husband also grow crops, mainly potatoes, lima beans, peas and corn which they take good care of in order to make a good profit at harvest time.  Their goal now is to improve their crops and livestock, and through hard work and commitment they know they will meet their goal.  She is a member of the communal bank "Acraquia" and this is her fifth loan through MFP.  She is counting on your support to reach her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  If you can help Julia she plans to invest the money in a new Brown Swiss cow that will give good milk.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un célibataire sans enfants.Il exerce le transport de clients et de bagages avec une charette et un cheval.Il vend également durant la saison sèche de la paille d'arachide pour augmenter ses revenus.Ce qui fait que ses deux activités lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille qui se trouve au village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville ou il travaille.Actuellement il sollicite  un pret de 400000f pour acheter une seconde charette et un cheval .Son ambition est d'acquérir plus tard un traxi de transport urbain.
texts.en:
The borrower is single and does not have children. He works as a transporter of people and baggage with a cart and a horse. During the dry season, he also sells groundnut straw to increase his revenues. As a result of these two activities, he can provide for his family; they live in a village located a few kilometers away from the city where he works.
He is currently requesting a 400,000 XOF loan in order to purchase a second cart and a horse. His ambition is later to acquire a taxi for urban transportation.

loans.use: to buy a second cart and a horse.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EMANNUEL est formé de trois  personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante  de ce groupe, nommée Ayetchitchè, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Ayetchitchè est âgée de 51 ans et est une veuve. Ayetchitchè a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à sa charge. Ayetchitchè vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses besoins. Ayetchitchè  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs quatre ans que Ayetchitchè exerce comme activité, la vente d’«akassa » (aliment local préparé à base d’amidon de maïs), accompagné de poissons frits ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de son enfant et de subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Ayetchitchè désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Ayetchitchè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EMANNUEL, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Group Emannuel is composed of three people, who reside in the same district. The group’s representative, named Ayetchitchè, is raising her hand on the photo. This is the third time that this group is requesting ALIDé’s financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Ayetchitchè is 51 years old and a widow. She has three children, who all went to school; one of them is still in her care. Ayetchitchè lives alone with her child and supports herself on her own. She did not go to school.
For about four years, Ayetchitchè has been in the business of selling "akassa" (a local food prepared from corn starch) together with fried fish. This has allowed her to provide for herself and her child without major difficulty. In order to strengthen her business and to meet demand from her customers, Ayetchitchè would like to increase her stock of products. To this end, Ayetchitchè is requesting a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of group Emannuel. The first two loans have been repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and fresh fish.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Rosa desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado y sanidad de su ganado ovino, con las ganancias que obtenga en la actividad podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Rosa es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos para que logren su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 33, lives with her two children in her own house which has electricity as the only utility.  The house is located in the Tambogrande district which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is known for it agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For several years Rosa has been raising and selling sheep.  Her corral is set up behind her house.  She feeds the animals balanced feed and natural fodder so they can reach optimum size and be sold at the different markets in the area, earning her a good profit so she can take care of the daily household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and pay for health care for her sheep.  With the earnings from the business she can pay back the loan and have a better lifestyle.  Through much effort and determination, Rosa has helped her children get ahead so they can reach their goals.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and pay for health care for her sheep.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 44 años, es una valerosa madre soltera que cuidó de sus 5 hijos, sola. Ahora vive con 2 de ellos y su nieto en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Acraquia. Como buena madre y abuela, ella cría a su nieta, pues su madre se fue a trabajar al exterior. A pesar de lo difícil que es asumir esa responsabilidad, no se desanima. Pues abrió un pequeño negocio en la plaza de la ciudad, donde vende bebidas, dulces y comida a los pobladores del caserío. Según cuenta le va bien, tanto así que ahora está pensando, mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, para tener mayor clientela. Sabe que el camino es largo, pero con la ayuda de sus hijos espera concretar sus objetivos. Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, siendo sus principales sembríos las hortalizas en toda sus variedades, además de 3 vacas que posee y con las que extrae leche para elaborar queso, "así obtengo mayor ganancia", afirma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo brindado hasta el momento. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Luzmila, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca lechera y en surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Luzmila, 44, is a courageous single mother who has taken care of her five children alone.  Now she lives with two of them and a grandchild in her own house located in the Acraquia annex.  She cares for her granddaughter because the child's mother is working overseas.  Despite the difficulties of her responsibility, she does not lose hope.  She opened a small business in the city's main square where she sells beverages, sweets and groceries to the people living in this rural area.  She says business is going well so she is thinking about improving its infrastructure in an aim to attract mO. customers.  She knows it will be a long road, but with the help of her children she hopes to meet her goals.  Since she is involved in agriculture, the main crops are vegetables in all varieties.  She also has three cows and makes cheese, stating, "I earn mO. profit this way.".  She belongs to the communal bank "Acraquia" and this is her fifth loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the support given to date, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Luzmila plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow and groceries for her stO..

loans.use: To buy a cow and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and oil  for her business.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Carlota tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Santa Teresa y desde  hace 12 años que vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Carlota es la venta de comida y sirve desayuno y almuerzo en el mercado de Ollantaytambo. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Carlota requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, conservas y otras cosas más.   

Carlota agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo”. The members of the communal bank meet every thirty days in the city of Ollantaytambo, located in the province of Urunbamba in the department of Cusco.

Carlota is 39 years old, she lives in a common law marriage and she has one son. She was born in the city of Santa Teresa and she has lived in Ollantaytambo for the past 12 years and this is also where she carries out her work. Carlota’s main job is selling food and serving breakfast and lunch in the Ollantaytambo market. She has worked in this business for 12 years and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

At this time Carlota requires the loan to buy supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, canned goods and other things.

Carlota appreciates and values the loan and she promises to keep up with her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, canned goods and other things.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de 6 enfants dont 4 élèves.Il exerce le métier de charpentier notamment la construction et la réparation de pirogues de pêche.Il pratique cette activité depuis 1983 alors qu'il était encore  jeune apprenti de son père qui lui a appris le métier.Aujourd'hui, il a son propre atelier et parvient à entretenir sa famille et à satisfaire ses besoins avec les revenus tirés de la charpenterie.Pour augmenter ses capacités de production , il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des planches et des troncs d'arbres morts.Son ambition est de construire un grand dépot de bois de menuiserie et de charpenterie.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married man and the father of six children, of whom four are students. He works in the trade of carpentry, especially in construction and in repairing fishing boats. He has working at this since 1983 while he was still a young apprentice of his father's, who taught him the trade. Today, he has his own workshop and manages to support his family and himself with the income derived from carpentry.

To increase his production capacity, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy boards and tree trunks. His ambition is to build a large warehouse for lumber and woodworking.

loans.use: to buy planks and tree trunks

loans.name: Ayivo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIVO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Léontine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Léontine est âgée de 52 ans et est une veuve. Léontine a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Léontine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Léontine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Depuis six ans, Léontine exerce comme activité, la vente de boissons et de conserves dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Léontine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Léontine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group AYIVO is comprised of three persons who reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, by the name of Léontine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Léontine is 52 years old and a widow with two children, who are both in school and still in her care. She lives alone with her children and ensures that their different expenses are covered. Léontine has attended middle school. For six years, she has had a business selling beverages and canned foods in her district; this enables her to respond fairly easily to the needs of her family. 

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, Léontine would like to bolster her business. To do so, she and the other members of the group AYIVO are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages and boxes of canned foods

loans.name: Cruz Esperanza

texts.es:
Cruz es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad, reside con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracterizapor la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 6 años Cruz se dedica a la venta de diversos productos naturales, los mismos que exhibe en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, la cual atiende diariamente, es conocida por los buenos productos que ofrece a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos naturales y realizar algunos arreglos en su casa, al surtir su negocio con una variedad de productos se incrementarían sus ganancias, con la finalidad de seguir sacando adelante en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cruz is a 35-year-old mother who lives with her three children in her own home.  The only service her home receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

For six years, Cruz has been selling a range of natural products which she displays at home.  She has her own customer base which she serves every day.  She is known for the good products that she offers her customers.  She uses the income that she makes to cover her family expenses.

Cuz would like to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more natural products and make some repairs to her home.  By stocking her business with a variety of products, her profits will increase and she will be able to continue providing for her children.

loans.use: to buy more natural products and make some repairs to her home

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 46 años, es una mujer que lucha por el futuro de sus hijos. Vive en el anexo de Acraquia, junto a Rodrigo, su esposo; ambos tienen 5 hijos. De los cuales solo cuidan a uno de ellos, Leydi, en su casa propia. En la plaza principal del caserío, todas las mañanas encontramos a Dolores, quien prepara los alimentos para luego venderlos a los pobladores que conocedores de su buena sazón, la visitan constantemente. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, tanto así que hace poco comenzó a preparar jugos de diversas frutas y a surtir su tienda, con bebidas, golosinas y demás productos de primera necesidad. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya tiene 3 vacas y 2 becerros, de los que prepara queso pequeño o llamados “bolillos”, que después lo comercializa en la ciudad de Pampas, cuando es día de feria. Ahora desea seguir trabajando con más empeño pues, desea contar con un capital de trabajo sólido, que no le cause dificultades. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que se caracteriza por ser responsable. Dolores de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, además de pasto para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Dolores is 46 years old.  She is a woman who works hard for the future of her children.  She lives in the small village of Acraquia together with her husband Rodrigo.  The couple have five children.  They only care for one of their children, Leydi, in their own home. 

Every morning, in the main square of the village, we find Dolores preparing food which she will then sell to the local people who, aware of the good flavor of this food, visit her all the time.  Her work is going very well, so much so that she recently started preparing different fruit juices and stocking her store with drinks, candies and other basic products.  As she is a hard-working woman, Dolores also raises cattle.  She has three cows and two calves whose milk she uses to prepare small cheeses called 'bolillos' which she then sells in the city of Pampas on market day.  Right now, Dolores would like to continue working harder as she would like to have solid working capital so that she doesn't have problems.  

Dolores belongs to the 'Acraquia' community bank and this is her eighth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support and pledges to make her repayments on time as she is noted for being responsible.  With your support, Dolores will invest the money she has requested in buying basic products for her food store and also fodder with which to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store and fodder for her animals

loans.name: Mahukpego 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKPEGO 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Bricia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Bricia est mariée à un certain Samson et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un à leur charge. Bricia  vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Bricia a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Bricia vend depuis une six ans, des chaussures et des glacières par le système de distribution. Bricia s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Bricia sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"MAHUKPEGO 2" is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Bricia (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 36 years old and married to a man named Samson. They have two children, both in school. One of the children is still in their care. The couple jointly ensures that the various household expenses are covered. 

Bricia dropped out of elementary school. To cope with her expenses, she has been selling footwear and insulated containers (coolers) for six years via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Benin and from Nigeria. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, and with the aim of increasing her working capital and bolstering her business, Bricia as well as the other members of the group MAHUKPEGO 2 are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve them in responding better to the demands of their customers and in making more profit.

loans.use: to buy coolers and shoes

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui vit seule avec ses 6 enfants depuis le décés de son mari en 2003.Trois de ses enfants sont des élèves.Pour nourrir et entretenir sa famille, elle exerce le commerce de tissus, de draps et de produits de mercerie.Elle a démarré cette activité avec un pret de 100 000f de l'UIMCEC qu'elle a remboursé sans retards.Actuellement elle sollicite un autre pret de 300000f pour acheter 3 douzaines de tissus, 10 draps et 5 douzaines de parfum. Son ambition est d'ouvrir une cantine au marché central de sa localité.
texts.en: This borrower is a woman who has lived alone with her six children since her husband's death in 2003. Three of her children are students. To feed and care for her family, she has a business selling bed sheets and sewing supplies. She started this business with a loan of 100,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC. She repaid it without delay. Currently, she is requesting another loan of 300,000 francs to buy 3 dozen of cloth, 10 bed sheets, and 5 dozen of perfumes. Her ambition is to open a stall at the central market in her town.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen of cloth, 10 bed sheets, and 5 dozen of perfumes

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr: LA PAIX est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Appoline Verène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Appoline Verène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Appoline Verène a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a près de six ans que Appoline Verène vend des produits divers (liqueurs, savons, biscuits)  dans son quartier. Appoline Verène exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Appoline Verène s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Appoline Verène sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe LA PAIX . Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
LA PAIX is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Appoline Verène (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a mechanic by the name of Jean. They have four children, all in school. Two of the children are in their care. She and her husband live together and jointly cover the different expenses of the children. 

Appoline Verène dropped out of elementary school. For six years, she has been selling a variety of goods (liquors, soaps, cookies) in her district. She works at it passionately, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and with the aim of increase her working capital, Appoline Verène along with the other members of the group LA PAIX are requesting a third loan. This loan will serve them in responding better to the demands of their customers and in making more profit.

loans.use: to buy various items (liquors, soaps, cookies)

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha, de 41 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene 3 hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica  a atender un auto lavado (Car Wash).  Empezó con este negocio hace 15 años debito a la falta de recursos económicos sus hijos le ayudaban a ella a lavar carros después de clases o en época de vacaciones además ella vendía ropa de manera ambulante para conseguir ingresos extras para su hogar , su esposo trabaja en acarreo. Pero un día decidieron aventurarse a poner un negocio de servicios de auto lavado propio ahora es un negocio del  cual ella sobrevive, sus hijos la apoyan en sus ratos libres.
Ella realizo el préstamo para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas o bombas de presión, aspiradoras y comprar material de trabajo tales como jabón liquido, pasta para darle brillo a los carros, aromatizantes, cepillos, toallas. Podrá darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus maquinas compra material que necesita y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Una de sus metas en acondicionar el lugar, comprar aspiradoras y bombas de presión nuevas, ir poco a poco modernizando su local.
texts.en:
41-year-old Martha lives in the city of León.  She has three children.  Her business is running a car wash.  She started this business 15 years ago owing to a lack of financial resources.  Her children would help her to wash cars after class or during vacations.  She also used to sell clothes as an itinerant vendor in order to make extra income for her household.  Her husband works in haulage.  However, one day the couple decided to take a chance and set up a car wash business of their own.  Now this is a business which enables Martha to survive.  Her children support her in their spare time.  

Martha requested this loan to have some maintenance work carried out on her machines, power washers and vacuum cleaners, and to buy work supplies such as liquid soap and polish for making the cars shine, scented sprays, brushes and towels.  She will be able to better maintain her machines, buy the supplies she needs and provide a better service to her customers.  One of her goals is to equip her business, buy new vacuum cleaners and power washers and gradually modernize her premises.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her machines, power washers and vacuum cleaners, and to buy work supplies such as liquid soap and polish, scented sprays, brushes and towels

loans.name: Yanira Nicolasa

texts.es: Yanira, de 32 años de edad, originaria de La Reynaga una comunidad ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad de León, ella es comerciante, se dedica a elaborar artesanías de barro, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 10,13 y 3 años respectivamente. Ella empezó este negocio a los 21 años de edad por medio de una cuñada quien el enseño a elaborar artesanías de barro, aprendió a hacer jarrones, hoyas, con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo mas experiencia y se independizo ahora ella trabaja bajo sus propios medios. Ella vende en su comunidad y viaja hasta  el mercado central de la ciudad de Loen para ofrecer sus artesanía de barros entre las piezas mas populares que ella vende son los puerquitos que se usan para que los niños ahorren dinero. Ella realizo el  préstamo para comprar materia prima como barro, pinturas y moldes para elaborar sus artesanías además quiere invertir para cubrir los costos de importar sus artesanías a Costa Rica. Ya que con esta inversión lograr abrirse ruta para importar sus productos fuera de Nicaragua, pues una de  sus expectativas en el futuro es expandirse por toda Centro América, su meta próxima es meta es mejorar la calidad y producción de su artesanías, vender toda sus piezas cancelar su crédito y hacerle mejoras a su hogar para darle un techo digno donde sus hijos puedan vivir.
texts.en:
Yanira is 32 years old and from La Reynaga, a community on the outskirts of the city of León.  She is a businesswoman who makes handicrafts from clay.  Yanira is married and has three children aged 10, 13 and 3.  She started her business when she was 21 years old through a sister-in-law who taught her how to make handicrafts from clay.  She learned to make vases and pots.  Over time she gained more experience and started working independently.  She now works under her own means.  She sells her products in her community and travels to the central market in the city of León to offer her clay handicrafts.  One of the most popular items she sells are piggy banks in which children save their money.

Yanira requested this loan to buy raw materials such as clay, paints and molds with which to make her handicrafts.  She would also like to invest in covering the costs of exporting her handicrafts to Costa Rica.  With this investment, she will manage to open a route to exporting her products outside of Nicaragua.  One of her hopes for the future is to expand throughout Central America.  Her next goal  is to improve the quality and production of her handicrafts, to sell all her pieces, repay her loan and make some improvements to her home so that she can provide her children with a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as clay, paints and molds to make her handicrafts and to invest in covering the costs of exporting her handicrafts to Costa Rica

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora Erlinda, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos entre las edades de 13 a 22  años,  en la actualidad 3 de sus hijos están estudiando, ella vive en una aldea rural del  Municipio de Santa Rita  Yoro, 
 Doña Erlinda trabaja a tiempo completo en su negocio de pulpería, donde se dedica a la compra y venta de productos lácteos, granos básicos y carnes.
Inicio su negocio con un prestamos de cuatro mil Lempiras (l.4,000.00) con el cual comenzó a vender  carne de pollo, en la actualidad ha logrado aumentar la oferta de otros productos.
Actualmente obtuvo su séptimo préstamo con ODEF por la cantidad de  L.16,000.00 el cual será invertido en la compra de productos lácteos y productos de la canasta básica familiar.
Ella se siente satisfecha porque considera que ODEF le tiene confianza al brindarle  oportunidades de financiamiento.
Su meta a futuro es mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar y continuar apoyando a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Erlinda, age 53, is a single mother.  She has five children between the ages of 13 and 22.  Three of her children are currently in school.  She lives in a rural village in the Santa Rita Yoro municipality.

Erlinda works full time in her business, a grocery store.  She buys and sells dairy products, basic grains, and meat.  She started her business with a loan for four thousand (4,000) lempiras, and she bought chicken.  She has currently managed to increase the number of products that she offers for sale.

She has now received her seventh loan with ODEF, and it is for 16,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy dairy products and basic needs products.

She is pleased because ODEF trusts her by offering her financial opportunities.

Her goal for the future is to improve her household’s financial situation and to continue supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy dairy products and basic needs products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Yaguarón Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité yaguaron poty surge a partir de la reunión de las integrantes  con la fundación, con la idea de conocer más sobre los beneficios ofrecidos a través de su programa de mujeres emprendedoras, el cual les resultó una excelente oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos e independizarse costeando sus propios gastos. Todas han asumido el compromiso de trabajar con mucha responsabilidad, solidaridad y respeto reciproco, actualmente se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo con calificación excelente, está integrado por 15 emprendedoras señoras quienes invierten sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de las miembros es la señora Herma, ella es modista. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, sacrificada. Dice que empieza su jornada de trabajo a muy tempranas horas ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos y siempre está muy atareada. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante con sus proyectos y también ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, lo cual es el elemento esencial de su trabajo. Está agradecida con la fundación pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The communal bank Yaguaron Poty arose due to a meeting the members had with the Fundacion with the idea of getting to know more about the benefits offered by their program for entrepreneural woman which they found to be an excellent opportunity to improve their income,s become independent and  pay their own expenses. All of them are committed to working very responsibly, with solidarity and mutual respect. Currently they are in their 7th cycle and are rated excellent. The group consists of 15 enterprising women who invest their loans in their respective business activities. One of the members is Señora Herma who is a dressmaker. She describes herself as a hardworking and selfsacrificing woman. She says that she starts her working day at a very early hour as she always has a lot of orders and is always very busy. Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead with her projects as well as help her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fabric which is essential to her work. She is grateful to the Fundacion as the loan will be of great help to her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for use in a sewing woorkshop.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.es:
Isaura es una mujer emprendedora que toda su vida ha luchado por sacar a su familia adelante, es madre de 4 hijos y su mayor sueño es poderles brindar a ellos y a sus nietos un mejor futuro, Isaura se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, como cosméticos, productos estéticos y de aseo personal, tiene una miscelánea donde exhibe y comercializa estos productos, y de esta manera genera ingresos para aportar en los gastos del hogar.

Actualmente Isaura sueña con ver progresar su negocio por lo que quiere aprovechar que pronto llegará la temporada de diciembre para comprar un surtido mayor de insumos para la venta, y hacerle algunas adecuaciones locativas a su negocio, pero ella no cuenta con el capital que necesita para hacerlo, por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual hacer dichas compras y adecuaciones, para lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Isaura is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked hard her entire life to provide for her family.  She is the mother of four children and her biggest dream is to be able to provide them and her grandchildren with a better future.  Isaura sells personal care products such as cosmetics, beauty products and personal hygiene products.  She has a store where she displays and sells these products.  In this way, she makes income to contribute toward her household expenses.

Isaura currently dreams of making progress in her business.  She would like to make the most of the fact that December is just round the corner in order to buy a larger stock of supplies to sell and make some physical change to her business.  She does not have the capital she needs to do this and so is requesting a loan to make these purchases and changes.  This will enable her to improve her own quality of life and that of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy personal care products and make some structural changes to her business

loans.name: Trese Belen Group

texts.es:
El comité Trese Belen es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 16 mujeres que trabajan incansablemente por el bienestar de sus familias e hijos. Son todas señora muy trabajadoras nunca tuvieron problema en el pago de sus responsabilidades.  Ellas desean poder seguir dentro del programa, pues ven en el mismo mucho futuro, ya que les ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Jenifer. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de toda clase, como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras, bermudas y otros. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, innovadora y muy luchadora. Comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo mejor y evitar que pasen por privaciones.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva para la compra de prendas de temporada de verano, como ser camisillas, bermudas, remeras y demás, lo cual está teniendo buen arrastre.
texts.en:
The 14 women who form the Trese Belen Committee are from the town of San Lorenzo. They work very hard for the wellbeing of their families and children. All are industrious women who have never had a problem making their repayments. They are keen to continue with the program as they see it as the way of the future. It has already been a great help to them.

One of the members is Sra. Jenifer who earns her living by selling all types of clothing such as shirts, pants, t-shirts, shorts etc. She is known as a hardworking woman, innovative and enterprising. She comments that all her efforts are because of her family as she wishes to give them nothing but the best so that they lack for nothing.

Jenifer is seeking assistance from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy summer clothing such as sleeveless shirts, shorts, t-shirts etc. which are very popular items.

loans.use: to buy sleeveless shirts, shorts, t-shirts etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier came to the US from Argentina in search for a better future for his family. When he arrived in 2001, he had no experience in landscaping. Once he got more experience in the field, he decided to open his landscaping business. Javier said the biggest challenge was dedicating all of his time and money to organizing the business while providing his children with financial support. As he said, adjusting to this “new country, new place, new work” was an amazing process and a learning experience. Javier now owns a successful landscaping business in South Florida and has three employees.

With this loan from Accion USA, Javier will buy a new lawn mower and other equipment that needs to be replaced. In the future, he hopes to keep expanding his business with new clients and get more contracts with commercial buildings and condos as well as private homes.

loans.use: To pay for a lawn mower and other equipment.

loans.name: Corzon Valiente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON VALIENTE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Viviana.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: frial, comercial de comida, venta de productos YAMBAL, venta de dulces, venta de perfumes, costura, venta de DVD.
 
La señora Viviana indica que hace dos años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de materia prima (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, etc.) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “CORAZON VALIENTE” (Brave Heart) community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Viviana.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include, selling food, selling Yambal [beauty] products, selling sweet treats, selling perfumes, sewing and selling DVDs.

Viviana tells us that she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank for two years.  She joined through an invite from one of her friends.  She currently has a business selling food which she has been working in for years.

Viviana will use this loan to buy raw materials (rice, oil, noodles, etc.).  She will buy her products in La Ceja and then sell them from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Viviana replied that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Maria quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la fundación, ya que vio que el mismo les sería de mucha ayuda en el progreso de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico sino también en lo personal.
La sra. Maria está en pareja hace 8 años con el señor Salín quien se dedica a la venta de caramelos,  tienen dos hijos menores de edad. Maria Trabaja en la venta de ropas de todo tipo, trabajo el cual le ayuda mucho para cubrir los gastos de la casa. Ella tiene como meta tener un local propio en  el mercado de Luque donde poder  vender ropas y  así ir mejorando el ingreso de su familia y satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá aumentar su variedad y de esa forma atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
It was Sra. Maria who started this group when she invited and organized her friends to become part of the Foundation’s Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. She saw that it would help each of them very much, not only economically but also personally.

Sra. Maria has lived with her partner Sr. Salín for eight years. He sells candy.  They have two young children. Maria sells all types of clothing, a job that brings in much needed money to pay for household expenses. Her goal is to have her own stall in the Luque market one day and sell clothing there. This would bring in more money for the family and pay for basic needs.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy a greater variety of clothing so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Desde hace varios años Maria Eugenia ha soñado con tener su propio negocio, es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un crédito con el cual iniciar este proceso, pues actualmente no cuenta con la suma de dinero necesaria para emprender su microempresa, Maria Eugenia es una mujer emprendedora, y madre de 2 hijos por quienes ha trabajado con gran espero para ofrecerles un mejor futuro, y hoy que su situación económica es tan crítica, busca la manera de tener un ingreso mensual fijo que mejore su calidad de vida.

Maria Eugenia invertirá el préstamo para adecuar un lugar donde montar la legumbrería, compra de mercancía para surtir el local como frutas, verduras, legumbres, y finalmente ambientar su negocio para lograr posicionarlo, y que sus vecinos y clientes en general comiencen a reconocerla.
texts.en:
For several years Maria Eugenia has dreamed of having her own business. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan with which to start this process, as she currently lacks the money necessary to start her small enterprise. Maria Eugenia is an enterprising woman and mother of 2 children for whom she works in the hopes of providing them with a better future and now that her economic situation is so critical, she is looking for a way of making a fixed monthly income that will improve their quality of life.

Maria Eugenia will invest the loan to make alterations to premises to set up her vegetable store, buy merchandise with which to stock the store such as fruit, vegetables, legumes and finally set up the business to position it so that her neighbours and customers start to recognize her.

loans.use: to set up her own business, buy stock and make the necessary alterations to open a vegetable store.

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO DIA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por siete integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Rosmery.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de licores, venta de jugos, venta de productos, tienda de barrio, venta de comino.
 
La señora Rosmery indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de víveres para llenar la tienda (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, etc.) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible pues ella soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
A.C. “NUEVO DIA” will start its first loan cycle as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It consists of 7 members lead by a board which is headed by Señora Rosmery. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are various and among them are: liquor sales; juice sale; groceries; neighbourhood store; cumin sales.

Señora Rosmery says that it is the first time that she has been a member of a communal bank with Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of one of the promoters. Currently she has a neighbourhood store which she has run for many years.

The loan she is asking for now is to buy groceries to stock her store (to buy rice, oil, noodles, etc.) which she buys at La Ceja and subsequently sells in her store. This workflow allows her to generate resources with which to support herself as much as possible as she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store.

loans.name: San Jose 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité San José 2 se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas tienen como principal objetivo el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en todos los aspectos, quieren lograr por medio del trabajo en conjunto, la ayuda de las familias de cada una.
Una de las miembros es la señora Liz, la cual tiene un copetín. Este local le sirve de sustento, no solo de ella sino también el de su familia. Trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, pero dice que su trabajo es muy gratificante. En cuanto a los clientes manifiesta que tiene una clientela formada y que eso sería como un ingreso seguro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, galletitas, gaseosas, cigarrillos y otros artículos para abastecer su pequeño local, ya que estos son los artículos que más salidas tienen.
texts.en:
The San José 2 committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Santaní got together. The members are a very close group who carry out activities that strengthen their friendship. Their main objective is for each one of the members to develop in every way possible. By working together, they want to be able to help each member’s family.

One of the members is Señora Liz who has a fast food counter. This supports not just her, but also her family. She starts work very early in the morning but says that her work is very rewarding. As far as her customers are concerned, she says that she has regular clientele and this is like having a steady income.

She is applying for the loan to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, cigarettes and other things to stock her small restaurant, as these are the most popular items.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, cigarettes and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, salt, candy and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak is 43 years old. He is married and has a son and three daughters. Sahak lives with his family in the Koti village Ijevan area. Since finishing his education and time in the army, Sahak and his parents have been engaged in farming and animal breeding in their native Koti village. 

Sahak's wife helps him in farming and takes care of their kids. Sahak keeps pigs and cows for meat and milk. Sahak is very appreciated for the agricultural and animal breeding business and, thanks to his profit, Sahak can meet his family's needs.
 
Sahak needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a lot of fodder for winter for his pigs and cows.

loans.use: To buy winter fodder for his pigs and cows.

loans.name: Carla Lilian

texts.es: la señora Carla es  clienta antigua de la institución,  que esta en su  cuarta secuencia,  la Señora Carla se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada, es madre soltera con tres hijos que están en la edad escolar viven en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de la paz,  cabe aclarar que  la señora  mantiene a sus tres  hijos y no cuenta con el  apoyo de sus familiares, el préstamo  invertirá  para la compra de pantalones por mayor  para fin de  año, la señora  se siente  beneficiada y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo ya que sin su apoyo no hubiera podido salir adelante.
texts.en: Señora Carla is a former member of the institution which is in its 4th cycle. Señora Carla sells clothes according to the season. She is a single mother with 3 children who are of school age. They live in the high part of the San Pedro area in the city of La Paz. It is clear that she takes care of her 3 children and has no support from relatives. She will invest the loan in purchasing trousers wholesale for the year end. The lady says that she feels she has benefited and is grateful to the institution for the support as without it she would not have been able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy trousers wholesale.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo con integrantes de otro comité que se disolvió. De esta forma se inicia el comité Virgen de la Candelaria. Actualmente está formado por 22 integrantes quienes trabajan de forma coordinada, siempre con miras a un objetivo común, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La Sra Graciela es una de las miembros, tiene 41 años está en pareja con el Señor Rogelio, quien es comerciante, tienen 2 hijas, una tiene 18 años y la otra 10 años, ambas están estudiando.
La Sra Graciela tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular, el cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su marido con la manutención de la casa y de los hijos. Comenta que tiene buenos ingresos, pues la mayoría de sus vecinos acuden a su negocio.
Ella pide la ayuda de Kiva y la fundación para cargar su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, como ser carnes, lácteos, panificados, azúcar, harina, pastas y otros.
texts.en:
The present communal bank was formed by members of another one that dissolved.  In this way the Virgen de la Candelaria communal bank began.  Currently there are 22 members who work in a coordinated fashion, always looking toward a common objective.  They are in the eighth loan cycle of the Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Program of Women Entrepreneurs].

Graciela is one of the members.  She is 41 years old and lives as a couple with Rogelio, who is a businessman.  They have two daughters; one is 18 years old and the other 10, and both are students.

Graciela has a store in her private home that generates the necessary income to help her husband with the support of the household and the children.  She comments that she has a good income, since the majority of her neighbors come to her business.

She is requesting help from Kiva and the Fundación to stock her business with basic household necessities such as meat, dairy products, bread, sugar, flour, pasta, and other products.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, bread, sugar, flour, pasta, and other products.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 47 es una mujer dichosa. Ella vive en compañía de Ceferino, su esposo desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo cuida a 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Usibamba. Todas las mañanas como es de costumbre sale a cuidar de sus sembríos, pues es temporada y necesita de una buena cosecha. Sus principales cultivos constan de alfalfa, pasto, avena y demás alimentos para su ganado, pues se dedica a la crianza de vacas, ya cuenta con 8, de los cuales 3 están preñadas, por lo que no brindan leche; aunque ahora este algo escaso, sabe que no durará  para siempre, pues cuando ya nacen las terneras, sus vacas le proporcionarán buena leche y podrá vender a un buen precio. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a ella; es el tejido, mientras realiza sus actividades, ella elabora diversas prendas como chompas, tapetes, colchas y demás accesorios a base de lana. Ahí obtiene una ganancia extra y además disfruta de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Usibamba” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con sus cuotas, pues las personas de su asociación son responsables y muy solidarias. Amelia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 vacas lecheras, con las que piensa aumentar la cantidad de su ganado.
texts.en: Amelia is 47 years old and is a happy woman. She lives with Cerefino, her husband of 25 years. They have 5 children. They take care of only 4 of them in their own house, which is located in the annex of Usibamba. Every morning as is her custom, she goes to take care of her crops as it is the season and she needs a good harvest. Her principal crops are alfalfa, grass, oats and other food for her animals, as she breeds cows. She already has 8 cows, 3 of which are pregnant and so do not give milk. Although now feeling the pinch, she knows that this will not last forever as when the calves are born her cows will give her good milk which she will sell at a good price. However, what she likes doing the best is weaving. While going about her daily chores, she makes various garments such as sweaters, rugs, quilts and other accessories made from wool. This gives her extra income and she also enjoys the work. She belongs to the communal bank "Usibamba" and this is their 3rd loan with MFP, from which she is hoping to receive a small loan to reach her goals. On the other hand, she promises to make her repayments, as the members of her bank are responsible and very supportive people. Amelia on receiving your support, will invest the money requested to purchase 2 milking cows with which she intends to increase her number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows.

loans.name: Corazon Unido Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON UNIDO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Teodora.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cotillones, venta de comida, albañilería, venta de leche, venta de café y tienda de barrio.
 
La señora Teodora indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de comida que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de víveres (compra de arroz y papa) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible pues ella es viuda y tiene siete hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
A.C. “CORAZON UNIDO” will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. This consists of 6 members lead by a board which is headed by Señora Teodora. The members of the communal bank have diverse businesses among which are: selling party favors; food sales; construction; milk sales; coffee sales and neighbourhood store.

Señora Teodora says that this is the 2nd cycle that she has been a member of a communal bank with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of one of the promoters. Currently she has a business selling food which she has run for many years.

The loan she is asking for is to buy groceries (to buy rice and potatoes) which she buys at La Ceja and subsequently sells. This workflow allows her to generate resources to support herself all she can as she is a widow and has 7 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the capacity-building training.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Katiana

texts.es: La señora Katiana, vive en la zona del plan 3000, la cliente vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y su hijo menor de un año, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas de jigote, milanesas y asaditos, dicha actividad lo realiza en el domicilio de sus padres hace varios años atrás, ya es muy conocida por la zona de esta manera ayuda a su esposo con algunos gastos del hogar, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de insumos  como papa, arroz  y harina para la elaboración de su comida, gracias a su actividad y conjuntamente el apoyo de su esposo la cliente ha podido salir adelante y de esta manera poder hacer construir unas habitaciones en la casa de sus papas ya que le cedieron un espacio en la casa para ella y su familia, la Sra. Katiana es una persona joven que desea salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Katiana lives in the Plan 3000 area. The client lives in her parents’ house together with her husband and her son, who is not yet one year old. She sells jigote [minced meat] empanadas, milanesas [breaded meat fillets] and asaditos [barbequed or roasted meats]. She has been carrying out this work in her parent's home for the last few years and is well known throughout the area. She can therefore help her husband with some of the household expenses. 

The loan is to be used for the purchase of supplies such as potatoes, rice and flour to prepare her food. Thanks to her job as well as her husband’s support, the client has been able to get ahead in life and continue building some rooms in her parent's home since there is not much room in the house for her and her family. Señora Katiana is a young person who wants to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare empanadas, asaditos and milanesas.

loans.name: Graciela Esmidia

texts.es:
G. de 60 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

G. desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras) y aves de corral (gallinas y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar otros animales y alimento balanceado para los mismos, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  G. es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejorar económicamente para tener otras comodidades.
texts.en:
