G. is 60 years old and lives together with her family in her own home.  The only service her house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Las Lomas district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

For some years now, G. has been raising and selling goats and farmyard birds (hens and turkeys).  Her pens are located behind her home and they are both suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals nutritionally-balanced feed, grains and natural fodder so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area.  This makes her good profits with which she covers her family's daily expenses.

G. has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and nutritionally-balanced feed for them.  She will use the income that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  G. is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that she wants is for her family to do well and to improve her financial situation so that she can enjoy some more comforts and conveniences.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritionally-balanced feed for them

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba, D. 40 años es una mujer seria y con aspiraciones. Vive en compañía D. Joel, su esposo desD. hace 13 años. Ambos tienen una hija Melina, a L. que cuidan en su casa propia; ubicada en el caserío D. Usibamba. Sus actividades son diversas. En las mañanas desD. muy temprano abre las puertas D. su casa, donD. hace algún tiempo abrió una tienda D. comestibles, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad y como mujer del campo. ElL. también se dedica a L. ganadería, con las 4 vacas que posee; venD. L. leche que produce, a un buen precio, pues son muy nutritivas D. buena textura. Asimismo, siembra en sus terrenos agrícolas; avena, habas, arveja y papa. Cuenta que desD. los 15 años comenzó a trabajar D. manera independiente, pues tenía que ayudar a su familia, con el tiempo consolidó una propia. Por ello no descansa, al contrario desea aumentar sus ganancias, con L. compra D. cerdos, con los que también obtendrá ganancias. Ya que piensa ensebarlos y venderlos a los carniceros D. L. zona. ElL. pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera D. su apoyo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas como en anteriores préstamos que tuvo. Elba, D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. una vaca para aumentar su ganado, además D. dos sacos D. semilL. D. arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elba is 40 years old.  She is a serious woman with aspirations who lives together with Joel, her husband of 13 years.  The couple have a daughter, Melina, who they care for in their own home which is located in the small village of Usibamba.  She is engaged in a number of activities.  Very early in the mornings, she opens the doors of her home where she set up a grocery store some time ago.  She sells basic household products and, as a country woman, she also raises livestock.  She has four cows and she sells the milk that they produce for a good price as it is very nutritious and has good texture.  She also grows crops on her farmland: oats, beans, peas and potatoes.  She tells us that she started working independently 15 years ago as she had to help her family.  She does not rest.  She would like to increase her profits by purchasing pigs which would also make her money.  She plans to fatten them and sell them to local butcher's.

Elba is a member of the 'Usibamba' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments as she was with her previous loan.  With your support, Elba will invest the money she has requested in buying a cow to increase the size of her herd.  She will also buy two bags of pea seeds for her next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Rosa tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Sicuani de  la provincia de Quispicanchis y desde hace 6 años que vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Rosa es la venta de comida y tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado por las mañana sirve desayuno, al medio día sirve almuerzo y por las noche sirve pollos a la brasa. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Rosa requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante y desea comprar mesas y sillas.    

Rosa agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo' community bank.  The members of the bank meet once a month in the city of Ollantaytambo, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Rosa is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have two children.  Rosa was born in the town of Sicuani, in Quispicanchis province and has lived in the city of Ollantaytambo for six years.  This is where she carries out her business.  Rosa's main business activity is selling food and she has a restaurant which is located in rented premises.  In the mornings she serves breakfast, at midday she serves lunch and in the evenings she serves charcoal-grilled chicken.  She has been in this business for six years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Rosa needs a loan to equip her restaurant.  She would like to buy tables and chairs.

Rosa is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to equip her restaurant and buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock his home furnishings business.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es D. la ciudad D. San Ignacio, Misiones. Está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y solidarias. Se unieron con el objetivo D. ayudarse las unas con las otras y D. esa forma poder llevar los ingresos necesarios para paliar los gastos diarios.
El comité  es encabezado por la señora Edita, ella cuenta con un almacén que monto gracias al préstamo obtenido con su comité. Comenta que le va muy bien, y que ya tiene una buena clientela. Comenta que su deseo es fortalecer la unidad D. grupo para seguir creciendo con sus actividades y como persona, mediante las capacitaciones brindada por el programa.
Ella solicita la ayuda para abastecer su negocio con los insumos necesarios, como ser pastas, azúcar, panificados, verduras, carnes y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Ignacio, Misiones.  It is composed of 15 women, all of them very hardworking, enterprising, and supportive.  They came together with the goal of helping each other and, in this way, being able to bring home the necessary income to lessen the daily expenses.

Edita is the head of the group.  She has a store that she put together thanks to the loan obtained with her communal bank.  She comments that it is going very well for her and that she already has a good clientele.  She says her desire is to strengthen the unity of the group and so continue growing professionally and personally through the training offered by the program.

She is requesting the help to stock her business with the necessary supplies, such as pasta, sugar, bread, vegetables, meat, and others.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy pasta, sugar, bread, vegetables, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet tiene 26 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella vive en compañía de William, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Estefanía, Josue y Jean Carlos; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Usibamba, el trabajo continuo es su lema. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano prepara los alimentos que venderá en la escuela de su localidad. Donde hace 2 años abrió un pequeño negocio, en el cual vende golosinas, bebidas y comida casera a los alumnos y profesores que cada refrigerio visitan a Yanet. Cuenta que, fue difícil para ella, obtener el permiso para vender dentro de la institución, “pero nada es difícil si eres constante”, afirma. Al mismo tiempo y como mujer del campo; se dedica a la siembra de avena en terrenos de su comunidad, donde todos los fines de semana cuidan y fertiliza los campos para que den buena cosecha; que después venderá en la feria que se realiza, los días viernes en la ciudad de Chupaca. Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.  Yanet de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de golosinas para su negocio, además de semilla de avena para comenzar su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Yanet is 26 and a hard working woman. She lives with her husband of 10 years, William. They have three children, Estefanía, Josue y Jean Carlos. They care for their family in their own home, located in the Usibamba locality. 

“Constant work,” is their motto. Beginning very early every morning, she prepares food that she will sell at the nearby school. Two years ago she opened a small business selling candy, drinks, and homemade food to the students and teachers that visit Yanet every snack time. She says that it was hard for her to get permission to sell inside the school, but nothing is difficult if you are persistent, she adds. At the same time and as a woman of the countryside, she plants oats in the land by her community. Every weekend they care for and fertilize the field so that they have a good harvest. Afterwards, she will sell in the market that takes place on Fridays in the city of Chupaca. 

Now she wishes to work more diligently to improve her income. She belongs to the solidarity group “Usibamba,” and this is her third loan with MFP. She hopes to gain the support of all you to accomplish her goals. She commits to being punctual in her loan payments. With your support, Yanet will invest the money requested in the purchase of sweets for her business, in addition to oatmeal seeds to begin planning the field.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her sweets store and to purchase oat seeds.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Maria Rosario tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión  tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad Ollantaytambo  y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Maria Rosario es la venta de comida y tiene un restaurante turístico en su domicilio por las mañana sirve desayuno turístico, al medio día sirve almuerzo a turistas y nacionales,  y por las noche hace pizzas. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Maria Rosario requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceite, harina, queso y otras cosas más.
 
Maria Rosario agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
María Rosario belongs to the Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo communal bank, and the meetings of the bank members are every month in the city of Ollantaytambo, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

María Rosario, 29, is married and has one child from this relationship.  She was born in Ollantaytambo and lives in her native city, where she carries out her business.  Her main economic activity is selling food, and she has a restaurant for tourists in her home.  In the morning she serves breakfast to tourists, at noon she serves lunch to tourists and locals, and at night she makes pizza.  She has had this business for a year now and it's going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

María Rosario needs a loan now to buy supplies such as, for example, bags of rice, bags of sugar, oil, flour, cheese, and other things.

María Rosario is grateful for and values the loan, and she is committed to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, oil, flour, cheese, and other supplies

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 46 años de edad, reside junto con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la gran actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace muchos años Daniel se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sombreros, el material  que utiliza es la palma, una actividad que sus padres le enseñaron y a ido pasando de generación en generación,  cuenta con su propia clientela, también realiza sombreros a pedidos, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar su necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar materiales para seguir elaborando sus sombreros y cumplir con los pedidos que le han solicitado, por el buen trabajo que realiza sus ventas se han incrementado, lo que le permitirá que sus ganancias aumenten para  pagar su crédito otorgado y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel, 46, lives along with his wife and children in his own house, with water and electricity, in the urban area of the Bambamarca district in the department of Cajamarca.

Daniel has been making and selling hats for many years.  The material he uses is palm leaf, work that his parents taught him and that has been passed down from generation to generation.  He has his own customers and also makes hats on request.  With the earnings he makes, he will be able to pay for his daily household necessities.

He has requested a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy materials to continue making his hats and fill the orders that have been requested.  His sales have increased because of the good work he does.  This will allow him to make more income to pay back his loan and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to continue making his hats

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  is 54  years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has five children between 6 and 29 years old. Four are attending school and live at home while the older one is working and living on his own.

Her husband is a security man.

For the past three years she has been selling candy and biscuits in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy and biscuits for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more candy and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 13 integrantes en la ciudad de Encarnación, son parte de la fundación a partir del mes de junio, con excelente conducta de pago en todos los créditos que han solicitado. El comité tiene experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que hace un tiempo que trabajan juntas.
Una de las integrantes es Rita, ella tiene 54 años, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos. Es una señora que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, es la única en su familia que trabaja y genera ingreso en su hogar, por lo que se integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda comprar más Frutas y verduras para su mejor venta e ingreso.
Todas están conformes con el sistema de trabajo con la fundación y quieren seguir adelante con el mismo.
texts.en:
This committee has 13 members from the city of Encarnación.  They’ve been part of the Fundación since June.  They have excellent repayment behavior with all the loans they’ve requested.  The committee has experience in group work since they’ve been working together for some time now.

One of the members is Rita, 54.  She’s a single mother of five children.  She’s a woman who is a street vendor of fruit and vegetables.  She’s the only one in her family who works and generates income for the home which is why she joined her neighborhood’s group so that with help from Fundación Paraguaya she can buy more fruit and vegetables to improve sales and income.

All the members agree with the Fundación’s method of work and want to continue forward with it.

loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas, apples, pears and others for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Oscar Bonifacio

texts.es:
Oscar de 44 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Oscar desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cuenta 18 ovejas y 2 vacas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha cuenta con otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para la compra de más alimento balanceado y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con las ganancias que obtenga con ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  Oscar es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante, permitiendo que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 44, is single. He lives in his own home, which has electricity. It is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura department. The residents of this region work in agriculture, livestock, and handcrafts.

Oscar started raising and selling barnyard animals a few years ago. He has 18 sheep and 2 cows. The corrals, which are large and well-suited for the animals, are located in his backyard. He feeds them balanced food and natural fodder so that they will reach an optimal level of growth, so that he can sell them for a good price in the various markets in his region. This is how he covers his personal costs. He also has land where he sows lemons; this harvest provides him with additional income.

He has requested a loan of 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of more balanced food, and for fertilizers to improve his land. With his earnings from both activities, he will be able to pay off his loan and provide a better quality of life for his family. Oscar is a person who has been able to succeed and grow his business through hard work and determination.

loans.use: to buy more balanced food, and to buy fertilizers in order to improve his fertile land.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 32 años es una mujer sabia, vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Huayhua. Como mujer del campo, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino. Tiene 7 vacas, que le proporcionan 10 litros de leche diarios, con ello realiza queso para venderlos a los comercializadores que la visitan continuamente, pues conocen del buen queso que ella prepara. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia no solo en la ganadería también, en la agricultura, pues siembra maíz, papa, arveja y trigo en sus 6 parcelas de terreno productivo, los cuales cuida con mucho amor, “estar en el campo me gusta”, afirma contenta. Pero en temporada de buena cosecha, cuando la tierra da buenos frutos, ella lleva sus alimentos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde le pagan mayor precio y si tiene buen capital, aprovecha para comprar más vacas que engorda para luego venderlas, es así que siempre tiene ingreso, pues su lema es “invertir”. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San Miguel” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues es una mujer responsable. Carmen, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca de raza y varias ovejas.
texts.en: Carmen is 32 years old. She is a wise woman and lives with Luis, her husband of 10 years. They have 4 children, all minors, which they take care of in their own house which is located in the annex of Huayhua. As a countrywoman, she raises cattle and sheep. She has 7 cows which give her 7 litres of milk a day with which she makes cheese to sell to the marketers who are constantly at her door, as they know the quality of her cheese. She now has 10 years experience not only in livestock but also in agriculture, as she plants corn, potatoes, peas and wheat in her 6 plots of farmland, which she takes care of with love. "I like being in the countryside," she says happily. However, during a good harvest, when the soil bears good fruits, she takes her produce to the city of Huancayo, where they pay higher prices and if she has the capital she takes the opportunity to buy more cattle to fatten for subsequent sale. In this way, she always has income, as her motto is "invest". She belongs to the communal bank "San Miguel" and this is the 7th loan with MFP. She hopes to receive your support to achieve her goals. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her repayments as she is a responsible woman. Carmen, on receiving your support, will invest the money requested to buy a pedigree cow and several sheep.

loans.use: to buy a cow and several sheep.

loans.name: Regana

texts.en:
Regana is 25 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has two children 7 and 9 years old. They are in school and live at home.

For the past two years she has been selling rice and oil in the local market. She make a lot of profit and has a lot of customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. Her plan is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Tomas tiene 28 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Tomas es la venta de comida y tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado por las mañana sirve desayuno, al medio día sirve almuerzo y por las noche elabora pollos a la brasa con papitas fritas. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Tomas requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del local ya que se están acercandose la época de lluvias pues el techo esta con goteras.
 
Tomas agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Tomas belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo”. The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Tomas is 28 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which he has 2 children. He was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and lives in the same city he was born in and where he carries out his economic activities. Tomas' main business is selling food and he has a restaurant in a rented property. In the morning he serves breakfast, at noon lunch and in the evening he makes roasted chickens with chips. He has had the business for 3 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

This time Tomas needs the loan for building maintenance as the rainy season is fast approaching and the roof is leaking.

Tomas is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his repayments on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to carry out building maintenance.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité tiene 11 integrantes, el grupo tiene experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que hace un tiempo que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse D. las novedades del grupo y resolver sus diferencias.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Amalia, quien se dedica a la venta D. ropas. Dice que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tiene mucha variedad y eso agrada mucho a sus clientes. Tiene buena clientela, pero le gustaría poder seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. más prendas, como ser remeras, camisas, bermudas, jeans y otros, para que D. esa forma pueda atraer a más clientes.
Todas están conformes con el sistema D. trabajo con la fundación y quieren seguir adelante con el mismo.
texts.en:
The committee is maD. up of 11 members. The group has experience with working as a group, since they have been working together for some time. They get together every week to share, communicate and learn what's new with the group, and to resolve their differences. 

One of the members is Ms. Amalia, who devotes herself to selling clothes. She says it is going very well, since she always has a lot of variety and that pleases her customers very much. She has a good customer base but she would like to continue growing her business. Thus she is seeking the loan, in order to purchase more articles of clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, Bermuda shorts, jeans, and other items. In this way she hopes to attract more customers. 

All of them are happy with the foundation's working methods and want to continue on with their current arrangements.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, shirts, bermuda shorts, jeans and other items.

loans.name: Kiswaras De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KISWARAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Severina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de papa, compra y venta de ganado, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, tienda de material de construcción, venta de colchones, venta de chuño, venta de mantas.

La señora Severina  indica es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio compra y venta de ganado que viene trabajando desde años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de vaca lechera la misma será adquirida de su comunidad y posteriormente criará y comercializará la leche a las fábricas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tienen dos hijos.
texts.en:
A.C. “KISWARAS DE PALCOCO" will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro de Copacabana. It consists of 10 members and is lead by a board headed by Señora Severina, The members of the communal bank have various businesses among which are: food sales; potato sales; the purchase and sale of livestock; food sales; neighbourhood store; building materials store; mattress sales; sale of potato flour; sale of blankets.

Señora Severina says that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, as she was invited to join by a promoter. Currently she has a business buying and selling livestock which she has run for many years, learning the trade from her family.

The loan she will now take is to purchase a dairy cow which she will buy in the area and subsequently raise to sell the milk produced to the factories. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es:
José de 24 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   En la cual los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

José se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco, el mismo que vende por las calles de la zona donde vive, tiene su propia clientela que le compra por la buena calidad de su producto, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar su gastos diarios de su familia.  Su esposa cría y comercializa aves de corral y así tienen otra ayuda económica para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más pescado fresco y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  José desea que su negocio crezca cada vez más para brindarle más comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
24-year-old José lives in his own house with his wife and children. They do not have all the basic services, as they are located in a rural area in the district of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura. In this area the inhabitants are involved in agriculture, livestock and artisanal activities.

José buys and sells fresh fish, which he sells in the streets in the area where he lives. He has his own customers that buy from him, because of the good quality of his product. With the income he obtains, he is able to meet the daily expenses of his family. His wife raises and sells poultry, and in this way they have another source of income for the household.

He has requested a loan of 500 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more fresh fish and balanced feed for their poultry, which will allow him to increase his income in order to be able to pay for the loan and improve the quality of life for his family. José desires that his business grows more and more to provide more commodities for his family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and balanced feed for their poultry.

loans.name: Olga Oliva

texts.es:
Olga tiene 47 años, vive sola en Pimampiro que se encuentra a una hora de Ibarra en la Provincia de   Imbabura-Ecuador. Olga se describe como una persona responsable, trabajadora y emprendedora.

Olga trabaja sola en la profesión de corte y confección, ella elabora toda prenda de vestir para niños y adultos. Es su décimo crédito con Fodemi el mismo que va a ocupar invirtiendo en la compra de una máquina de cocer ya que la actual está en malas condiciones y no le deja cumplir bien su trabajo y es su única herramienta para generar producción; con esta inversión auemntaría su productividad optimizando su tiempo y así generará mayores ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es poder tener un local grande, con unas 10 máquinas y poder emplear a personal para que su negocio se convierta en una gran miroempresa de confeción de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Olga’s 47 years old and lives alone in Pimampiro which is located an hour away from Ibarra in Imbabura Province, Ecuador.  She describes herself as a responsible, hardworking and enterprising person.  Olga works by herself as a dressmaker.  She makes all kinds of articles of clothing for children and adults.  

This is her 10th loan with Fodemi that she’ll use to buy  a sewing machine because the one she has is in poor condition and does not let her do her work well and is her only work tool to generate production.  With this investment she’ll increase productivity organizing her time to generate increased income.  Her dream is to have a large locale with ten sewing machines and to be able to hire personnel so that her business will become a large clothes making micro business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 37 años es una mujer buena y trabajadora. Vive junto a Lorenzo, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Yadisano, Richard y Renzo en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Huayhua. Como mujer joven, ella se dedica a varias actividades económicas. Su principal fuente de ingreso es la agricultura, ya tiene 18 años de experiencia en el cultivo y cuidado de los alimentos que produce la tierra. Sus principales cultivos son avena, alfalfa, papa y maíz, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Le va bien en su negocio, pero afirma que aún le falta mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas, “necesito más capital de trabajo”, asegura. Por ello su meta es obtener mejores ganancias para invertirlo en su producción. Sabe que lo logrará, pues también se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 6 vacas que producen la leche que le sirve para realizar “bolillos” (quesos pequeños), asimismo, alquila una parcela de sembrío de alfalfa a terceras personas que le pagan un dinero extra, ya que necesitan para la alimentación de sus animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San Miguel” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera su apoyo financiero para concretar sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en todas sus cuotas. Marina, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
Marina, 37, is a good, hardworking woman.  She lives with Lorenzo, her husband of ten years.  They have five children but only three still live with them in their own house located in Anexo de Huayhua: Yadislao, Richard and Renzo.  As a young woman she carries out several economic activities.  Her main source of income is farming.  She has 18 years’ experience growing and caring for the food her land produces.  Her main crops are oats, alfalfa, potatoes and corn that she grows on her own farmland.  She does well in her business but she affirms that she still needs to improve the quality of her harvests; “I need more working capital,” she assures.  Because of this, her goal is to earn better profits to invest in production.  She knows she’ll reach it because she also raises cattle.  She has six cows that produce the milk used to make “bolillos” (small cheeses) and she also leases a piece of land to others for alfalfa farming who pay her extra money because they need to feed their animals.

She belongs to the “San Miguel” communal bank and this is her 7th MFP loan where she hopes to get your financial support to reach her goals.  In addition, she commits to be punctual with her payments.  IF Marina were to receive support from you, she will use the requested money to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among her next potato crops.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha Maura

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha, tiene  37 años, es madre de 3 hijos, y socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años.
Martha trae frutas y verduras y vende en el mercado, se siente exitosa con todo lo que ha logrado con su ahorro, gracias a ello pudo construir su casa, con las capacitaciones pudo aprender como trabajar correctamente, educo a sus hijos de manera correcta. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de frutas y su meta es poder comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Martha’s a member of the “Urpicha” communal bank.  She’s 37 years old and the mother of three children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for two years.

Martha brings fruit and vegetables to the market to sell.  She feels successful with everything she’s attained with her savings.  Thanks to it she was able to build her house and with the training she learned how to work correctly and educated her children in the correct way.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy fruit.  Her goal is to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Jesús  tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera. Ella tiene 3 hijos, con las edades de 9, 20 y 22 años. Su hija mayor está casada y vive en su propio hogar. Doña Jesús vive en San Pedro Sula con sus dos hijos menores.  

 Doña Jesús es comerciante ambulante y vende ropa usada y adornos para el hogar. Ella también lo hace por encargo. Inicio su negocio motivada por la necesidad de conseguir ingresos que le permitieran cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos (alimentación, vestuario y educación). 

El capital semilla que ha invertido en su negocio, lo ha obtenido de personas prestamistas cuyos intereses son extremadamente altos. Manifiesta que ha sido muy difícil su situación económica, ya que como madre soltera no ha tenido el apoyo del padre de sus hijos.

Doña Jesús comenta que es su primera experiencia con financiamiento en una institución formal como ODEF. 
Piensa invertir su préstamo en surtir más su negocio con la compra de ropa, carteras y adornos,  ya que a veces tiene dificultades para suplir la demanda de algunos clientes que le solicitan mercadería de la cual ella no dispone. 

Su meta a futuro es aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 42, is a single mother.  She has three children; ages 9, 20, and 22.  Her oldest daughter is married and lives in her own home.  Jesús lives in San Pedro Sula with her two minor children.

Jesús is an itinerant merchant.  She sells used clothes and decorations for the home.  She also does this by order.  She was motivated to start the business by the necessity of getting income that would allow her to cover her children’s basic necessities (food, clothing, and education).

She got the seed money that she has invested in her business from lenders whose interest was extremely high.  She states that her financial situation has been very difficult.  As a single mother she has not had the support of the father of her children.

Jesús comments that this is her first loan experience with a formal institution like ODEF.  She plans on using her loan to better stock her business.  She will buy clothes, wallets, and decorations.  At times she has difficulties meeting the demand of some customers who request merchandise that she does not have.

Her goal for the future is to increase sales and to get greater income in order to improve her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to better stock her store by purchasing clothes, wallets, and decorations.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas se denomina un buen grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Itá, gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Reinalda contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el quinto ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Reinalda se dedica a la venta D. comidas D. todo tipo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, ya que según ellos mismos, la señora cocina muy bien. Gracias a su negocio pueD. ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y darle a su familia las condiciones mínimas para una vida digna y decorosa. En vista D. que le va muy bien, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. carne, fideos, condimentos, verduras y otros, los cuales son los ingredientes esenciales D. sus comidas.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas (Active Women) is a group of good women formed in the city of Itá.  It was formed thanks to the efforts of Sra. Reinalda, the current president.  She contacted the loan counselor during a weekly meeting of Fundacion Paraguaya that the organization was having in the area.  Once she approached the foundation’s counseling office, Sra. Reinalda succeeded in bringing together 17 women whom she had met.  They work together comfortably with unity and solidarity and are already in the 5th loan cycle working within the program.

Sra. Reinalda is engaged in the sale of meals of all types.  She says that she has many customers since, according to them, she cooks very well.  Thanks to her business she is able to help with household expenses and give her family the minimum conditions for a dignified and proper life.  

Since things are going well she wants to continue investing in her business.  That’s why she is applying for a loan in order to purchase meat, noodles, condiments, vegetables, and other foods which are essential ingredients of her meals.

loans.use: to purchase meat, noodles, condiments, vegetables, and other foods.

loans.name: Clara Judith

texts.es:
Clara tiene 23 años D. edad, esta separada D. su compañero D. vida con dos hijos.

Ella se dedica a trabajar desD. hace un año, en una tortillería, ganando $3.00 dólares diarios, desD. las 6:00 D. la mañana hasta las 12:00 del mediodía. Después, sale a vender pan dulce D. casa en casa. Clara viaja tres veces por semana durante treinta minutos, a una ciudad del oriente del país a comprar el pan dulce.

Clara solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar cerdos y destazarlos, luego, salir a vender la casa D. casa en casa. Este era el negocio que su abuela le enseño desD. niña; también, invertirá en la compra D. mayor variedad D. pan dulce, porque por falta D. dinero no ofrece variedad D. pan dulce.

D. esta manera, clara tendrá su propio negocio, y comprara a mejor precio el pan dulce, ya que cuando compra poquito lo adquiere a mayor precio. A demás, se satisfará la demanda D. sus clientes y recibirá mejores ingresos. Los cuales le servirán para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos.

Ella ahorrara, para construirles una casa a sus hijos, ya que están viviendo en casa D. su abuela.
texts.en:
Clara is 23 years old and is separated from her life companion with two children. 

For a year now she has devoted herself to working at a tortilla shop, earning $3.00 dollars a day, from 6 a.m. until 12 noon. Afterwards she goes out to sell pastries door-to-door. Clara travels for thirty minutes three times a week to a city in the eastern part of the country to purchase the pastries. 

Clara is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo in order to purchase pigs and butcher them, then to go out and sell the meat door-to-door. This was the business her grandmother taught her when she was a child. She will also invest in the purchase of a greater variety of pastries, because owing to a lack of money she does not offer a variety of pastries. 

In this way Clara will have her own business, and will purchase the pastries at a better price, since when she buys in small amounts it carries a higher price. Furthermore she will satisfy her customers' demand, and bring in a better income, which will help her improve her children's quality of life. 

She will save in order to build a house for her children, since they are living in her grandmother's house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and butcher them, and also to purchase a greater variety of pastries.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
María  de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con una pequeña tienda instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y otros. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad trata de solventar sus gastos económicos y ayudar a su familia.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos comestibles para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes en su consumo diario, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea cada vez más grande y tenga productos surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. María es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles lo mejor a su familia y ayudarlos alcanzar su ideales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

For several years she’s had a small store at home.  She sells to her neighbors and customers from the zone various daily use products like staple goods and others.  She has an established clientele and no nearby competition.  She tries to cover expenses and help her family through this business.

To be able to stock her store she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more groceries to stock the store and meet customer daily needs.  Her only wish is that her business is larger every day and to have the products her customers want in stock.  María is a responsible, hardworking person who strives to provide the best for her family and help her children reach their dreams.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store and to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Juana; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. comida,ella prepara pollo al horno,estofado D. pollo,saltado entre otras comidas,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,azucar,pollo y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: Juana is a retail merchant.  She’s still selling food.  She makes roasted chicken, chicken stew and stir-fried chicken, among other dishes.  She wants to expand and improve the food sales business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, sugar, chicken and vegetables.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meal preparation like rice, sugar, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Yovana Blanca

texts.es: La señora Yovana vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, que debido a cuestiones de trabajo  que el se encuentra de viaje, no tienen hijos por el momento que después ya piensan en agrandar la familia, la cliente se dedica a la venta de comida y venta de abarrotes el cual funciona en el mismo domicilio, ya que tiene su tienda de barrio el crédito esta destinado a la compra de un frízer para que la cliente pueda vender refrescos y cerveza y así poder generar mayores ingresos, gracias a la venta de comida la señora Yovana pudo implementar su actual tienda de abarrotes para generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yovana lives in the Plan 3000 zone in her own house with her husband who is traveling due to work.  They do not have any children at present although they do plan to enlarge the family in the future. 

She sells prepared food and groceries at home where she has a small neighborhood grocery store.  The loan will be used to buy a beverage refrigerator so that she can sell beer and soft-drinks to generate higher income.  Thanks to the food sales, Yovana was able to set up her grocery store to generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy a beverage cooler.

loans.name: Ysidro

texts.es: Ysidro, de 33 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Elva su esposa, ambos tienen 2 hijos: Kevin y Gisella; a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Quebrada Imperial Acostambo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador y responsable. Junto a su esposa, se dedican a la siembra de maca en cantidad, cuenta con 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola; donde siembra diversos productos de temporada, pero lo que le brinda mayores ganancias, es la comercialización de maca. Aprovechando la demanda piensa sembrar 4 kilos de semilla. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo, por ello se dedica a trabajos eventuales como peón en diferentes cosechas, donde recolecta el alimento en costales. Además su esposa le apoya con la crianza de ganado vacuno, que le brinda leche con lo que elabora queso y así obtiene una ganancia extra. Ahora espera con ansias la temporada de cosecha, pues está seguro que tendrá mucho éxito. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los puquiales” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Ysidro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de maca.
texts.en:
Ysidro, 33, is a hardworking man.  He lives with Elva, his wife.  They have two children, Kevin and Gisella, who they care for in their own house located in Anexo de Quebrada Imperial, Acostambo.  He is characterized as being a hardworking, responsible man.  Together with his wife they farm maca root in quantity.  He has two hectares of farmland where she grows seasonal products but the one that is the most profitable is the maca root.  Taking advantage of demand, he plans to plant 4 kilos of seeds.  His main difficulty is the lack of working capital and this is why he works as a temporary worker in various harvests reaping fruit into sacks.  In addition, his wife helps him raising cattle that produce milk that she uses to make cheese thus earning extra income.  He is now anxiously awaiting harvest season because he’s sure he’ll be very successful.

He belongs to the “Los Puquiales” communal bank and this is his 10th MFP loan.  He’s very happy to know that he’ll have financial support because he’ll feel sure that he’ll be able to make headway with his work.  He promises to be punctual with his payments.  If Ysidro were to receive your support, he will use the requested money to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer for his next maca root planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Gregoria Ccasani

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, es socia D. Finca Peru desD. hace 16 años. Gregoria venD. chicha y jugo D. naranja, antes vendía fruta en un mercado, con la ayuda D. los préstamos reibidos se compró un triciclo y posteriormente compró parlantes para alquilar.
Gregoria pudo obtener muchas cosas gracias a los préstamos, esta muy agradecida porque le enseñaron muchas cosas, tales como aumentar su negocio, como poder tener una buena relación familiar, todos estos años que es socia aprendió a querer mucho a Finca y se siente parte D. esta familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. maíz, azúcar.
texts.en:
Gregoria’s a member of the “Lirio” communal bank and a member of Finca Perú for the last 16 years.  Gregoria sells chicha [beverage maD. from corn] and orange juice.  She used to sell fruit in the market.  With help from the loans she got she was able to buy a three-wheel cart and later on bought loudspeakers to lease.

Gregoria was able to acquire many things thanks to the loans. She’s very grateful because they taught her many things like how to increase business and have better family relations.  In all the years she’s been a member she’s grown to love Finca very much and she feels like she’s part of a family.  The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy corn and sugar.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar.

loans.name: Py Renda Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través D. la Sra. Romelia, quien se había acercado hasta la Oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más al respecto del  Programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo D. vida, son 15 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. 
La señora Romelia se dedica a la venta D. mercería, allí venD. todo tipo D. artículos, como zapatillas, perfumes, artículos para regalos y demás. Ya que su negocio está muy bien surtido atrae a muchos clientes, lo cual consecuentemente le trae buenos ingresos. Desea poder seguir abasteciendo su negocio por lo que solicita el crédito, ya que quiere comprar zapatillas, perfumes, artículos para regalos y otros.
Agradece a kiva y a la fundación por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues es una gran oportunidad D. seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This committee was created through Ms. Romelia, who had approached the Office of the Fundación Paraguaya in order to familiarize herself with the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program. She invited her friends and companions from the neighborhood and they decided to join the group effort to get ahead and so improve their lifestyle. They are comprised of 15 hardworking and humble women who must earn a living every day. 

Ms. Romelia devotes herself to selling supplies. There she sells all manner of items such as sneakers, clothing, perfumes and other things. Since her business is well-stocked it attracts many customers, which consequently brings her a good income. She wishes to be able to keep her business going and so she is seeking the loan. She wants to buy sneakers, clothing, perfumes and other items. 

She thanks Kiva and the foundation for the opportunity they afford her, since it is a great chance to keep growing.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, perfumes, gift items, and more

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, es socias D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 12 años. 
Andrea tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, antes elL. era feriante, junto con finca pudo cambiar D. negocio, gracias a sus ahorros y préstamos recibidos pudo techar su casa y poder crecer como negociante, esta muy agradecida por las capacitaciones que recibe porque le ayudan mucho a poder ser mejor madre y negociante, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. azúcar, leche y arroz, ahora su meta es poder terminar el segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Andrea’s a member of the “Lirio” communal bank.  She’s 47 years old and has four children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 12 years.  Andrea has a grocery store.  She used to be a street market merchant but together with Finca was able to change her business.  

Thanks to her savings and to the loans she obtained she was able to roof her house and grow as a merchant.  She is very grateful for the training she gets because it helps her very much to be a better mother and businesswoman.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy sugar, milk and rice.  Her goal now is to finish the second story on her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and rice.

loans.name: Teresa Amparo

texts.es:
Teresa de 52 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algún tiempo Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta de helados y gelatinas congeladas en vasos en su domicilio, sus clientes son las personas que viven cerca su casa, además puede atender a sus clientes a lo hora que sea, con los ingresos que obtengan podrá solventar sus necesidades personales.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para preparar sus helados, gelatina y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral, para seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes y con las ganancias poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Teresa con trabajo y empuje a logrado salir adelante poco a poco.
texts.en:
Teresa, 52, is single and lives in her own house which only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

For some time now Teresa has been making ice-cream and frozen gelatin to sell in glasses at home.  Her customers are people who live near her house and she’s able to take care of her customers at any time.  With income earned she’s able to cover her personal needs.  She also raises barnyard fowl to sell.

She’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new sol loan to buy ice-cream making ingredients, gelatin and nutritionally balanced barnyard fowl feed to continue to offer them to her customers.  With profits obtained she will be able to repay the loan and improve her standard of living.  With work and effort Teresa has been able to get ahead little by little.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream making supplies, gelatin and nutritionally balanced barnyard fowl feed.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Honorata; la socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos  la socia actualmente se esta dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella cambio de negocio porque no le daba muchos ingresos la picanteria y con la tienda de abarrotes gana un poco mas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia requiere el crédito para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche,fideos y galletas al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Señora Honorata, is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has 2 children and currently makes her living by running a grocery store. She changed businesses because the picantería (traditional Peruvian restaurant) did not provide much income; with the grocery store, she earns a little more. Through this business, the member gives her children a good start in life. She wants to expand and improve her grocery store business. She needs the loan to purchase products for the grocery store like rice, sugar, milk, noodles and cookies at wholesale. 

She is happy about the loan and commits to meet her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and cookies at wholesale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 niños, y esta en Finca desde hace 4 años. 
Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella empezó con poco capital, con Finca ella fue creciendo, y ahora le va muy bien en su tienda de abarrotes, pudo obtener una computadora, y aumentar su negocio, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder administrar mejor su negocio y su vida familiar, ahora el préstamo lo dividirá en la compra de Azúcar, arroz, fideos que es lo que mas vende y también comprará leña. Ahora su meta es poder techar el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel, a member of the Lirio Communal Bank, is 38 years old and the mother of 3 children. She has been with Finca for some 4 years.

Isabel has a grocery store. She began with little capital but with Finca, she has been growing, and now, things are going very well in her grocery store. She has been able to get a computer and expand the store. The training she receives has helped her to better administer the business and her family life.

This loan will be divided between purchasing sugar, rice, and beans, which is what she sells most, and also, buying firewood.

Now her goal is to be able to put a roof on the 2nd story of her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and beans for her store, and to install a roof over her house.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres se reunieron en la oficina regional de fundación paraguaya de la ciudad de Paraguarí para informarse acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y ya que les gustó la idea decidieron organizarse y de allí surge el comité  que lleva por nombre Renacer, debido a que el grupo renació al dejar atrás problemas que se generaron en el grupo en un momento dado pero gracias a la unidad del mismo pudieron superarlo, ellas se han comprometido en mantener unido el grupo y trabajar con responsabilidad mutua. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Emiliana, la cual tiene una peluquería bien equipada. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada, lo que la ayuda a mantener su negocio. Dice que tanto hombres como mujeres van junto a ella y siempre vuelven debido a su buen trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, tintes, enjuagues, maquillajes y otros, los cuales son los insumos necesarios para su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad de progreso que tiene.
texts.en:
Fifteen women met at the regional office of the Fundación Paraguaya of the city of Paraguarí to learn about the entrepreneurial women's program, and since the idea pleased them they decided to organize themselves and thus the committee came about. It has as its name Renacer [Rebirth], since the group was reborn upon leaving behind problems which were generated in the group at a particular moment, but thanks to their group-mindedness they were able to overcome it. They have committed themselves to keeping the group together and working together with shared responsibility. 

One of the members is Ms. Emiliana who owns a well-equipped hair salon. She comments that she has a well-formed customer base which helps her keep up her business. She says that men as well as women come to her and they always come back owing to her good work. 

She is seeking the loan for the purchase of shampoo, hair dyes, conditioners, makeup, and other items, which are the supplies required by her business. She thanks the foundation for this opportunity for progress that she has.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair dyes, conditioners, makeup and other items.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis de 32 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Luis desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Luis es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old and lives in his parents' house with his family. The house has electric service only. It is located in Tambogrande district, pertaining to Piura department. The zone is dedicated to agriculture, livestock-raising, and artisan production.

For some years now, Luis has been raising and selling corral animals (sheep and farm foul). His corrals are located at the back of his house, and they are ample and appropriate. He feeds the animals with the proper feed formulas so that they will have optimal growth, and he can sell them in the zone's different markets and obtain good earnings to pay his family's expenses.

Luis is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols to buy more livestock and their respective feed. With the earnings he will obtain through the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as enjoy a better quality of life. Luis is a person who with effort and much enterprise has been able to advance his family, despite life's difficulties.

loans.use: to buy more farm animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 23 años, vive con su madre en Ibarra que es la Capital de la Provincia de Imbabura en el Norte del Ecuador. Jorge se describe como una persona alegre, tranquila, paciente y muy trabajadora.

Jorge trabaja junto con su madre en la venta de ropa, en un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que será invertido en la compra de mercadería como es camisetas, calentadores, ropa interior, etc, que le servirá para incrementar los productos en su negocio y sus clientes tengan variedad para escojer y así generará buenos ingresos económicos que le servirá para ayudarle a su madre.

Jorge sueña con tener una casa propia y tener un local grande de ropa.
texts.en:
Jorge is 23 years old and lives with his mother in Ibarra, the capital of Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.  Jorge describes himself as a cheerful, calm, patient and very hard-working person.

Jorge works together with his mother selling clothes on a stall in the town market.  This is the first loan that he has requested from Fodemi.  He will invest it in buying merchandise such as t-shirts, legwarmers, underwear, etc. which will help him to increase the products that he sells and his customers will have a wider variety of products from which to choose.  This will make him good income which he will use to help his mother.

Jorge dreams of owning his own home and having a large clothes store.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, legwarmers and underwear to increase his business

loans.name: Amanda Sonia

texts.es:
Amanda es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, tiene 41 años, es madre de 2 hijos, esta en Finca desde hace 3 años.
Amanda es dueña de un recreo, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable y a tener autoestima a valorarse asi misma y a su familia, en los momentos mas difíciles de su vida estuvieron alli para apoyarla, a raiz de la muerte de uno de sus hijos, ella de desanimo mucho, pero las capacitaciones le ayudaron mucho a poder seguir adelante.
Amanda se siente realizada por todo lo que pudo construir. Ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y bebidas. Uno de sus mayores metas es poder tener una sucursal.
texts.en:
Amanda is a member of the Lirio Communal Bank. She is 41 years old and a mother of 2 children. She has been with FINCA for the past 3 years. 

Amanda is the owner of a café. Thanks to the trainings she received in her Communal Bank, she learned to be responsible, have self-esteem to appreciate herself and her family. In the most difficult moments of her life, they were there to support her. Due to the death of one of her children, she became very depressed, but the trainings greatly helped her to continue moving forward.

Amanda feels fulfilled because of everything she has been able to build. Now she will invest the loan that she is taking in the purchase of tables and drinks. One of her main goals is to be able to have an additional location.

loans.use: to purchase tables and drinks.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy, de 30 años es un hombre responsable y alegre. A pesar de los constantes problemas que afrontó, no se desanima. Al contrario lucha por salir adelante, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huaycha. Hace un año murió su madre, que fue su única compañera. A pesar de ello continúa trabajando sin descanso, pues desea salir adelante y lograr sus objetivos. Hace 4 años que comenzó a sembrar papa, maíz y pasto en sus 4 parcelas de terreno productivo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es tener que tomar decisiones sabias e importantes, como cuando la plaga llega a malograr sus cultivos, necesita curar y limpiar sus cultivos durante todo el día. ”Eso lo aprendí de mi madre”, comenta. Además ya es conocido entre los comerciantes de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende sus cosechas. Pero como es un hombre responsable y con muchas ambiciones. También se dedica a la crianza de vacas, ya tiene 3 de buena calidad y espera incrementar su ganado, pues quiere dedicarse a la elaboración de productos lácteos en cantidad. Asimismo se dedica a la construcción de casas como albañil, así obtiene un dinero extra. Él pertenece al banco comunal “San Miguel” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, pues en su asociación la responsabilidad es importante. Percy de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para esparcirlo en su próximo sembrío de papa de la variedad “amarilla y blanca”.
texts.en:
30-year-old Percy is a responsible and cheerful man.  In spite of the constant problems he has faced, he has not been discouraged.  On the contrary, he works hard to get ahead in life.  He lives in his own home which is located in the town of Huaycha.  One year ago his mother, who was his only companion, died.  In spite of this, he continues working without rest as he would like to get ahead and achieve his goals.  He started sowing potatoes, corn and fodder on his four plots of farmland four years ago.  What he most enjoys about his work is having to take wise and important decisions such as when pests ruin his crops and he needs to care for and clean his crops all day long. "I learned this from my mother", he comments.  In addition, Percy is well known among the traders in the city of Huancayo where he sells his harvests.  He is a responsible man with many ambitions and he also raises cows.  He has three good-quality cows and he hopes to increase the size of his herd as he would like to start producing dairy products in bulk.  At the same time, he also works as a builder, building houses which makes him extra money.

Percy is a member of the 'San Miguel' community bank and this is his seventh loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you so that he can achieve his goals.  For his part, Percy pledges to be punctual in making his loan repayments as, in his association, responsibility is important.  With your support, Percy will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over the next lot of 'amarilla' (yellow) and 'blanca' (white) potatoes he sows.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell cleaning products and clothing.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio  se sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria metalica,el realiza puertas,ventanas y techos en metal,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de carpinteria metalica .El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fierros para realizar los trabajos de carpinteria metalica.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member has a metalworking business.  He makes metal doors, windows and roofs.  He works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, he provides for his children.  He would like to expand his metalworking business and is requesting this loan to buy iron with which to carry out his work.  

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy iron for his metalworking business

loans.name: José Candelario

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 72 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, que es empleada domestica y un hijo de 13 años de edad, que estudia séptimo grado y una hija de 10 años de edad, que estudia quinto grado. Ellos viven en casa propia, construida de adobe con techo de teja.

Él es pensionado, desde sus 25 años de edad, ya que laboro para una empresa, donde se desempeño como obrero de maquinas estiradotas, cumpliendo con la labor de deshilar la penca del henequén, para luego pasarlas a las hiladoras.

En los últimos 17 años, José se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, siembra normalmente 7000 metros cuadrados, produciendo 40 quintales de maíz (4000 libras), también, trabaja como jornal devengando un salario de $5.00 dólares al día. A pesar de su edad, tiene la suficiente fuerza para realizar trabajos de campo.

La compra de los insumos agrícolas y la venta de su cosecha, las realiza en la ciudad, esta se encuentra a cinco kilómetros de su comunidad, se trasporta en autobús y en la palangana de un carro.

El prestamos será invertido, en la cancelación de un crédito vigente en Fundación Campo, y el resto será para pagar mano de obra de la cosecha de maíz y pago de la maquina desgranadora. La producción que espera don José es de 20 quintales (200 libras) de maíz, resultado de la siembra de media manzana (3500 metros cuadrados) de cultivo. De esta forma él venderá su producción a buen precio, ya que la producción agrícola fue poca, además evitara que le roben el maíz en el campo de cultivo.
 
Don José posee dos terrenos, y desea construirle una vivienda a cada uno de sus hijos, que ellos puedan estudiar como mínimo bachillerato, para que puedan trabajar y sostenerse económicamente, enseñándoles el trabajo de la agricultura y por supuesto inculcarles valores morales como la honradez, responsabilidad y amor al prójimo.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 72 and lives with his life companion who works as a domestic servant, his 13 year old son, who is in seventh grade, and his 10 year old daughter, who is in fifth grade. They live in their own home, built of adobe with a tile roof.

He is retired. From the time he was 25, he worked for a business operating a sisal fiber extractor, which involved scraping the leaves of the sisal plant before sending them to the spinners.

For the past 17 years, José has cultivated corn, normally planting 7,000 sq. meters and producing 40 hundredweights (4,000 pounds). He also works as a day laborer, earning a salary of $5 a day. Despite his age, he has enough energy to work in the fields.

He purchases farming supplies and sells his crop in the city, which is about five kilometers from his neighborhood. He uses the bus or the bed of a truck for transportation.

The loan will be invested in paying off an outstanding loan with Fundación Campo with the remainder used to pay a work force to harvest his corn crop and to pay for the threshing machine. Sr. José expects to harvest 20 hundredweights (2,000 pounds) of corn from planting half a manzana of land (3,500 sq. meters). Consequently, he will sell his crop at a good price since corn production was low this year. In addition, he will avoid having the corn stolen from his fields.

Sr. José has two lots and wants to build houses for each one of his children so they can study at least through high school, and can work and support themselves economically. He is teaching them how to farm and, of course, inculcating in them moral values such as honesty, responsibility and love for their neighbors.

loans.use: to pay off an outstanding loan from Fundación Campo, with the remainder used to pay a work force to harvest his corn and to pay for the threshing machine.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Yolanda tiene 31 años de edad y es casada tiene fruto de eta linda relación tienen cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Yolanda es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras más. Yolanda tiene una tienda de abarrotes y esta implementada con necesidades básicas. 

 Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria como productos de primera ósea sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y muchas cosas más. 
  
Yolanda agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the 'Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo' community bank.  The bank's meetings take place once a month in the town of Ollantaytambo, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Yolanda is 31 years old, married, and has four children from this beautiful relationship.  She was born in the town of Ollantaytambo and lives in the town in which she was born.  This is also where she carries out her business activities.  Yolanda's main business activity is selling basic household products such as rice, sugar, etc.  She has a grocery store which is stocked with basic products.

Yolanda has been in this business for one year and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Yolanda needs a loan to buy basic household products (bags of rice, bags of sugar and many other products).  She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy basic household products for her store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Paulina; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia ahora se dedica al negocio de venta de vinos,ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes instituciones o al publico en general,ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de vinos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vinos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina is 35 years old and lives with her partner.  Her current business is selling wine.  She makes her sales independently, taking her products to different institutions or selling to the general public.  She sells from 9.00am to 5.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her children.  Paulina would like to expand and improve her wine sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy wine wholesale.

Paulina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wine wholesale

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es: Teodocia, de 42 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de Félix, su esposo desde hace 22 años.
