Con esta inversión espera darle un mejor mantenimiento a su siembra de frijoles , sacar una producción con buenos rendimientos y calidad que permita cubrir costos mejorar las ganancias, pues su próxima meta es sembrar papas y expandir el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Lesther is a young farmer who is 23 years of age. He is married and originally from Estelí. Lesther grow beans and potatoes in the community of La Quebrada. He only completed school through the third grade since his parents were not able to continue paying for his studies because of the poverty-stricken conditions in which they lived. Lesther decided to work with his family so that they could continue to feed themselves each day. When he reached the age of 18, he started planting his own potato crops. His first sale consisted of 50 quintales (1 quintal = 46 kg) of potatoes and he reinvested his profits into another crop of potatoes. Once he got married, his wife was able to help him.

Lesther is requesting a loan for planting beans and potatoes, so he will buy compost, supplies, and seed potatoes. He expects this investment will provide better maintenance for his crop of beans, which will lead to a high yield and good quality production. The improved earnings will help him to cover his expenses because his next goal is to plant more potatoes and expand his sowing area.

loans.use: to buy compost, supplies, and seeds for planting potatoes and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Adama.  She is married to a businessman, and has two children aged 8 and 4 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to attend school and also help with domestic work. 

 In 2006, Adama established her imported foodstuffs business. She began her business because she did not have anyone to help her continue her education because her parents are poor.  She stated selling doughnut cakes.  She saved Le 700,000 then changed her business into foodstuffs on a small scale, and she has improved over one year into a larger business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  

Adama has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase Irish Potatoes - 10 bags @ Le170,000, Onions - 5 bags @ Le90,000, Vinky Eggs - 10 cartons @ Le180,000, with the balance Le 50,000 being for transport. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Adama plans to build a dwelling house for her family. She wants her children to have a good living and education.     She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Irish Potatoes - 10 bags @ Le170,000, Onions - 5 bags @ Le90,000, Vinky Eggs - 10 cartons @ Le180,000 and the balance, Le50,000, is for transport.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Ibrahim.  He is single and has no children.   In 2001, Ibrahim established his underwear's and ladies bras. He began his business because he used to sell with his father after school hours.  He lost his father during the war and there was no sponsorship for his schooling.  He engaged himself in working for a Lebanese and he accumulated his salary and decided to start a business with the intention of going back to school. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,012,000 every month from this business.  

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. He requires a loan in order to purchase the following items - Boxers - 1 bale @ Le1,700,000, Underwear - 1 bale @ Le1,400,000 and Ladies' Bras - 1 bale @ Le1,400,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  

In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a house, marry and further his education to earn a degree. He serves 15 customers each day, and his business is popular because he has good quality items. He has no employee; he is only assisted by his younger brother.  His suppliers are located in Freetown.  He transports his goods by public transport a least three times a month.  He reinvests his profit into the business.   He is honest and dedicated to his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase the following items - Boxers - 1 bale @ Le1,700,000, Underwear - 1 bale @ Le1,400,000 and Ladies' Bras - 1 bale @ Le1,400,000.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chicken.

loans.name: Sector 3 Esquinas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector 3 Esquinas está formado por siete socias quienes trabajan en actividades del campo, trabajos que heredaron de sus padres y ahora les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares, también mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus ancestros y se caracterizan por ser personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido. Viven por comunidades aledañas al cantón de Nabon (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, su gente joven laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferente plazas de trabajo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosita Mercedes, tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de su unión  conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosita Mercedes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa cría y vende animales como gallinas, borregos y cuyes. También trabaja labrando sus terrenos en donde siembra hortalizas y verduras a las que las vende en su comunidad o en el mercado.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y pollos.
 
Su meta es tener un criadero de pollos grande para vender en las pollerías de la ciudad
texts.en:
The communal bank Sector 3 Esquinas is made up of seven female members who work in the field. They inherited this work from their parents and it now allows them to contribute to the finances of their home. They also maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors and are characterized by being kind people with a warm heart. They live in the neighboring communities of the canton of Nabon (Cuenca). This area has a cold climate and its people make a living farming, raising animals, and its young people work in the city of Cuena doing different kinds of work.

One of the members of this group is Rosita Mercedes. She is 36 years old and married, and as a fruit of her married life, she has conceived 4 children of the ages 13, 11, 9, and 5. Her first two children study in secondary school and her last two children in primary school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and the home in which they live is their own.

Mrs. Rosita Mercedes makes a living taking care of her children and as she is home she raises and sells animals like chicken, sheep, and guinea pigs. She also works her land where she plants vegetables and greens which she sells in her community or in the market.

This is her first loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs and chicken.

Her goal is to have a large chicken farm to sell in the poultry stores of the city.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chicken.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is from the town of Clarin. She is 39 years old. Jelly is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. Jelly has been in her business for over three years and earns 800 PHP a month for these activities. 

Jelly is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She's been a member of GDMPC for three years. Jelly plan to used the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is a married woman having seven children. Melita is 53 years old, residing at Malaubang, Ozamis City, Philippines. Melita own and operate a general store to earn a living and she's been eight years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. 

Melita is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Melita wants to build house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Chreub

texts.en:
Chreub is 41 years old and married with two children. She is a farmer, and she also raises pigs. Her husband is a construction worker. She has been raising pigs and farming her rice field for 18 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. Chreub requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice field and also to buy food for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income, feed her pigs to be healthy and fat, keep her children in school, buy necessary household stuff, and save some money for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs and fertilizers for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is married with one child. He is 44 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Arnold has a motorcab business. He has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle business. Arnold has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Arnold hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle, to operate his motorcycle business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is married with one child. He is 43 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Edgar has a motor cab business. He has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase a sidecar for his motorcycle. Edgar has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sidecar for his motorcycle

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa is 49 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Melissa has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Melissa has a requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for snack making. Melissa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Melissa would like to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for snack making

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is married with three children. She is 56 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Crisanta sells canned goods, toothpaste, and noodles to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, toothpaste, noodles, etc. Crisanta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Crisanta hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as canned goods, toothpaste, and noodles

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from Bliss Baybay, Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old, married, and has five adult children. Luzminda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. She has been in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. Luzminda is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to resell. 

She's been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Luzminda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Sam Art is married with three children. She is a 31-year-old farmer. She also raises pigs and sometimes she works for others for additional income. Sam Art has been a farmer for 11 years.

This is her first loan from VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields with good quality and sell for a good price to increase family income, to have some savings for future needs, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Minkailu.  He is married, his spouse is a trader, and her income is Le450, 000. They have four children aged 19, 15, 10 and 7 years old. In 2001, Minkailu established his shoe business.  He began his business after he dropped out of school and realised that he needed a source of income to enable him to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business.   He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  

Minkailu has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase - Comfort Slippers - 2 cartons @ Le815, 000, Madam Shoes - 1 carton @ Le600, 000, Foam Slippers - 5 dozen @ Le605, 000, Sponge Sandals - 1 carton @ Le750, 000, Sponge Slippers - 2 dozens @ Le240, 000, Plastic Shoes - 1 packet @ Le150, 000 and Toilet Slippers - 4 packets @ Le1, 080,000.  The balance of Le 262, 000 will be used for transportation.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Minkailu plans to build his own house and educate his children. He also plans to have a shop and buy a car.  His believes that this loan will help him to improve his business.  His major challenges are that some items get faded, especially in the dry season, and this can force him to sell at cheaper prices.  He serves 15 customers each day.  His business is popular because of good quality items. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase - Comfort Slippers - 2 cartons @ Le815,000, Madam Shoes - 1 carton @ Le600,000, Foam Slippers - 5 dozen @ Le605,000, Sponge Sandals - 1 carton @ Le750,000, Sponge Slippers - 2 dozens @ Le240,000, Plastic Shoes - 1 packet @ Le150,000 and Toilet Slippers - 4 packets @ Le1,080,000, with the balance of Le262,000 for transportation.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman having three children. Zenaida is 56 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Zenaida owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 43,200 PHP to purchase products to resell. 

Zenaida has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Zenaida wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Johnfryl

texts.en:
Johnfryl is single. He is 20 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Mis Occ., Philippines. 

To earn a living, Johnfryl has a "buy & sell" business. He has had this business for one year. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 6,000. He has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase electronics equipment for his electronics repair shop. 

Johnfryl has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Johnfryl hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase electronics equipment for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Mabinty Ishmail

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mabinty. She is single and has a child who is nine years old and a student. In 2004, Mabinty established her business selling dishes, slippers, and bowls. She started her business because she left school at primary level and her mother introduced her to business. She began by joining her mother selling vegetables but as she grew older she started her own business. Gradually, her business grew and she was able to accumulate 1,000,000 SLL which she used to start her current business. This business is special to Mabinty because she is making a living out of it and it also gives her security. She works 11-hour days seven days a week and earns about 1,200,000 SLL each month. Competition is great but Mabinty buys in quantity to provide what her customers need on time. She serves customers around the city center and is assisted by her cousin. Mabinty’s suppliers are located in Conakry and she usually travels there by public transportation twice a month.

Mabinty is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy slippers, ladies blouses, and rubber bowls to sell. She hopes her loan will increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Mabinty plans to open a big store and give her child a good education and life.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, ladies blouses, and rubber bowls

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea is a 32-year-old woman who comes from a low income family. She operates a selling business. She sells cakes, cookies, sweets and chocolates, especially varieties of biscuits (cookies) for the kids in the community. She has run this business for many years and she’s able to generate an income of around $2USD per day to support her livelihood. She now has two single children, one of whom is a hairdresser in a suburb area of Phnom Penh city. Chea is a good wife and mother. She always cares for the family as well as the future of her children. She wants all of them to become people who can live independently and have their own careers. Due to the lack of transportation means for the family, Chea has faced difficulties in her personal life and business. She would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family’s use. In the future, she intends to expand her selling business and sell more types of products.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family’s use.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 52 years old and married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 10 years, Josefa has been a farmer who plants crops to earn a living. Josefa has been a member of GDMPC for two years. 

Josefa is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase crop fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase crop fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is a 41-year-old farmer who is married with two children. She is also a fisherwoman and she raises cows and horses. Sreang has run her agriculture businesses for 21 years. 

Sreang is requesting her second loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy a water pump for her farm and also to buy cows and horses. Sreang hopes to increase her crop yield and quality to increase her income and improve her ability to provide for her family’s expenses. In the future, she hopes to raise more cows and horses and also to have some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and livestock

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Edita Emelda

texts.es: Edita Emelda de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas en el lugar de su residencia es muy conocida en la zona pues prepara las tortillas y pupusas más ricas, con material de calidad y a un buen precio y el servicio es excelente despacha a la clientela en el menor tiempo posible; Edita es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante para ella es con la motivación y la sabiduría como se abre el camino del éxito, Edita quiere abrir ese camino es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz mayor, queso, chicharrón, frijoles entre otros. Edita Emelda tiene la confianza que con su arduo trabajo lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Edita Emelda, 57, lives with her daughter in her own home.  She works selling tortillas and "pupusas" [corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] in her house.  She is very well known in the area since she makes the best tortillas and pupusas, with quality ingredients at a good price.  The service is also excellent, and she takes care of the customers in the least amount of time possible.

Edita is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.  For her, it is motivation and wisdom that lead to the road to success.  Edita wants to take this road.  This is why she decided to ask Integral for a loan that would allow her to buy corn wholesale, cheese, pork rinds, and beans, among other products.

Edita Emelda is confident that with her hard work she will manage to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork rinds, and beans

loans.name: Alma Silvia

texts.es: Alma Silvia vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de pan dulce en variedad semita, quesadillas, budín entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues prepara el pan mas delicioso del lugar siempre calientito, con material de calidad en un lugar higiénico y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable siempre está pendiente de las preferencias del cliente y los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro; Alma es una mujer carismática llena de energía para el trabajo, para ella el recurso más valioso que poseemos los seres humanos para poder triunfar es el tiempo es por eso que Alma está trabajando duro para aprovecharlo es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, colorantes, levadura, etc. Alma Silvia tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma Silvia lives with her life companion and her daughter in her own house.  She sells assorted sweet bread like semitas, quesadillas and budín among others.  She has acquired quite a few customers lately because she makes the most delicious bread in the area, always nice and warm, made with the best quality materials in a hygienic space.  Besides, prices are accessible and the service is unequaled; she is always aware of her customers’ preferences and she welcomes them with a smile on her face.

Alma is a charming woman who is full of energy for work.  For her, the most valuable resource we human beings have to succeed is time.  Because of this, Alma works hard to use her time in the best way possible.  This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy flour at wholesale, sugar, food coloring, yeast, etc.  Alma Silvia hopes that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, food coloring and yeast.

loans.name: María Hilda

texts.es: María Hilda D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, jabones, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad y últimamente se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita con productos D. excelente calidad a precios accesibles; María siempre esta alegre es la mejor arma en su trabajo ya que eso la motiva a mejorar cada día, para ella lo más importante para adquirir el compromiso del éxito en la vida es creer en uno mismo, confía en sus capacidades es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, pan, granos básicos, productos instantáneos, jabones, etc. María Hilda tiene fe que así lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: María Hilda is 42 years old and lives with her life companion and their children.  She has a store where she sells basic staple items like rice, beans and soap.  Her store is very well known in her community and she’s acquired quite a few customers lately because she always has what people need: quality products at affordable prices.  María is always cheerful; this is her main weapon at work because it motivates her to improve daily.  For her, the most important thing to achieve success in life is to believe in oneself, to trust in our abilities.  Because of this, she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy snacks, bread, basic grains, instant products, soap, etc.  María Hilda has faith that she’ll manage to proviD. a better quality of life for her family this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Fatu.  She is married to a driver and has a 32-year-old child. In 2006, Fatu established her cooking utensil business after dropping out of school due to the lack of financial support from her parents. Women were not encouraged to further their education at that time, so her alternative was to start doing business. She started trading in local produce and was able to save 40,000 SLL which she used to purchase household utensils to sell from home.  Within the year, she rented a stall in town and last year she was able to rent a shop to display her stock in larger quantity.  Fatu works 11-hour days seven days a week and earns about 1,000,000 SLL each month. Her major business challenges are transportation costs and foreign exchange. 

Fatu is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase pans, flasks, drinking buckets, stoves, food containers, and iron charcoal. She has successfully repaid a previous loan. Fatu hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, she plans to build a house and a store outlet to have her own business premises. Fatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, stoves, and home products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has three children, ages five, eight and 12. In 2003, Fatmata established a used clothing business to get extra income to assist her husband to provide a livelihood for their family. She works 10-hour days seven days a week and earns about 1,200,000 SLL each month. Fatmata’s business is popular because of her quality items and her good customer service. She travels to her suppliers in Freetown four times each month and she puts her profits back into her business.

Fatmata is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to purchase a bale of trousers and a bale of windbreakers and transport them. She has successfully repaid a prior loan.  Fatmata hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.  In the future, she plans to have her own shop and build a house.  Fatmata also hopes to educate her children to the university level, an opportunity she did not have.  She is trustworthy and honest and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase and transport trousers and windbreakers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with seven children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Evelyn is a farmer and she is also a copra producer [dried coconut meat used for oil production]. She has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns 21,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer for copra.

Evelyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to support the finish of her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for copra

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Solomon.  He is married to a businesswoman and has four children aged 18, 15, 12 and 10 years; all are school-going children.  He has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is his younger sister's daughter, who came to live with him to attend school as his sister is living in the village. 

 In 1992, Solomon established his essential drugs business.  Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. 

Solomon has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and he now requires a new loan in order to purchase - Caf D - 5 cartons @ Le200,000, Glucose powder - 4 cartons @ le250,000, Dexorange - 4 cartons @ Le200,000, Septrin Syrup - 2 cartons @ Le200,000, Is Cof S - 2 cartons @ Le200,000 and Vitamin Syrups - 2 cartons @ Le200,000.   He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Solomon plans to build a house, open another drug store and educate his children very well.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase - Caf D - 5 cartons @ Le200,000, Glucose powder - 4 cartons @ le250,000, Dexorange - 4 cartons @ Le200,000, Septrine Syrup - 2 cartons @ Le200,000, Is Cof S - 2 cartons @ Le200,000 and Vitamin Syrups - 2 cartons @ Le200,000.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. Marlyn is 32 years old, residing at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marlyn owns and operates a banana farm, planting banana to earn a living and she's been one year in this business. 

Each month, Marlyn earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase pesticides for banana growing. Marlyn is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Marlyn wants to build her own house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides for banana growing.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret (pictured with her young son) is 32 years old and her husband, Ra is 33 years old. They live across the Mekong River and about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons, one attends school and the other one is still young. 

Saret is a weaver and she also sells weaving materials (raw materials) such as cotton thread and silk. Her husband is a barber. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional cotton thread and silk materials for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cotton thread and silk materials for sale.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 47 years old, married with three children, residing at Sebasi Clarin, Philippines. Jerry sells swine and also he owns a corn farm. Jerry earns 20,000 PHP every month with this kind of work. He requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more swine.

Jerry has been a member of GDMPC for three years. Jerry's future plan is to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more swine.

loans.name: Sokyoeurn

texts.en:
Sokyoeurn (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Bunthai is 41 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have one daughter who is in school.  The family is living in a village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Sokyoeurn has been running a grocery store for five years, while her husband is a construction worker.  She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to fill in the land behind her house because there is a pond behind it that she needs to fill in.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house.

loans.name: Isatu Junior

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Isatu.  She is married to a businessman and has three children aged 10, 7, and 5 years; two are school-going children. In 2001, Isatu established her ready-made clothes business. She began her business when she got married and her husband asked her to start her own business so that they could get enough income to support their home. 

Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy ladies' dresses - 100 pieces @ Le30, 000 and T-shirts - 25 pieces @ Le40, 000.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Isatu plans to open a jewellery shop.  Taking out this loan will help as it will enable her to expand her business.  She wants her children to attend good schools so that they will become better people in future. 

Isatu is an honest and hard-working businesswoman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ladies' dresses - 100 pieces @ Le30,000 and T-shirts - 25 pieces @ Le40,000.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Merilyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merilyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery items for sale. Merilyn is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.  She plans to used the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her general store and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot and his wife Saran (pictured together), live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young son. 

Mot is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment worker. He is in the process of building his new house to live in, but the house is not finished yet, so Mot decided to apply for a loan of $1,200 to complete the work.

loans.use: to finish his house building.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a married woman with six children. She is 55 years old and lives in Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Remedios operates a vulcanizing shop to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 from this activity. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 in addition to her working capital to buy vehicle spare parts. Remedios has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, she wants to build a big house.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional pigs to raise and to assist in her rice farm by buying seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut succeeded with her last loan. She sold her pigs for a high price. Ni Ketut received a new loan of 1,300,000 Indonesian rupiah because she wants to improve her business. She will use this loan to purchase five piglets. She will keep the piglets for five months for fattening. She hopes the business will run well and she can get enough profit. She plans to renovate her kitchen with the profit.

loans.use: to buy five piglets.

loans.name: Hagie

texts.en: Hagie is 32 years old and married with three kids living in Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She sells corn to earn a living and she earns PHP 15,000 each month. Hagie requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer. She's been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for five years. In the future, she plans to improve their house and to live in convenience.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Yot

texts.en:
Yot, 49 years old, is a weaver. Her husband, Mao, 52, is a construction contractor. They have six children - two sons and four daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mao needs some money to pay his workers. That’s why Yot decided to ask for a loan of $400 to assist in her husband’s business.

Photo: Yot is not pictured with her loom because the house where she lives is flooded, so she needed to move her looms to a place that is not affected by flood.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is a married woman with four children. She is 46 years old and lives in Segatic Daku Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Narcisa operates a stall that sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in addition to her working capital to purchase more food for resale. Narcisa has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Narcisa wants to build a big house.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is married and has five siblings. She is 57 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Luzminda owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting crops to earn a living. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more fertilizer for their farm. Luzminda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for almost a year. In the future, she plans to buy a lot in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a widow with two children. She is 60 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Brenda owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Brenda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Brenda's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.en:
This is Perseveranda, 45, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of 3 children and her husband, Emeterio, is a vendor. Two of her children are in college while the youngest is in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Perseveranda operates a business selling accessories. She buys accessory products from wholesalers, repackages them and then sells them for a profit. Customers are attracted to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as a result.  

Perseveranda hopes to have a stall in the market and dreams of being able to give all of her children a high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more accessory items for resale

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol (in the photo) and her husband, Chheng, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children - three sons and one daughter. 

She is a weaver and her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. She helps in her husband’s farming business when she is free. She is requesting another loan of $300 to assist in her husband’s farming by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide, so he can continue his farming business.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is a single woman. She is 60 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Pablita owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. Pablita requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer for her farm. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for almost a year. In the future Pablita plans to buy more plots to work on.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm land

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married with four children. She is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alice owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting crops to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns PHP 13,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the costs of planting rice. Alice has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future Alice hopes to expand her rice farm and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for the costs of planting rice

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Маъруф трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Более 15 лет он занимается купля продажей сухофруктов. Он торгует на местных рынках города и получает хороший прибыль. От прибыли он купил дом для сына с женой, чтобы они жили отдельно и стали самостоятельными. Его сын и жена переехали в новый дом, и он сам с женой остался в старом доме. Маъруф хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки сухофруктов с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Maruf is a hardworking and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits for over 15 years.  He sells at local town markets and makes a good profit.  He used his profits to buy a house for his son and his son's wife, so that they could live separately and become independent.  Maruf's son and daughter-in-law moved to the new house, and Maruf and his wife stayed in the old house.  Maruf wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of dried fruits in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Sivun

texts.en:
Sivun (in the photo), 34, lives in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with one son and three daughters. All of her children are in school. 

Sivun is a garment worker. She is applying for a loan of $800 to buy her neighboring land to expand her property. She will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To buy her neighboring land to expand her property and also to build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her two children are still studying. She aims to send her children into higher levels of education, so she is doing her best to support them in their studies. 

She is a dealer of fish sauce and she has been running this kind of business for nine years. She delivers her products to three municipalities: Santiago, Diffun and Maddela. She uses her delivery truck within these municipalities to transport her products. She is grateful because through her hard work and patience she is able to increase her sales and profit. 

Elisa is still in need of additional capital amounting to P50,000, due to the high cost of basic commodities and the expenses of her two children. She will be using her additional capital to buy a stock of fish sauce. She hopes that through her loan she could make her dreams come true and improve their  standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish sauce for her business.

loans.name: Rakey

texts.en: Rokey (shown in the photo) sells chickens and ducks that she buys from her villagers, transporting them to sell in a market approximately three kilometers from her house. Her husband, Mat, is a fisherman, and they have eight children - six sons and two daughters. Rokey is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying new fishing nets and a boat.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying new fishing nets and a boat.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca D. 56 años D. edad,  habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y dos hijos uno D. los cuales se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo desD. hace varios años. Es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su negocio y quiere  seguir manteniéndolo activo por mas años ya que es uno D. sus principales fuentes D. ingresos. Gracias al carisma y amabilidad D. Blanca ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchas personas y cada día los clientes la prefieren mas ya que cuando D. productos D. belleza se trata ella tiene los mejores con los precios más accesibles. Para Blanca lo más importante es su familia y por ella hace todo lo que está en sus manos para ofrecer una mejor oportunidad D. vida. Últimamente ha pensado mucho en la posibilidad D. surtir su negocio con el fin D. cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar su nivel D. ingresos y por consecuencia mejorar su calidad D. vida. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. productos D. belleza como: lociones, cremas, champo, jabón, cosméticos y D. mas productos que permitan atraer a más clientes. D. esta manera espera mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, 56, lives in her own house with her family group composed of her husband and two children one of which is still in school.  She has been selling beauty products via catalogue for many years.  She is a hardworking, responsible, enterprising woman.  With much effort and dedication she’s managed to stay in business and wants to continue to do so for many more years since this is one of her main sources of income.  Thanks to Blanca’s charm and kindness she’s managed to win over the trust of many people and every day customers prefer her more because when it’s about beauty products she has the best ones at the most accessible prices.

For Blanca, the most important thing is her family and she does everything that’s in her hands to do to proviD. them a better opportunity in life.  Lately she’s been thinking a lot about the possibility of stocking her business to meet increased demand so that she can improve her income level and as a result her quality of life.  With that in mind, she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her business buying beauty products like lotions, creams, shampoo, soap, cosmetics and other products that will allow her to attract more customers.  She hopes this way to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1987. She lives in Thac Qua village and has two children who are going to school. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice but they also sell groceries and fast food from their general store. They earn a monthly income of about VND 7,000,000. Since 2007 Mrs Ha has participated in SEDA and has always repaid her loans punctually. The last time, she borrowed VND 6,322,000. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 7,630,000 to expand her store by purchasing more groceries such as cobbler, beer, candy, etc. She is the leader of her group.

About the other borrowers in her group:
 Thuy is 23 years old. She has one child. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow VND 6,322,000 to buy cloth.
 Hien is 22 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow VND 5,014,000 to buy food for pigs.
 Ha is 29 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow VND 5,014,000 to breed pigs.

loans.use: to expand her store by buying more groceries

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de 42 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. María es una mujer emprendedora llena de muchas ideas de negocio. Hace ya varios años logro establecer una pequeña pupuseria la cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable pero sobre todo llena de amabilidad para los clientes razón por la cual cada día la prefieren más ya que cuando de pupusas se trata María tiene las mejores y a los precios más accesibles. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio razón por la cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (maíz, arroz, frijoles, queso, chicharon, etc.) que le permitan ofrecer una mayor cantidad de sus ricas y variadas pupusas a los clientes. Espera que de esta manera su situación económica y la de su familia mejoren.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 42, and lives in her own house with her family; which consists of her life partner and her three school-age children. María is an enterprising woman, who is full of many business ideas.  

Several years ago, she managed to set up a small pupusería (pupusas are corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled), which has helped her support her family. 

She is a hard-working woman, responsible, and above all full of friendliness toward her customers. That's the reason why every day they prefer her more;  since when it comes to pupusas, María has the best ones, and at the most affordable prices. 

Her dream is to see her business flourish.  That's why she has decided to apply to Integral for this loan, in order to buy the necessary ingredients (corn, rice, beans, pork, etc.) that allow her to sell a greater quantity of her varied and delicious pupusas to her customers. She hopes that in this way, her financial situation, and that of her family improves.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, beans, cheese, pork, etc.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim (in the photo) now sells groceries at home. Her husband, Sim, is a security guard. He used to be a remoque taxi driver but he quit the business. A remoque taxi is a motorbike with a trailer at the back. Sarim is asking for a loan of $1,000 to rebuild the house where she lives because it’s old.

The couple has been married since 1970 and has two children - one son and a daughter. One is married and lives outside the family home, and the other child has full time employment. They live in a village about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 46, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of 1 and married to Ernie, who is also her business partner. She, together with her husband and child, manage the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Carolina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her stall's regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as a result.  

Carolina hopes to open another store in their area and dreams of being able to give her child a high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and other products for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different types of iron and tools

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet was born in 1976. She lives in Thac Qua village, Duc Tu commune. She has two children who are going to school. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice, but also they make tofu. They have been working at this job for many years. They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and the last time she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy soybean to make tofu.

loans.use: to buy soybean to make tofu.

loans.name: Tomasa De Jesús

texts.es: Tomasa de Jesús, vive sola en casa propia. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada y emprendedora en su trabajo.  Ha trabajado toda su vida para ganarse  el pan de cada día. Tomasa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas tortillas en su hogar de habitación. Gracias a su carisma y amabilidad ha logrado ganarse la confianza de todos sus vecinos los cuales con mucha frecuencia solicitan sus deliciosas tortillas. Para Tomasa lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su producto por lo que cada día se levanta muy temprano para tener las ricas tortillas cuando los clientes las soliciten. Es una mujer con muchas ideas de negocio y poco a poco las va poniendo en marcha. Su sueño es abastecer a más personas de su vecindario de tal manera que sus ventas se vean aumentadas al igual que sus ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tortillería en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (maíz, agua, cal, gas propano, leña, etc.). De tal manera que pueda cumplir su sueño de poder mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por consecuencia su  calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tomasa de Jesús lives alone in her own house. She is a very enterprising woman, who is dedicated in her work. She has worked all her life to earn her daily bread. Tomasa makes and sells delicious tortillas in her home. 

Thanks to her charm and friendliness, she has managed to win the trust of all her neighbors, who frequently ask for her delicious tortillas. For Tomasa, the most important thing is for her customers to be satisfied with her product, so every day she gets up very early in order to have the delicious tortillas when the customers ask for them. She is a woman with many business ideas, and little by little she has been putting them into practice. 

Her dream is to supply more people in her neighborhood, so that her sales increase along with her income. This is why she has decided to apply to Integral for this loan, in order to invest in her tortilla-making business. She will use it to buy the necessary raw materials: corn, water, lime, propane gas, firewood etc. In this way, she can fulfill her dream of improving her level of income, and consequently her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy raw materials: corn, water, lime, propane gas, firewood etc., for making tortillas.

loans.name: Rofich

texts.en:
Rofich and his wife, Symas, (pictured together with their grandchild) have been married for more than 30 years and have four children - three sons and one daughter. Three are married and the other one is in school. They live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Rofich's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia.

Rofich and his wife sell recycling materials. Rofich’s son who is married wants to live in a separate home, but he does not have money to make the building. Hence Rofich decided to request a loan of $500 to build a house for his son.

loans.use: To build a house for his son who is married.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu was born in 1970. She lives in Thac Qua village, Duc Tu commune, with her husband and four children, who are still small. Her husband is a worker. He has income. Mrs. Thu is a farmer. She not only grows rice, but also she has many other jobs for more income. Her main job is farming. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 7,194,000 VND to pay tuition for her children and repaid this loan punctually. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to repair her house. She always wants to have a better life.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jyparkul's Group

texts.en: With money received from this loan, Jyparkul wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wishes to see all her children get wed. Jyparkul is 47 and, together with her husband, she has raised two sons and three daughters. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family, two daughters are at school, the older son works in construction, and the younger one is a farmer. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, this family breeds cattle. At the moment they keep four cows and Jyparkul sells about 50-60 liters of milk a day. In this way she earns about 12,000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to improve their living conditions and increase their number of cattle. Jyparkul is the leader of this group. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Seut

texts.en:
Seut (in the photo with her loom) is 38 years old, and her husband, Pon, is 40 years old. They live in a village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children - four sons and two daughters. Five are in school and the other one is still young.  

Seut and her husband are weavers. Besides weaving, they also grow rice. Seut is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Konthy

texts.en:
Konthy (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, San, is a commune leader. In addition, they are also rice farmers. They have been married since 1991 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, two attend school and the other one is still young. The family is living across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Konthy is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Dai

texts.en: Dai was born in 1953. She lives in Thac Qua village, Duc Tu commune, with her husband and a son. Her husband is a contractor. Her son is a worker in Thang Long industrial park. All of them have income. Mrs. Dai has a general store. She sells groceries. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She really likes participating in SEDA because she can save money every week. In 2007 she joined SEDA, and has always repaid loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Komang Ngurah

texts.en:
Komang Ngurah is really happy because he can sell a lot of his milk to customers. The milk not only tastes delicious, but is good for our health. Now he is a major distributor for the milk.  He is proud that, because of the milk, he also supports the health of the community.

He needs a new loan to buy more milk to fulfill the demands of  the salesmen. Komang Ngurah will use the profit to support his children's education and save for family needs.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of soy milk

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Sreysros is a garment worker and her husband, Somneang, is a tuk tuk taxi driver. They have been married since 1996 and have two sons and one daughter. One attends high school and others are in primary school. The family lives about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
None of Sreysros’s children attends university, but she wants her children to increase their knowledge since they are young. Hence Sreysros is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a computer for her son, who is in high school.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her son.

loans.name: Reynato

texts.en:
Reynato is a farmer who is raising his family in a village. He is 42 and has two school-age children. His goal in life is to improve their status of living and give his family a better life. 

They plant corn and vegetables for sale. He aims to expand his corn plantation to increase his yields and income to help him to support the education of their children, who are now at college level. He want them to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. Despite financial difficulty, they are striving hard to satisfy their family needs.

Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and pay the labor cost required in planting corn. He believes that this loan will help him to work out his plan. He hopes that his patience and hard work will give him a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor cost required in planting corn.

loans.name: Gulzamzam's Group

texts.en:
Gulzamzam is the leader of this group. She is 47 and she brings up a son and a daughter, both of whom study at school. Ten years ago she broke up with her husband and with an initial investment of 2000 soms she started to sell fruits and vegetables to earn her livelihood. Gulzamzam mostly sells apples and with money received from the loan she plans to purchase more applies in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wishes to open her own grocery store. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples for resale

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has 3 adult -age children.  To make a living,Thắng owns & operates a furniture making business.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling cabinets & wardrobe furniture to local businesses and community members. Thắng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Thắng joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thắng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase machinery to expand the business.  Thắng is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken from SEDA.  Thắng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thắng là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Thắng Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán tủ kéo & tủ áo quần cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thắng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thắng kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Thắng đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thắng đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Thắng dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  tiết kiệm cho những trường hợp khẩn cấp sau này.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Maredel

texts.en:
Maredel, age 39, is married with two children. She resides in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Maredel farms her own rice fields to make a living.  She has been this business for more than 15 years. Each month she earns Php 35,000.00. doing this type of work. Maredel has requested a loan amount of Php 50,000.00 which will be to used buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the next planting. 

Maredel has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year and this is her first loan. Maredel's future plan is for the education of her two children until  college and for their daily needs everyday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a teacher. She has been working at this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 Vietnamdong (VND).  She wants to earn more money. So in addition to teaching she also breeds  pigs and poultry. Last time she borrowed 6.944.000 VND and repaid punctually. This time she would like to borrow 8.736.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old,married with five children. She is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.
Nenita owns and operates a  fish selling business  to earn a living and had this business for more than 30 years. Each month, she earns Php 10,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 20,000.00 to purchase additional fish to sell.

Nenita has been a member of GDMPC for almost 2 years. Nenita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and also to  educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is 26 years old and single. He is a resident Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past two years, Bobby has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP. Bobby is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.

Bobby is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase vehicle spare parts to maintain his transport business. In the future, he wants to save his revenue for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Abduhoshim

texts.ru: Абдухошим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 33 года. Он женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена работает продавщицей. Сам Абдухошим имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abduhoshim lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 33 years old, married and has three children. His wife works as a salesperson. Abduhoshim has secondary education. He breeds cattle at home. He has been in this business for seven years. He is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of merchandise in order to expand her business

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Robert is a 26-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. For the past five years, he has been selling footwear and his business has been very profitable. Robert got his initial capital from wages earned as a laborer, and now he has stock worth two million. 

Robert is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell. In the future, he hopes to buy land so that he can construct residential and commercial houses.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru: Бахри вдова и у неё один ребенок. Она трудолюбивая и четная женщина. Более 10 лет Бахри занимается продажей продукты питания. Она имеет собственный магазинчик возле своего дома, и имеет много постоянных клиентов, которые живут в её махалле. В неделю два раза она ездит за товарами в город и покупает хорошие свежие продукты питания. Кроме того в свободное время она вместе с соседками шьет киргизские ковры. Основные покупатели ковров является жители сельских местностей, которые собираются проводить свадебную церемонию. А также она занимается откормом овца дома. Бахри хотела бы получит займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки товаров для магазина и приобретение шерсти для шитья ковров. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Bahri is a widow and has one child.  She is a hardworking and honest woman.  Bahri has been involved in sales of food products for over 10 years.  She has her own store near her house and has many loyal customers, who lives in her mahalla.  Twice per week, she travels to the city to buy products and buys good, fresh food products.  Besides this, in her free time, she and her neighbors make Kyrgyz rugs.  Local rural-area residents, who plan to hold wedding ceremonies, are the main customers for the rugs.  Bahri is also involved in fattening up sheep at home.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2000 Somoni to buy products for the store and wool for making rugs.  She thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase food products for the store and wool for making rugs

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 21 years old and single. She is from Nacional Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, she has managed her own garden, selling produce to make a living. Julie Ann earns 7,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.

Julie Ann is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer for her garden. In the future, Julie Ann hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 37 years old. She makes a living by selling cassava flour and vegetables and fruits and this is her third successful year in this business. Her business is open from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more cassava flour and vegetables and fruits as well as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to sell. 

With this loan, Epiphanie hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her business with more types of goods to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 29 years old and lives in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past nine years, Jamila has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, where she sells bed covers, blouses, skirts and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomeses. Jamila is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jamila who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

To help expand her business, Jamila is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cloth and will help Jamila to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Jamila hopes that in the future she will be able to open up other clothing stores nearby.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 41 years old, married, and has five children between 6 and 18 years old. 

Regine owns a boutique selling various goods such as cosmetics, sugar, biscuits, etc. This is her 11th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 5 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day.

Regine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying various goods such as cosmetics, sugar, toilet paper, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cosmetics, sugar, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and the father of two children.

Mohamad has owned an auto workshop since 2004 where he repairs and fixes electronics for cars. He has experience in this field and a good reputation.
His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of potential customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to purchase testing equipment for cars. He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase testing equipment for cars.

loans.name: Grez

texts.ru: Грез проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат. У них трое детей. Грез занимается торговлей более 13 лет. Он в основном покупает фрукты и продает на рынке. Кредит берет для аренды торговой точки на рынке и покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Grez lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 55 years old, married and has three children.  Grez has been involved in sales for over 13 years.  He primarily buys fruits and resells them at a market.  He is requesting this loan in order to lease a retail outlet at a market and buy fruits.

loans.use: to lease a retail outlet at a market and buy fruits

loans.name: Wily

texts.en:
Wily is 40, married and has three school-age children. He owns and manages their farm, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. As a responsible father, he wants to continue sending their children to school and give them a bright future. Although being a farmer is not easy, through his patience and perseverance, he can support his family. 

He plans to expand his corn plantation to increase his yields. But due lack of capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs required in planting corn. 

He said that his loan will greatly help him to expand his corn plantation. He is expecting to have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs required in planting corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator for his shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, who is 46 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eladio, a worker, and is the mother of four children. Together with her husband and children, Yolanda manages the household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Yolanda operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community and she earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Yolanda is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business. She will use her loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
