C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Adjoa Bénédicte est âgée de 25 ans et est célibataire. Adjoa Bénédicte n'a pas d'enfant. Adjoa Bénédicte vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Adjoa Bénédicte a été scolarisé. Adjoa Bénédicte exerce comme activité, la vente de chaussures de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de répondre à ses besoins. Adjoa Bénédicte exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. Adjoa Bénédicte s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Adjoa Bénédicte désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Adjoa Bénédicte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FA-NOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Fa-Nou group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Adjoa Bénédicte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the first time that this group has requested a loan from Alidé and they are doing so in order to increase their business volume. Adjoa Bénédicte is 25 years old and single. She does not have any children. She lives alone and takes care of her own expenses. She has had an education and now has a business selling shoes on a door-to-door basis; this enables her to provide for her own needs. Adjoa Bénédicte has been carrying out this activity for around 12 years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand she would like to boost her stock and increase her business volume. In order to do this, she is requesting a first loan from Alidé, along with other members of the Fa-Nou group,

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 41-year-old married man and father of four children. He has been working as a barber for the last 18 years. He’s well-known in the region with a good reputation and talented fingers.

Moussa works hard to provide a good living for his family. That’s why he invests his income in educating them as much as he can. To continue improving his business and their education at the same time, Moussa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for his children's primary school fees. He puts all of his efforts into making sure that they will get the best education ever and hopes he can stay alive to see them in very important positions.

Moussa hopes to expand his business, in the future, through opening a new branch.

loans.use: to pay for his children's primary school costs.

loans.name: Havokhon

texts.ru: Хавохон умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она любящая жена и заботливая мать троих детей. Её муж в заработках в России и чтобы помогать мужу она начала заниматься куплей продажей носков, колготок, платков, парфюмерий и т.д. Она приобретает товар из города Худжанд, а затем продает на своем местном районе. Её муж ежемесячно отправляет денежные переводы на содержании семьи и улучшение жилищных условий. Хавохон хотела бы получит займ для увлечения товарооборота.
texts.en: Havokhon is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is a loving wife and a caring mother of three children.  Her husband is away, working in Russia, and, in order to help him, Havokhon became involved in buying and selling socks, stockings, scarves, perfumes, etc.  She buys her merchandise in the town of Khujand and then sells it in her local district.  Her husband wires money monthly to support the family and improve their living conditions.  Havokhon wants to obtain this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 50-year-old man. He is married and has five sons. He has a store for clothing sales, which is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud wants to purchase winter clothes in bulk to have a larger collection for sale, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. He needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mahmoud gets the loan, he will be able to pay for the bulk purchase of winter clothes, so he will have a better collection to compete with others and sell more. His income will increase and he will have the ability to offer better living conditions for his family. 

Mahmoud is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 37 years old and is married to Ann. Together they have two children. He gets his income from rearing pigs. He has been in the business for the past seven years. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is George's first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase feed for his pigs and increase the number of piglets. He will use the anticipated profit to increase his poultry. His dream is to be able to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Charles has been working hard to manage his bookstore, which sells all types of textbooks and stationary products. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more textbooks and will help Charles to generate greater profits as well as buy a printer for the store. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to finish building his house and start another stationary store. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more textbooks to sell in his bookstore.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 31, works in a bakery factory as a confectioner. She lives with her son and husband in a rental house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her salary does not meet her family's expenses often. This year, her son has entered secondary school and family expenses have been notably increased since then. Due to this, she decided to start her second business of a taxi with her husband’s old car. It is beneficial to increase her earnings further. Now she needs some money to make adjustments to the car for providing secure and comfortable service to the passengers.

loans.use: To make adjustments to the car for providing secure and comfortable service to the passengers.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 36 year old a married woman and has two children, one is in school. She has had a business selling cool water and soda in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Jackline requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her child.

loans.use: To purchase soda to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 35 years old. He lives in An Ninh village with his wife and three children. His children are still small. His wife is a farmer and he is businessman. He sells clothes in the market and he has had this job for four years. He has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). 

Since 2009 he has participated in SEDA. The last time he borrowed 6.944.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycL., he would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Erdeneochir

texts.en:
Erdeneochir is 22 years old and lives with his wife in ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife rents a well and runs it. He started his taxi service business in 2007 with his own car. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to finish building the house and service his car for a harsh winter. He is a young and hard working man who says, "My daughter has born recently. I don't want my daughter turn out to be like me, in order to make that possible, I will work hard and get her well educated". 

He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car and to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi and finish building his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frozen foods, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, snack foods and beverages to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli, in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past two years, Jonathan has been working hard to manage his hotel and bar, which provides accomodation and drinks for local travellers. 

To help expand his business, Jonathan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer, and will help Jonathan to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Jonathan hopes that in the future he will be able to build commercial housing. 

Jonathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jonathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Odbayar, 26, is a taxi driver and runs his taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing the taxi service for 6 years and it is his main income source. Lately, his car has started to have some breaks and is becoming dangerous to serve the customers. Therefore he needs to change some parts and some sections. It will be good for his business earnings if he could make repairs before this winter. 

The loan Odbayar is requesting will be used to purchase some new spare-parts for his taxi car and make a repairs to it.

loans.use: To purchase spare-parts for his taxi car

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 36 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Jesca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Jesca has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Jesca to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Jesca hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jesca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town for the last two years.  She is 25 years old and married to a man named Macharia, with whom she has two children.  

Veronica was introduced to Kiva field partner KADET Ltd by an existing borrower and this will be her second loan. She paid all her previous loans off on time. She plans to use this loan to buy more milk to sell in her dairy shop.

In future, Veronica hopes to expand her business and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 39-year-old married man and the father of four children.  He says his children represent his whole life. Abbass works in furniture making since 25 years ago, this long experience gave him customers trust and respect. Abbass is requesting a loan from Kiva-partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary wood requested for a special furniture project requested. 
Abbass is willing to support bed room industry as much as he can, because it’s highly requested by most of his customers, he’s willing to make his own showroom, and to improve it as much as he can, to provide the best living to his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children who are all currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells home supplies, food and fresh produce. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more food to sell at his shop. Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

Peter hopes he will be able to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. He hopes that in the future he will be able to start offering new kinds of produce to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale

loans.name: Ndeye Fama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de trois enfants.Deux de ses enfants sont à l'école primaire.Depuis prés d'un an, elle exerce le commerce de tissus,de draps et d'articles divers.Elle assure les frais scolaires de ses enfants et prend en charge ses propres besoins avec les revenus de cette activité.Son ambition est d'implanter devant son domicile une cantine pour bien fixer sa clientèle.Elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des tissus, des draps grand et petit modèle ainsi qaue des articles de mercerie.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman and the mother of three children. Two of her children are in primary school. For nearly a year, she has had a business involving fabrics, bed sheets, and a variety of items. She covers the cost of schooling for her children and supports herself with the income from this business. Her ambition is to set up a stall in front of her home to earn the loyalty of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy some fabrics and bed sheets both large and small, as well as some sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, small and large bed sheets, and sewing supplies

loans.name: May

texts.en: May started her interior design business in 2000. Since then, she has done all the major stores and luxury shops interior design in the province. She is well known for her skills. She does one job in a month. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I have many children and I will do everything I can in order to support my children." May is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her eldest daughter is a college student, and the other four children all attend a local school. She is requesting 3,000,000 tugriks to buy equipment and materials for her construction business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials

loans.name: Sala-Ko Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SALA-KO est formé de trois personnes qui cohabitent ensemble. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Magni Catherine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Magni Catherine est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur nommé François. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont deux à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Magni Catherine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Magni Catherine exerce comme activité, la vente de pain accompagné de sandwich dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Magni Catherine désire renforcer son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Magni Catherine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SALA-KO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
SALA-KO Group is made up of three persons who share a home. The group's representative, named Magni Catherine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Magni Catherine, age 43, is married to a taxi driver named François. The couple has four children, out of whom they have to support two. Some children attend school. The couple live together with their children, and take care of the various household expenses together.

Magni Catherine never attended school. She sells bread and sandwiches in her neighborhood, a business which enables her to provide for her family without much difficulty.

Eager to better meet customer demand, she would like to increase her working capital and bolster her business. To this effect, she's seeking her first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy bread and ingredients to make sandwiches (oil, fish, avocado, etc)

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is 41 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosana runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. Rosana has been in her business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. In the future, Rosana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 33 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more livestock. Emily has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from farming corn and vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Wilma has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 34-year-old married woman with six children; four of them in school. She has had a business selling bread in Kator, South Sudan, for five years. Monica requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread for sale. She will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase food stock to sell more food.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with four children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling herbal products.

Zenaida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Oyumaa

texts.en: Oyumaa is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been renting a small space in a hairdressing salon since 2007. She has a bright vision to open her own hair salon one day. Her equipment is getting old and doesn't operate. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I had a daughter recently. I will work as hard as possible to support my son." She is requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase new equipment for her hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been working in selling women's clothes since seven years ago.
 
Rania is a hardworking woman. She started her business seven years ago to help her husband in improving their social and financial situations. Rania is requesting a loan from Kiva-partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with the new season's collections, especially for the Adha Eid “Muslim Holy Pilgrim.”

Most of her customers are family members, friends, neighbors and relatives; they highly support her in order to provide a good living for her children. Rania’s special reputation earned her customers’ support and trust. She insists on improving her business as much as she can in order to expand it through opening a shop instead of working from her own house.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with new collections.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une commercante qui vend des tissus simples, des tissus "thioub", des draps de lit et des rideaux.Elle pratique cette activité depuis son jeune age en accompagnant sa maman qui faisait le meme commerce.Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l'un est élève au lycée.Elle entretient sa famille avec les produits de son commerce et se charge surtout des dépenses liées aux études de son fils.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 20 pièces de draps, 20 pièces de rideaux et 15 "thioub".Elle ambitionne de construire une maison sur un terrain qu'elle a acheté.
texts.en:
Khary is a merchant who sells ordinary fabrics, "thioubs" (dyed cotton cloth), bedsheets, and drapes. She's been doing so since her young age, with her mother who used to run the same business.

Khary is married and the mother of two children, out of whom one attends high school. Thanks to the profits of her business, she provides for her family. She mainly takes care of her son's school expenses.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, in order to buy 20 bedsheets, 20 drapes, and 15 "thioubs". She ambitions to build a home on a land lot she purchased.

loans.use: to buy 20 bedsheets, 20 drapes, and 15 "thioubs" (dyed cotton cloth)

loans.name: Abdullahuman

texts.en:
Abdullahuman is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli, in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three and a half years, Abdullahuman has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells many different kinds of food items and household supplies. 

To help expand his business, Abdullahuman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and drinks and will help Abdullahuman to generate greater profits and finish his family's first home. Abdullahuman hopes that in the future he will be able to start a transporting business. 

Abdullahuman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves microentrepreneurs like Abdullahuman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 40-year-old man married with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His dreams for his family are to educate his children and to build a better house.

Pius has been brewing alcohol for the last fifteen years.  He used profits from brewing to start up a bar, though he has been challenged by price fluctuations.  Pius plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy bananas to make banana beer.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married to Virginia, and together, they have one child who is school-going. He owns a motorcycle and he also sells cereals. He does the business with his wife and has been in the business for the past nine years. He gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to increase stock of cereals, beans and rice for sale.

He will use the anticipated profit to open another food stall. His dream is to have a stable income to take care of his family and pay school fees for their child.

loans.use: to increase stock of cereals, beans and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new construction kit.

loans.name: Lutfiddin

texts.ru: Лутфидин женат имеет троих детей, двое несовершеннолетние. Жена предприниматель  занимается торговлей детской одежды. Ранее он тоже помогал жене в торговле. На прибыль, полученную от бизнеса они купили пассажирский мини-фургон. Лутфидин стал заниматься перевозкой пассажиров из г. Исфара в г.Худжанд. Он улучшил домашние  условия, построил дом. Часть средств уходит на образование детей. Он хочет получить займ для приобретения запчастей для автомашины и подготовки автотранспорта к зиме. Он надеется получить займ. Лутфидин заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Lutfiddin is married and has three children, two of whom are adolescents.  His wife is an entrepreneur, involved in sales of children's clothing.  Previously, he used to help his wife with the sales.  Using profits from that business, they purchased a passenger minivan, and Lutfiddin became involved in transporting passengers from the town of Isfara to the town of Khujand.  He improved his living conditions by building a house.  Part of the earnings are also used for the children's education.  Lutfiddin wants to obtain this loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle in order to outfit it for the winter.  He hopes to get this loan.  Lutfiddin thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts in order to outfit his vehicle for the winter

loans.name: Batamgalan

texts.en: Batamgalan has been making handmade shoes and his wife has been selling them in the market since 2006. He owns a counter in Mongolia's biggest market and his monthly income is approximately 2,100,000 tugriks (MNT). Now that winter is approaching, he needs additional raw materials to make warmer shoes. He is a young and diligent man who is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to buy materials for his business. Batamgalan is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His elder son is a school student and the younger one goes to kindergarten.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Ghayath

texts.en:
Ghayath is a 24-year-old single man, working in construction since six years ago. Ghayath is a builder who is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary wood requested for future projects.

Ghayath is a man with a good reputation; he is a hardworking man who puts all his efforts toward improving his business to a more developed one.

Ghayath hopes to open a big construction company in the future to deal with all construction procedures, with a big number of employees to reply faster to customers’ needs.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Après le décés de son 1er mari en 2003, l'emprunteuse s'est remariée avec le frère de ce dernier comme le veut sa tradition.Elle vit avec ses deux enfants qui sont élèves à l'école primaire.Son mari n'ayant pas les moyens d'entretenir seul la famille, cette brave femme s'est engagée dans un commerce de légumes, d'huile de palm, de savon et de divers produits alimentaires...Elle parvient à obtenir des revenus qui lui permettent de supporter les dépenses d'alimentation,de santé de ses enfants ainsi que leurs frais scolaires.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 50 litres  d'huile de palm et 1 sac de 15 kg de savon en poudre. Son ambition est d'acheter un  terrain pour y construire une maison.
texts.en:
After her husband's passing on May 1, 2003, Awa remarried with his brother, as tradition has it. She lives with her two children who attend elementary school.

Her husband being unable to take care of the family on his own, this brave woman started selling vegetables, palm oil, soap, and various food products.

She manages to earn an income that enables her to support her children's food, health care, and school expenses.

To bolster her working capital, she's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 to buy 50 liters of palm oil and one 15 kg sack of powder soap.

She ambitions to buy a land lot to build a house.

loans.use: to buy 50 liters of palm oil and one 15 kg sack of powder soap

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, who is 30 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Grille, and is a mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. 

Hilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to his house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (Php)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 34,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Hilda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Une Femme De Plus Group

texts.fr: UNE FEMME DE PLUS est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Emilienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un dessinateur nommé Edouard. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Emilienne a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs huit ans, Emilienne vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son quartier. Emilienne achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Emilienne et les autres membres du groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
"Une Femme de Plus" (One More Woman) is a group of four women whose members reside in the same neighborhood.

Emilienne, representative of the group and whose hand is raised in the photo, is 34 years old and is married to an artist named Edward. The couple has three children attending school, two of whom are dependents. Emilienne lives together with her ​​husband and children. The couple share the various household responsibilities.

Emilienne has had very little education. For about eight years, she has been selling locks and beauty products in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Benin.

This is the fourth time Emilienne and other members of the "Une Femme de Plus" group have requested the financial support of ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and business activities, and to better meet the demands of their customers.

loans.use: Buy locks and beauty products

loans.name: Huyagdulam

texts.en: Huyagdulam is 52 years old and lives with her husband. They rent a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. She started her parts supply retail business in 1996 by renting a counter in the biggest market in Mongolia. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "In past years I have concentrated on my kids. Now that they are independent, it's time to expand my business." She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more spare parts to expand the range of products that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Chawkat

texts.en: Chawkat is a 26-year-old married man and father of one child. Since 2003, he has worked fixing car bodies. His business is improving because he is working hard at it for his family’s benefit. He makes sure they have a main source of income. Chawkat is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary machines and tools that will help a lot in improving his business. These items will help him do the requested work in a very professional way and in a short period of time. Chawkat hopes to open a big car maintenance company that provides a wide variety of services for cars.

loans.use: To buy necessary machines and tools for his business

loans.name: Marah

texts.en: Marah is a 22-year-old young woman; she is married and her husband works in vegetable sales and has a low income. Marah wants to help her husband by purchasing bulk vegetables for sale to increase his collection and increase his income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Marah gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband and purchase bulk vegetables, so he will be able to compete with others and improve his sales and increase his income. This will enable him to provide better living conditions for the family. Marah is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase bulk vegetables for sale

loans.name: Abduvahhob

texts.ru: Абдуваххоб женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он любит свою семью и всегда старается содержать их в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечит их всему, что они хотят. Абдуваххоб вырос в кишлаке там, где в основном все занимаются фермерством. Он начал свой бизнес 16 лет тому назад и достаточно набрал опыта, чтобы успешно продолжать бизнес. Он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. Абдуваххоб хотел бы расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 8000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en:
Abduvahhob is married and is the responsible father of three children. He loves his family and tries his best to support them as much as possible. Abduvahhob grew up in a village populated mainly by farmers. 
He started his business sixteen years ago and has enough experience to successfully continue it. 
He breeds animals and grows crops. His main cash crops are wheat and barley. Abduvahhob wishes to expand his business and maximize his profits. Therefore, he's asking for a loan of 8000 Somoni. He thanks you ahead of time for your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a new canoe and nets in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en: Tumurbaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business but is unable to work due to their recently born baby. Their elder son is a student. Tumurbaatar rents a motel and runs it. With the landlord's permission he is allowed to expand the motel. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I thought I could build this extension on my own; however, it is difficult and I have to finish this before winter." He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy heating and decoration materials for his motel.

loans.use: To buy heating and decoration materials

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 34-year-old single man who has been fixing cars and doing electrical work on trucks for 22 years. Fadel was very young when he started working; he had to help his parents earn a living. He didn’t get to live his childhood as it was supposed to be, so he is working hard to plan for his future.

Fadel's 22 years in the auto repair business have given him broad experience as well as customers' trust. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special scanner to detect cars' hidden problems and to make needed changes to his house such as putting on new tiles to make it suitable for healthy living.

Fadel is a man with a very good reputation. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future by opening a big garage that is capable of handling all vehicle needs and where he can provide special customer care.

loans.use: To buy a special car scanner and made needed changes to his house

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en: Heyam is a 23-year-old young woman, and she is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Heyam wants to purchase a new refrigerator for her house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Heyam gets the loan, she will purchase the new refrigerator, and she will improve her house and provide her family with better living conditions. Heyam is a conservative woman, so her husband Shaker is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for home

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза замужем имеет двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Она живет вместе c родителями мужа. У них свое дехканское хозяйство. Аграрное производство имеет свои риски и свои доходы, на протяжении нескольких лет из-за непогоды они не имели хорошей прибыли, чтобы наладить работу на земле, посев, приобретение крупного рогатого скота им пришлось много работать. Последние два года, получая займы, они наладили выращивание сельхоз культур в своем фермерском хозяйстве. Приобрели скот. Дилфуза хочет получить займ на покупку грубого корма и нескольких голов крупного рогатого скота, также постройку помещения для скота. Она заранее благодарна вам за помощь и надеется получить займ для намеченных целей.
texts.en: Dilfuza is married and has two children. Her husband does temporary work in Russia. She lives with her in-laws, and they have a small farm. Agricultural work has its risks. During the past few years, they have not been able to make much money, due to bad weather. They have had to work hard to prepare the land, sow crops and purchase cattle. With the help of borrowed money, over the past two years, they have successfully began cultivating crops on their farm and have acquired some cattle. Dilfuza would like a loan to purchase cattle feed and additional heads of cattle, and to construct a shed. She is grateful for your help and hopes to secure a loan for the listed items.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and repair the cow shed

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 44 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. He has a transportation business, which he started in 1996. Now he transports people and also collects firewood, which his wife then sells. Now that winter is approaching, the demand for firewood is high, and he needs to meet the demand in order to run his business successfully. Batsaihan is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I always look for an opportunity for business, and I will do everything I can in order to support my family." He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy firewood.

loans.use: To buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single barber who lives in Nabatieh. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy needed beauty products and gels requested by his customers. He plans to start selling these products in a small retail section and to expand it to an exclusive, big retail shop in the future.

Ali is a hardworking man with a good reputation. He works hard to make sure his business is improving step by step and thus to ensure its stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and gels

loans.name: Saiyohatkhon

texts.ru: Саёхатхон замужем имеет двоих несовершеннолетних детей. Чтобы содержать семью и помогать мужу она на рынке продает детскую одежду. Полученную прибыль она тратить на содержание семьи и на обучение детей. Дети учатся в школе. Часть прибыли тратит на расширение товарооборота. К каждому сезону следует обновлять и пополнять ассортимент товаров. Саёхатхон хочет получить займ и пополнить товар зимней детской одеждой. Она надеется на получение займа и благодарна вам.
texts.en: Saiyohatkhon is married and has two children, both under 18 years of age. To support her family and help her husband, she sells children's clothes at the market. She uses the money she makes to support her family and on the children's education. Her children go to school. Some of the money she makes is used to increase turnover. Ahead of every season, the selection of clothing must be updated and additional stock purchased. Saiyohatkhon would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional inventory of children's winter clothes. She hopes to receive her loan and is grateful to you.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for retail

loans.name: Vasco

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 61 anos,  fez a 3ª classe é solteiro pai de 4 filhos, vive na companhia dos seus 7 netos que vão a Escola. Não consegue poupar nenhum valor na sua conta bancaria.


Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha aprocura de emprego onde fixa sua residência. Consegue um emprego no Colégio Maria Auxiliadora ha 35 anos onde trabalha das 11h as 19h auferindo um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. 

Este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa( cimento, blocos, barrotes e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O credito anterior foi de 5.000.00mt foi para a mesma finalidade.
Está  confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
He was born in Inhambane and completed 3rd grade. He is 61 years old, single and the father of four children. He lives with his seven grandchildren who attend school. He isn't able to save any money in his bank account.
He moved to the district of Namaacha in search of a job and there he established residence. He got a job at Maria Auxiliadora School 35 years ago. He works there from 11a.m. to 7p.m. and earns an income which he uses to pay for home and construction expenses.
This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies for his house (cement, cinder blocks, rafters and zinc sheets) so that he can keep building. The first loan was for 5.000mt, for the same purpose.
He is confident he will be able to repay in advance and request a new loan in order to furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for his house (cement, cinder blocks, rafters and zinc sheets).

loans.name: Tsedev

texts.en: Tsedev is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger, a mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, his elder daughter studies at school and the younger one goes to kindergarden. He started his garment retail business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. Now he owns the counter, rents another one and is ready to buy that counter. Due to the purchase of the counter, he is lacking money to run the business. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "My business is expanding rapidly and I will not stop". He is requesting 1,700,000 MNT to buy winter clothes.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 38 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelas suas 2 sobrinhas que vivem com ela na sua casa. Consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria.


Nunca saiu do Distrito, iniciou a sua actividade comercial muito jovem. É comerciante ha mais de 20 anos, vende diversos tipos de roupa, com os lucros consegue iniciar sua obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não consegue concluir , solicita um empréstimo na Hluvuku para dar continuidade da mesma.  

Este é seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa( cimento, arreia, blocos e mais). Os anteriores de (3.000.00, 5.000.00 e 7.000.00)mt foram para o comercio. Está disposta a pagar com sucesso para aderir mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Nammacha. She is 38 years old, single and the mother of three children, all of which attend school. She lives in a house she owns and is also responsible for her two nieces who live with her. She is able to save 1.000mt in her bank account.
She has never left the district and started her retail business at a very young age. She has been in sales for over 20 years and sells various kinds of clothing. With her profits she was able to begin her construction project, but couldn't finish it due to the high cost of supplies. She requests a loan from Hluvuku so that she can keep building.
This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, sand, cinder blocks, etc.). The first loans were for 3.000mt, 5.000mt and 7.000mt, for her retail business. She is willing to successfully make the repayments in order to obtain more loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, sand, cinder blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane, de 43 anos solteira mãe de 2 filhos todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, não responsabiliza se por ninguem e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancária. 

Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha na companhia dos pais, trabalhou 3 anos numa Fábrica de Costura com as irmãs da Igreja Católica local. Anos depois inicia com seu próprio negócio. vende cocos no Mercado Informal Shoprite nas Quartas e Sabados e nos dias normais no Mercado Central. conta com ajuda da sua filha que lhe tem tomado conta do negocio, na sua ausência. 


Este é  o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus cocos. Os anteriores de 6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt foram para o comércio. Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nunhum problema para aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
She was born in Inhambane. She is 43 years old and the mother of two children who attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns. She doesn't support anyone else and she is able to save 1.000mt in her bank account.
She moved to the district of Namaacha along with her parents. She worked for three years in a a sewing factory with the sisters of the local Catholic Church. Years later, she started her own business. She sells coconuts at the Shoprite Informal Market on Wednesdays and Saturdays and also at the Central Market on regular days. She gets help from her daughter, who oversees the business in her absence.
This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to increase the amount of coconuts. The first loans were for 6.000mt and 10.000mt, for her business. She is confident that she will repay without any problems so that she can obtain more loans.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for selling.

loans.name: Yehime Group

texts.fr: YEHIME est un  groupement composé de vingt six personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Lucienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Lucienne est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Théodore. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple se partage ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Lucienne vend des poissons fumés de façon ambulante. Lucienne s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Lucienne et les autres membres du groupement YEHIME sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en:
YEHIME Group is made up of 26 persons who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand.

The group's representative, named Lucienne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years old, and married to one Théodore. The couple have four school-attending children they have to support, and cover the various family expenses together.

To provide for her various needs and help with the family expenses, Lucienne sells smoked fish as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies in Benin. For the second time, Lucienne and the other members of the group are seeking a loan from ALIDé in order to bolster their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cinder blocks, stone and cement).

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 54-year-old married man, father of four children, and owner of a small grocery store since 2000. 
Ali is a hardworking man, with a good customer care talent.  He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special refrigerator for the poultry he’s planning to display.
His shop is located in a very important spot on the main road and next to the school, which makes his business turn over in a very special way. 
He hopes to stay capable of managing his business, to keep on providing a good living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a special display refrigerator

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells banku, popularly called “etew,” in Cape Coast at Ayensudu, near Elmina. She is a widow and has six children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Theresa has been selling banku for some time now.  She will use her loan to buy more bags of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas sells ladies' bags, earrings, body lotions, and cosmetics at Ayensudu near Elmina. Her husband is a mason. Dorcas has been selling cosmetics for three years. She responsibly supports her spouse by paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying land.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en: Erica is single. She has been educated through junior high school. Erica operates a mini-provisions shop and sells food and plastic bowls at Ayensudu near Elmina, which she has done for just a year. Erica sees to the well-being of her home. Erica will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Erica plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Shaiyrbubu's Group

texts.en:
Shaiyrbubu is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married to a farmer. She and her husband have four sons and three daughters. Most of their children are now married and live separately with their families.

In order to earn money for their livelihood, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. Shaiyrbubu plans to use her portion of the loan to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening, and further resale. In the future, she wishes to improve her family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cica Josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Cica Josephine est âgée de 44 ans et est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Cica Josephine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs divers besoins. Cica Josephine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Cica Josephine exerce comme activité, la vente de sacs de riz, de liqueurs et des conserves dans une ville du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Cica Josephine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Cica Josephine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group Dieu est grand (God is great) consists of four people who reside in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Josephine Cica, is the one with a raised hand in this photo. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to improve their business. Josephine Cica is 44 years old and is a widow with three children, who are all attending school and under her responsability. Josephine lives alone with her children and takes care of all their needs. Josephine has a secondary school education. Her business is selling bags of rice, liquors and canned products in a city of Benin. This allows her to take care of her family. In order to better meet her customer demand, Josephine wants to increase her product inventory and improve the level of her business. To do this, Josephine, together with other members of her group, has requested a third loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase rice bags, boxes of liquors and canned products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 35 years old and is married with six children aged between 6 and 16 years old. He is well-known in the business of selling various goods such as: salt, rice, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. His business hours are from 7 a.m until 8 p.m every day, and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Pascal has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods such as, salt, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell. If successful, Pascal hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. With any profits, he will keep reinvesting them for better financial stability in the future, and he will be able to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as, salt, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells fish, pegs, sandles, and slippers at Ayensudu near Elmina by moving from one place to another. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Vivian has been selling slippers for six years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy sippers to resell.

loans.use: to buy sippers to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a married mother of one child, was educated to the junior high level. Married to a driver, she sells kenkey and will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare banku. Gladys with reinvest into her enterprise the new profits arising from the loan.

(The photo shows Gladys with her hand placed on the corn dough she will be using for the kenkey).

loans.use: to purchase more maize to prepare banku.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: In the picture above, Sophia has a pot of water on the fire getting ready for the kenkey. She is married and has one child. Sophia sells kenkey in Ayensudu near Elmina. Her husband is a driver. Sophia helps her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Sophia will use this loan to procure more bags of maize to cook. Sophia plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business for further growth.

loans.use: to procure more bags of maize to cook.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 50-year-old married man and father of four children who has been selling furniture for 20 years. His long experience has given him special skill in the furniture business, which has helped a lot in providing special deals to attract customers.

Kamel is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new furniture collection to attract new customers. He hopes to open a special furniture factory one day to design his own collections.

loans.use: To buy a new furniture collection

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children, all of whom go to school, and also takes care of two other family members (father and mother). Tessie operates a rented retail shop where she sells her products. Her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for the last 5 years and works seven days a week.

Tessie has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, 50 kgs. of rice, soap, and maize flour. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop, to buy a plot of land, and to educate her children to university level. Her major challenges are defaulters and transportation. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, 50 kgs. of rice, soap, and maize flour

loans.name: Shawqi

texts.en:
Shawqi is a young man, 18 years old. He has a studio for a sound system. He wants to improve his work and purchase new sound system items such as speakers, etc., but he doesn't have enough money to pay. He needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Shawqi gets his loan, he will be able to purchase new sound system items that will help him to improve the quality of his work and increase customer demand. He will increase his income and have better living conditions. 

Shawqi is in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase new sound system items.

loans.name: Issa  Diaby

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de deux enfants.Il tient un restaurant au bord de la route qui mène à l'hopital de sa localité.La bonne situation  géographique de son restaurant lui assure une grande clientèle et des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter  du riz,de l'huile et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est de moderniser le matériel et l'équipement de son restaurant.
texts.en: This borrower is a married father of two. He owns a restaurant on the side of the road leading to the hospital in his area. His restaurant's excellent location ensures a large clientele and an income consistent enough to take care of his family's living expenses. In order to strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy rice, oil, and various other products. His ambition is to modernize the equipment and machinery in his restaurant.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and various other products.

loans.name: Jumakul's Group

texts.en:
Jumakul is the leader of this group. She is 63 and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised three sons and three daughters. All the children, except the youngest son, live separately with their families. Jumakul keeps some livestock, and she is applying for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing sheep. In the future she plans to increase the number of livestock to leave a good inheritance to her children. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Marie.  She is married to a trader who earns Le500,000 every month  and has one child aged 10 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they were brought by her husband from the village to assist them in their schooling.  

In 2001, Marie established her household utensil business.  She began her business because she was not privileged to go school and after she was full grown, her elder brother gave her some money to start selling cakes.  After she got married, her husband asked her to change the business to household utensils because of the fire risk involved in baking the cakes.  

Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,095,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  Marie has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase drinking buckets 13 dozens @ Le1,740,000, bathing bucket 3 dozens @ Le330,000, set pans - 10 sets @ Le350,000, bowl pans - 5 dozens @ Le600,000, dish pan - 1 dozen @ Le900,000 and plastic bowls - 3 dozens @ Le450,000.  The balance of Le130,000 will be used for transportation.  

Marie hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 164,250. In the future, Marie plans to build her own house and educate her children to university level.  She feels good because this loan will add to her capital and this loan will help her to improve her business and earn more income.  

Her major challenge is that some of the items may get damaged or spoilt when travelling with them.  She serves about 10 customers each day.  The business is popular because the items are used by the majority of people and they are of good quality.  She is assisted by her younger sister who doesn't go to school.  Her suppliers are in Freetown and Guinea Conakry.    She usually uses public transport and she buys twice a month.  She saves some of her profit and ploughs the balance back into the business.   She is planning to expand and this can be achieved by adequate utilization of her capital and profit.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase drinking buckets 13 dozens @ Le1,740,000, bathing bucket 3 dozens @ Le330,000, set pans - 10 sets @ Le350,000, bowl pans - 5 dozens @ Le600,000, dish pan - 1 dozen @ Le900,000 and plastic bowls - 3 dozens @ Le450,000 with Le130,000 for transportation.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man, father of four children, and has been working at selling household plastic-ware and many other special things used in every house for 29 years. This is his main source of income for his family’s living expenses and that’s why he works hard to keep improving his business as much as he can. Most of his clients are neighbors and villagers, who help him in improving his social and financial situation as much as they can.

To improve his livelihood, Hassan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital through buying new merchandise requested by his customers. 

Hassan hopes to open a big household goods shop in the future, to keep a good inheritance for his children.

loans.use: To increase his business capital through buying new merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a food business selling Cavendish bananas and sweet bananas. She sells her products in a rented shop. Her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for the last 16 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish and sweet bananas. 

Rose's goals are to see her business grow big so that she sells wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university level. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce c'est-à-dire dans la vente de pain et de sandwich. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité  dans le but de se procurer des revenus et gagner sa vie. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat d’une cantine située a coté d’une boulangerie ce qui lui permettra de se rapprocher de sa clientèle. La rentabilisation de son activité l’aidera à accroitre s es bénéfices pour mieux se prendre en charge et aussi participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Ms. Maguette lives in Senegal. She is engaged in a business that sells bread and sandwiches. She chose this activity by necessity with the goal of earning an income and making a living. She is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC, with whom she has already repaid a previous loan. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 Frs in order to buy a food stall located next to a bakery, which will allow her to get closer to her clientele. The increased profitability of her business will help her raise her profits and thus help her take better care of herself and participate in providing for the family.

loans.use: to finance a food stall.

loans.name: Insa

texts.fr: Monsieur Insa est âgé de 30 ans. C’est un célibataire marchant  ambulant qui pratique la vente d’habits et de divers autres produits. Il vit au Sénégal  depuis plus de 10 ans et a opté pour le petit commerce. Il est sociétaire d’un  guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2009. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits  a revendre. Son objectif est de  développer son activité de  commerce en  cette période de préparation  de la rentrée des classes.  L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux subvenir à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Mr. Insa is 30 years old. He is an unmarried travelling salesman who sells clothing and various other products. He has lived in Senegal for more than 10 years and decided to start his small business. He has been a member of a local branch of U-IMCEC since August 2009. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 Frs in order to buy clothing for resale. His goal is to develop his business during the period when students are preparing to re-enter school. The increase in his profits will allow him to better provide for his societal needs.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is 37-year-old married man, father of three children, who has been working at painting furniture for 27 years. He started early, working since childhood, so he hopes to create the best childhood for his beloved children.

Anwar is a hard-working man; he does his best to improve his living conditions and his family’s at the same time.

Anwar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools and equipment and to continue building his house in a healthy way, to provide a healthy environment for his precious family.

Anwar’s business is doing well; he tries to improve it as much as he can, in order to keep on responding to his family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and equipment.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with 2 children, both of whom go to school.  She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. For the past 7 years she has been selling milk and bread at the market on a retail basis. She sells to all categories of people.  She works seven days a week.  

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more loaves of bread and milk. Her aspirations and goals are to own a milk processing plant and also to build her own rental houses.  Her major business challenges are irregular electricity and transportation. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more milk and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme célibataire qui tient une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires en face de la rouite nationale qui traverse sa localité. Avec les revenus générés par son activité, il participe aux dépenses d'entretien des membres de sa famille.Il arrive à épargner sur ses bénéfices et a ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acherter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre, du savon et d'autres produits divers destinés à la consommation.Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: This borrower is an unmarried man who owns a food-products store located across from the national highway that runs through his area. With the income from his business, he contributes to providing for the needs of his family members. He has been able to save some of his profits and has opened an account with U-IMCEC. He is seeking a loan of 250,000 F to buy rice, oil, sugar, soap, and various other consumer items. His ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, soap, and various other consumer goods.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, is 58 years old, married, and the father of two children who are still in school. A farmer for 17 years, he currently produces maize and vegetables and raises poultry for the local market.

Richard has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimoto to purchase more poultry to boost his business. He says the expansion of the enterprise will generate enough income to provide clothing and feed and educate his children. He notes that the biggest challenge farmers currently face are high production costs compounded by low prices for farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 67-year-old married man.  He has owned a sawmill since 1982, and his business is growing because of his good reputation and the quality of work he provides.  He is a hardworking man who puts his effort into improving his work as much as he can. 
	
Ali has borrowed from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for five consecutive cycles.  All of his previous loans helped a lot in improving his business, and had a positive impact on both his social and financial situations. He is now applying for a new loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new, updated machines and tools necessary to make special designs requested by his customers.  Ali hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can to fulfill all of his customers’ needs and desires.

loans.use: To buy new, updated machines and tools.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells women's garments and children's wear. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more traditional Ugandan dresses and children's wear for the holiday season, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and to improve the quality of life for her family. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the welfare of her children and continue to grow her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase traditional dresses and children's wear.

loans.name: El-Shadaï Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EL-SHADAÏ est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Afiavi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Afiavi est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un certain Karim. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Afiavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Afiavi exerce comme activité depuis six ans, la vente de céréales et de cartes de recharges téléphoniques ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Afiavi vend des boissons. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Afiavi désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Afiavi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EL-SHADAÏ, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The El-Shadaï group is made ​​up of four people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, named Afiavi, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to raise the level of their business activity.

Afiavi is 48 years old and is married to Karim. The couple has three children, all under their care and attending school. The couple lives together with their children, both sharing responsibility for the family's diverse needs.

Afiavi has not attended school. For the past six years her business activity has been to sell grain cereals and phone refill cards, which allows her to support her family without much difficulty. As a side business, Afiavi also sells beverages.

In order to better meet customer requirements, Afiavi wishes to strengthen her product inventory and raise the level of her activities. To do this, Afiavi is requesting (together with the other members of the EL-SHADE group) a third credit loan from ALIDé,

loans.use: Buy grain, beverages and phone card refills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hairstyling equipment.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline is 47 and has been in farming for over 10 years. She produces and sells nappier grass, milk and eggs to the local market and grass to dairy farmers in particular. She clarifies that farming is her sole source of income. 

Caroline has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilmo, 40,000 of which will be used to construct a poultry unit, and the remaining 60,000 of which will be used to purchase more poultry and boost her farming income. She says she wants to be an animal breeder and supply the farmers in the area. 

She notes that weather is very unpredictable and poses the greatest challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Mebra

texts.en:
Mebra is 42 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past three years, Mebra has been working hard to manage her clothing and garment business, which sells women's suits and garments. 

To expand her business, Mebra has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more traditional Ugandan dresses called Gomeses and more party dresses for the Christmas season, and will help Mebra to generate greater profits and to improve her family's welfare. Mebra hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another clothing business at the market center. 

Mebra is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mebra who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase traditional and party dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repay his suppliers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years. Besides farming, she also has a bookshop in the area.  She is 50 years old, married, and has two school-going children with her husband, David.  

Emily was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client; this will be her first loan. She plans to use the money to buy farm inputs and pay for labor on her farm.  In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Yeyssa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de sept enfants.Elle pratique l'élevage traditionnelle depuis son enfance.Après avoir ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC, elle a bénéficié d'un premier crédit pour faire de l'embouche ovine et l'a remboursé entièrement.Elle sollicite un second pret de 250000f pour acheter des moutons qu'elle va engraisser et les revendre sur les marchés locaux.Son ambition est de démarrer l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: This borrower is a married mother of seven children. She has been engaged in traditional animal rearing since her childhood. After having opened an account with UIMCEC, she benefited from her first loan to raise sheep and repaid the loan completely. She is seeking a second loan of 250,000 F to buy sheep that she will fatten and sell at the local markets. Her ambition is to start raising cattle.

loans.use: To buy sheep.
